text: I found the claims process pretty easy. The direct deposit option for reimbursement adds another layer of simplicity. The very first claim took a little longer (a couple of weeks maybe), but once the first claim was processed subsequent claims were processed within a couple of days.
title: Easy claims process!

text: Embrace was with me all the way when my sweet kitty, Ghost, got sick.  They refunded my expenses in a timely manner and made me feel like my Ghost mattered to them.  I selected mailed refunds, which take much longer but I still received my refund within 3 weeks.  If I had opted for Direct Deposit it would have been 2-4 days
title: Embrace was with me all the way

text: Our beagle developed bronchitis and she needed x-rays, blood work, and medication.  I submitted my first invoice and Embrace applied the entire amount to my deductible, which I then met, and reimbursed me for my percentage of the remaining invoice.  The process was quick and painless and I found Embrace to be very fair.
title: Beagle with bronchitis.

text: Insurance is too expensive. It goes up every year and is almost impossible to continue. The well visit plan is not worth the money. You get back what you put in but have to submit receipt the wait for reimbursement just to break even.!
title: Insurance is too expensive

text:
Embrace Pet Insurance settled my claim quickly. It was the first time I’d submitted a claim for my 12 year old dog, Syd.  Syd became very ill. I took him to an emergency veterinary hospital. Several tests were done that showed he would require a very delicate surgery. At his age the prognosis wasn’t good. The made the decision to have him euthanized.

I was told by Embrace that they would need to review Syd’s records for several previous years and that it could take about 30 days for them to determine a payment. I was very pleasantly surprised when I received an email with a very generous settlement within a week!

The people I spoke with were all very kind and considerate. I highly recommend Embrace Pet Insurance.
title: Embrace Pet Insurance is a wonderful company.

text: Embrace has been wonderful.  The claims submission is very easy and the website walks you through each step needed. My puppy didn't have some background information that was needed and they reached out and let me know what they needed and how to get it. Response time is quick and they are available for any questions. Wonderful experiences so far.
title: Embrace has been wonderful

text: Would give 0 stars if possible.  My cat almost passed away in December from acute glomerulonephritis (kidney disease), which had never been previously diagnosed (he is 1 yr old).  Despite this, my claim for his medical expenses was rejected due to the pre-existing condition of a cough that was noted during his kitten wellness exam 10 months prior.  I appealed the decision and my vet provided additional medical records and a statement that the two were in no way related, however my appeal was again denied.  In the past year I filed 3 claims for 3 different pets and every single one was denied.  I have cancelled my very expensive policy for all of my pets and filed a complaint with the California Department of insurance. I would never recommend anyone waste their money on this insurance.
title: Would give 0 stars if possible

text: I have never before had insurance for any of my pets. In the past it was a costly mistake. Our last German Shepherd dog bloated and required immediate surgery costing over 7k dollars. Later, he developed perianal furunculosis, and we lost him shortly after his diagnosis. When my husband and I purchased our new dog we knew immediately we need to purchase insurance just in case! Hoping, of course to never need it. However, that wasn't the case. Recently, our dog had a spell of allergies and required vet care. Then two weeks later he got pretty sick and was vomiting, shaking, and landed us in the ER. With $2000 in unexpected vet bills it was an ouch! I immediately filed both claims with Embrace. The claims went through normal procedure, and I received an email yesterday that both claims have been processed and paid! Thank you, Embrace!! We HOPE to never need anything else but the wellness insurance! We are SO grateful!
title: I have never before had insurance for…

text: I have spent a crap load of money and you have returned a fraction of it from two claims I submitted. A that’s crap! So no I don’t understand why I have insurance if I’m going to end up paying majority of the bill! Useless. My bill was almost 800 to a $1000 for Luca’s ER Visit an you paid me a measly portion of $124 for an unplanned ER visit. Whatever I won’t be renewing. It has to be something better!
title: I have spent a crap load of money and…

text: I am extremely impressed with both the efficiency as well as the customer service and follow up from my claims. I am new to Embrace and they were very helpful and genuinely seemed to care about me and my situation.
title: So impressed….

text: Embrace said they would reimburse me for 2 claims, but the $ not showed up in my account.  I've waited awhile and then was  in contact with Claims Dept., and they said they will report it, and it may take another 15 working days.  This is my first time getting claims after paying Embrace for premiums, and I am disappointed that it is taking so long to get this solved.   It has been over a month that my first claim was granted.
title: Claim money not getting transferred to my account

text: We just had an emergency with our friendship. She got ivdd in her back and that tough surgery immediately we called embrace To get authorized, everything was done within a matter of hours. I had nothing to worry about. And my claim was paid expeditiously. Kudos to embrace for making this less stressful for us
title: We just had an emergency with our…

text: We were dealt with a difficult situation with our dog which resulted in his passing. It all happened so fast. Nonetheless the claim process was fast and easy. It was a simple document upload and I was reimbursed within a few days. They even sent a sympathetic email regarding our loss.
title: We were dealt with a difficult…

text: Terrible experience.  My dog had surgery for a spindle cell sarcoma and they declined my claim because she has had 2 small skin tags in the past one resolved without treatment and the other is on her eyelid, very common and has not changed in 3 years.  Due to small skin tags they are saying she had a preexisting condition.  I am a physician I know this is ridiculous skin tags are common and are totally unrelated to the spindle cell sarcoma that was found and removed within 2 weeks.  I am forced to give one star to post that they dont deserve even that.
title: Terrible experience

text: The representative who helped me was very helpful and courteous. She listened and gave me the time to explain what my question was.
title: Courteous

text: After our dog spent several days in the ER, we were presented with a very large bill. The claim process was extremely easy - used the app to take pictures of the invoice and submit it. It took about three days to get approved and payment was sent. I was skeptical about purchasing “pet insurance” initially but this helped us avoid a big financial hit when we couldn’t really afford it.
title: Worth it

text:
I have a rescue golden retriever. He had been very abused & was very sick when he first arrived . I purchased my Embrace Insurance 3 years ago. I have been lucky, We  haven’t needed it . Recently my boy has been sick. I was worried about how this process would go . It went so smooth . I sent a screen shot of my pups statement .  I received a check within 2 weeks . No hassle , & straight up front . They also suggested if I have a bank on file , they can send an automatic deposit instead of waiting for a paper check . 
Thank you Embrace 🩷🐾
title: I have a rescue golden retriever

text: I called Embrace because they were rated #1 by Forbes. I talked to Brian, who answered all of my questions and concerns after a bad experience with Spot Pet Insurance. We adopted a 4 month old Silver Miniature Poodle 9 months ago. We purchased pet insurance to cover needed vet bills and medicines for our baby. We recently took Sterling to the vet for a heartworm test so we could get our new prescription for Trifexis, which I was expecting to be reimbursed for the test and the 6 month prescription. The vet informed me that there is a new year long shot for heartworms and told us how much it cost and that the shot only prevents heartworms and we would still need flea and tick prevention. We decided to do the heartworm shot and purchased Bravecto for fleas and ticks for 3 months for each application. When I sent my claim in to Spot, they approved $25 for all treatment (Test was $41, Heartworm Shot was $107 and 3 month prevention for Fleas and Ticks (Bravecto) was $75.70, $223.70 Total). They said they only cover $25 per year for heartworm tests, prevention and flea and tick prevention. $25 for the year!! I questioned this and they told me it was on page 10 of the contract. I searched with them on the phone to find it on the last page of the contract (Page 21) after the name and address of the company that carries the policy, not Page 10. It is hidden at the end on the very last page! I immediately canceled my policy with them and ended on the phone with Brian with Embrace! Brian was very professional and knowledgeable about the insurance policy and what I needed for the coverage I was interested in. I told him I wanted to talk to my husband before I actually made a decision about coverage. He told me he could call me back at noon the next day, which was a Saturday. He called at exactly noon and signed me up. I feel confident that things will go much better with Embrace instead of Spot who hides things in their policies!!
title: I feel my furbaby, Sterling, will be covered for needed things!

text: the claims filing process was easy and efficient through the online site by answering a few questions and uploading documents, including receipt and updates with a timely turnaround. thank you!
title: the claims filing process was easy and…

text: First of all finding insurance for your pet is a full time job. So many companies to choose from, but finding the one right for your unique pet and situation takes time. I have to say that Katherine with Embrace was very helpful in giving me information that I needed in order to make the correct choice. She was clear in the information and made no false promises. It was refreshing to just receive the facts and no fluff to make me choose right then. I felt if I needed more time it wasn't a problem.
title: Clear and informative

text: I purchased this policy for my pet and every claim I submitted it was denied and sent a preexisting explanation.  Example: if your pet has a little buildup on a tooth they will call this dental disease and its NOT!  Unless you start your pet out as a puppy or kitten, its definitely not worth giving your money away and you are basically donating to the company.  I would recommend starting a savings account for your pet and place what you pay for a premium in that account vs. making payments to Embrace.  Do your research there is several complaints online and people had a similar experience.  It seems the last year they have been denying more claims, which makes you question a company's ethical practices.  Do your homework if you feel you truly need pet insurance.  Even veterinarian offices don't really recommend the insurance because they see this happen constantly.
title: Dont waste your money

text: They are quick to settle my claims and are super nice to deal with. I always recommend Embrace to all my friends and family.
title: They are quick to settle my claims and…

text:
I have been informed that if my dog, Willow, has cancer, her treatment will not be covered. Your reasoning is based on the fact that when the doctor looked at her "lumps", he determined they were only sebaceus cysts and no biopsy was required.  I would think your company would defer to a doctor's expertise in determining when a biopsy is not warranted. In fact, one cyst was removed recently and it was just a cyst; no cancer. And Embrace would not pay for it.
I will not subject my dogs to unnecessary medical procedures, especially when the doctor knows they are not warranted. I would think that would be your position, as well.
title: I have been informed that if my dog

Submitting claims through their app has made the whole process so easy. I tell everyone that pet insurance is important to sign up for as soon as they get a dog. Of course, I recommend Embrace to them and a number of friends have done so!

text: We had been with them for several years, then they went to renew our policy with over a 100% upcharge, when we have made NO claims on the policy. I could understand a 20-30% INCREASE, BUT OVER 100% INCREASE...not someone I want to do business with anymore.
title: We had been with them for several…

text: Using Embrace couldn't be easier! The app and webpage make submitting a claim super easy. Every claim I've submitted has been at least partially covered and I get feedback on my claims super fast, usually the same day. It makes me wish my own health insurance worked the same, feels like how insurance should work!
title: Using Embrace couldn't be easier!

text:
It has been 2 years of frustration, follow up, runaround, and non-payment with this company. Our dog has literally been enrolled with Embrace since 9 weeks of age. The first year we did the wellness plan and the work we had to do just to save $25 was ridiculous!! our vet submitted to them all the required proof of health and orthopedic wellness. But this apparently was useless. We had to repeatedly call in order to get any of our wellness visits paid. Anyhow, 2 years later and We had an emergency come up with our dog that cost $2800 due to something our dog ate. Yet they are refusing to reimburse us because (according to THEM) they need to verify that this was not a pre-existing condition. What?!? So  I called and spoke with a rep and had her tell me word for word what I needed to email my vet and request them to send. The vet sent everything they asked. But Because our dog has never had anything other than vaccines and wellness visits, there are no extensive notes. So Embrace says their notes are insufficient. Now, instead of needing notes from the first 3 months of his insured period, they now need all of our dog’s info from June of 2021 to NOW. Our dog was not even born until September of 2021!! So apparently, they want to find something - ANYTHING - as a way to not pay. They also seem to want to tell my vet how to take notes. 
At this point, it’s not even about money. It’s about how much this company has wasted my vet’s and my time. Save yourself the aggravation. Go with someone else.
title: Their plan is to FIND a pre-existing condition

text: Thankfully I cancel on time my dog is only 4 months and they have been review documents for ever. While I understand their policy. Is to complicated for me and I don’t have time for that and she already have another insurance which is better and already review her pre existing condition. I don’t recommend embrace.

text: I purchased both Wellness and Illness coverage for my 2 cats. Two months later, after manually providing all the vet records requested, they were still requesting records before claims could be processed. They insisted my cat saw a vet he never saw. They pulled out terms from the records and misdiagnosed conditions, such as "dilated pupils", calling them pre-existing conditions. These had nothing to do with any of the claims, which were for simple things like ear infections and teeth cleaning. Only one claim was ever approved. In the end, I found it more cost effective to save the $169 month rather than pay Embrace for no services at all. I cancelled the policy. However Embrace did not stop. They continued to bill me and contact my vets asking for medical records (which had already been provided). After three phone calls, I hope this stops, but the last call was this week. I told them I will file a BBB complaint if this continues.
title: I purchased both Wellness and Illness…

Note: my pet had no preexisting or any illnesses. 
I’m now shopping for a different company.

title: This was one of the worst experiences…

text: Thank you for such an easy process and assistance when necessary.
title: Thank you for such an easy process and…

text:
A month after I enrolled in Embrace Pet Insurance, my 7 year old cat developed a cough, so I took her into the vet. The vet performed an x-ray and determined my cat had bronchitis and prescribed medication to treat it. They additionally performed blood work as it had been a while since checking her levels. In total, I had two separate vet bills totaling over $400. 

I submit two claims to Embrace, one for each invoice, and they were both denied on the reason my cat had a "pre-existing condition". The "condition" was the fact that she vomited 8 months prior to her vet visit (as cats tend to vomit), completely unrelated to the development of bronchitis. This vomit incident was included in the onboarding information Embrace received from my vet. I submit an appeal to the denial and they said after reaching out to my vet, they were declining my appeal. I spoke with my vet, who reported Embrace never reached out to them. They also provided a letter stating the one vomit incident months prior to the appointment had no bearing on the bronchitis diagnosis. My second claim was ALSO denied for the SAME reason. When I appealed it, they simply deleted the claim.

I tried calling Embrace to speak with a human rather than the weeks long email process, but after being on hold for two hours I was disconnected.

Do NOT interact with this company unless you are insuring a newborn pet. They will find any reason to deny your claims. They provided me with zero service after taking my money for months. They also will not allow you change any account information online, it must be done over the phone after you sit on hold for an egregious amount of time.
title: Will deny claims without reason

text: I love Embrace Pet Insurance!  The app is easy to use and claims are completed quickly.  Their customer service is fast and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend them!
title: I love Embrace Pet Insurance

text:
I had to provide documents from 4 years ago from two different vet clinics for medical history. Embrace told me that they had requested these documents from the clinics for months but it was clearly a lie. I had to do it my self, ridiculous. Afterwards, my claim took about a month and a half to be processed before I got a refund. The only reason I received a refund was because I fought long and hard against them, even providing x rays, because they claimed “pre-existing condition” over a skin mass that was found 3 years prior. 

But the real reason we cancelled our policy was because after a year of owning the policy, Embrace decided to increase our premiums by 50%! Stating that because our dog was 1 year older (13yo), inflation, and costs in my area this justified such a large price increase.

I highly discourage anyone getting pet insurance. Save a little money each month and invest it. This option is significantly better than giving your money and your time to these insurance companies. They created more stress for me during a time of need. I cancelled and will not be looking back.
title: I hated the entire experience!

text: They will increase your premiums 30+% Every Year, Year over Year regardless of your pet's age or if they have had any illnesses. By the time I finally cancelled, my 4 year old german shepherd's premium was More expensive than my own health insurance and we Never Used our coverage for a single medical issue. If this were human insurance these rates would be illegal. This is essentially a scam for well-meaning rich people. I would just keep a credit card handy for big vet bills and skip the scam. As a former vet tech, I can tell you that an average emergency vet visit with bloodwork, xrays, and IV therapy/medications to go home will run about $5-800, even with 'low' deductible (and high premium) plan options, you would pay a $500 deductible, plus 10% on top of that, so even with an $800 bill you're still paying $600 of that bill, and unless your pet has Multiple emergency visits or serious surgery in a plan year, you're basically paying $1,000 for a $200 discount, if you use the insurance at all. Don't need to be an accountant to figure that one out. This is just another corporate squeeze to siphon money off of the middle class. Save your money, please.
title: They will increase your premiums 30+%…

text: New Customers, BE AWARE!! Rates went up 40% at first year renewal. No details to why, just that they see this increase every year and it happened to all customers! Which is BS, because you go online and the rates didn’t increase for new customers. Isn’t insurance regulated like regular health insurance? Embrace does this, while other carriers follow state guidelines which can only raise their rates if they do it for all.
title: Be Aware 40% increase every year

text: I’ve been a customer for several years. They always cover my dog’s regular needs, but when she needed something bigger that’s when Embrace really saved the day. text: I signed up with Embrace based on generally good reviews and have been deeply disappointed. I've had two minor claims so far, both of which, after much back-and-forth and repeatedly asking for the same paperwork, were denied claiming "pre-existing conditions." This was patently not true -- for instance, I had an emergency visit because the cat was constipated, they cited "lack of appetite" as a pre-existing condition, which did not relate to the vet's diagnosis at all. I will have to terminate this policy and I really wish I had signed up with something else.

text:
I started my policy with Embrace when my pup was 8 weeks old. He is now going to be covered for his 3rd year and my premium increased by 52% ($96 to $146 per month!) mind you all he has had aside from regular wellness checkups is an ear infection and a questionable lump. The reps are friendly and knowledgeable but at this rate, I will be priced out in 2 years. 
I don't buy the info they provided of it being based on the dog's age, policy tenure and inflation in the area. Maybe that's how they make their money though? They provide a great price to newcomers and price out those with tenure after the rates become ridiculous. I'm not interested in downgrading my coverage but I am also not interested in pay 50%+ extra each year. Reasonable increases are expected but this is insane.

text:
The main issue was that they needed further information from one of the vets we attended. They weren’t making an effort to get it, and asked for my assistance for the info, but neither the online portal, nor the email request had info regarding which vet or what information they needed.

After 3 phone calls with embrace I was able to figure out what they needed, and get it from the provider (which was very easy) and had them send it to me and Embrace, which I’m glad I did. I also forwarded the info and got email notification of receipt.

One month later I get an email saying they never received it, so I get on the phone with a fourth rep, and have them put me in touch with an adjuster. Suzanne was great and got it figured out immediately.

There’s just so many things wrong it’s hard to make any meaningful criticisms… but Suzanne was awesome, so two stars.

text:
They said my dog was anxious and nervous, and was prescribed Trazadone, but Cassie Jane has NEVER taken trazedone, nor was it ever prescribed for her. I have owned her since last May! It is almost a YEAR! She has NOT taken TRAZEDONE, EVER,  and she is as sweet and laid back as a dog could possibly be, with people!!! She was nervous on her first visit to the vet as she was just rescued the day before (after being in boarding in a cage for 3 +  months) and was ill with food poisoning and worms. Their policy is a scam! It took from January until now for a medical review to be held when I submitted everything to the person who sold me the policy, before I took out the POLICY! Her name was Katie. Embrace waited until 3 months after the cancelation refund deadline to review her files!

FOREWARNED IS FOR-ARMED!!!!
DO NOT PURCHASE EMBRACE PET INSURANCE!!! I am about to report them to the BBB! Cassie Jane,my rescue dog, had worms and food poisoning when I rescued her, and I got $2000 bill from the Emergency room where I had to take her for projectile diarrhea and vomiting the day after I got her. Insurance said it is a preexisting condition so they won't cover ANY  vomiting or diarrhea for a period of ONE YEAR....AAAND, if she vomits or gets diarrhea again, before that one year period, it will not be covered and will be considered pre existing!!! WTAF???? What dog never vomits or gets diarrhea???? It was caused by food poisoning and worms!!!! I am so angry I am fit to be tied. I sent Cassie Jane's records in JANUARY! There is a 30 day cancelation refund but despite me calling them over and over, they dragged out her review for the records 3 1/2 months until I could no longer get a refund and paid them almost $400!
DO NOT GET EMBRACE PET INSURANCE! BAD BAD BAD- WORSE THAN BAD!

text:
The good: super easy claims process and quick payment.

The bad: be REALLY careful that you know everything about your pet's medical history before signing up. I didn't know that when my dog had a tooth pulled, the vet found a small growth called an epuli (it's a common, benign growth in dog's mouths). Embrace saw that in my dog's medical records from over a year prior, and said that without a biopsy to confirm it was benign, they'd consider ALL growths, including cancer, a pre-existing condition. I obviously could not get a biopsy on something removed over a year ago. I canceled and got a pro-rated refund for the rest of the policy because it just didn't seem worth it to have such a large exclusion.
title: The good and the bad

text: I had the policy for 5 years and accepting the 40% increase per year. The last straw was I moved across town (going to the same vet) and they claimed they had to increase my policy another 30%. So my policy basically doubled in price. Please do the math before you sign up for this scam. My premium per year would be around $900 and the related deductible is $750, so my out of pocket expense is $1,650. I might as well just pay the $1,650 directly to the vet. And remember depending on your plan not everything will be covered so you’d have to pay excessively to Embrace and then still need to compensate your vet. Over the course of five years I made ONE claim and it didn’t even exceed the deductible. It was the biggest rip off of my life. Please think twice before you sign up.

When it raised the first time they said that was a rare increase due to rising vet costs and not at all typical and then the next year it’s raised even more!! Our dog is only 3 years old and is not a pure breed that might have genetic issues. We have not moved locations. Why would we pay $84 a month for our healthy 3 year old dog? STAY AWAY! Just set aside money for your pet in case something happens.

text:
I am a brand new client and to the world of pet insurance. After purchasing a new puppy I wanted to get insurance since my last pup went through expensive arthritis and cancer issues her last couple years.

So far a terrible experience with Embrace since February 1. Filled out all the paperwork including vet medical history.

My vet filled out and signed the orthopedic report.

There are zero issues health wise with my pup, but Embrace continues to reject the paperwork.

They are requiring revised paperwork and an additional office visit at my expense just to satisfy their needs.

Claims department sent a nasty email stating we are at a standstill with coverage even though I have no claims. 

Their customer service department keeps transferring me to other departments only to get disconnected and having to start all over again with my story and required follow up.

I’ve invested many stressful hours only to have them come back weeks later saying the forms sent in will not suffice.

They promised to call my vet and request them to print out a revised medical history only to find out they did not follow up.

It just should not be this difficult to get pet insurance for a young pup and unacceptable that I paid in advance over $1,000 only to find out he is not covered.

Considering cancelling and moving to another company. They are also closed weekends.

Embrace-You need to treat your customers better!

text: When I first got my dog over two years ago I got embrace the exact same day. They said I had a 6 month waiting period and I needed to get a vet visit within two weeks to make sure he was healthy. I did that and I sent it in. Then in NOVEMBER 2023 I submit our first emergency claim. Embrace refused to process it because they needed ALL medical records since I “never visited the vet after getting the policy” I told them I did and I sent in all the paperwork and it even said in the doctors note that this visit was for insurance and then they magically said they found it and they would process my claim. They still didn’t and wouldn’t until I got the records from when he was 8 weeks old and still belonged to the breeder. Almost a month later they finally reimbursed me. Three months to process one claim? That was unbelievable and everyone else I have talked to about other companies said their claims were always processed in a couple of days. I was just very disappointed by their lack of professionalism and how they handle business.

text:
From my experience they will do whatever it takes to avoid covering what they should, no matter how small. Wasted hours on the phone talking to people lying about words I'm reading in their emails. 

They will ignore what the vet writes and manufacture their own diagnosis that is literally the opposite of what the vet said. They will intentionally misinterpret statements to fit whatever narrative they want. 

From what I can tell, they're simply a scam.

Deeply regret giving this company any money.

Edit: Embrace's reply to my comment: "We want to be upfront about our coverage and the exclusion of pre-existing conditions which is defined and agreed upon in our terms and conditions as"

What they DON'T TELL YOU is if you take your pet in for something that is covered, like an injury, and it shares one single SYMPTOM with something that is excluded, EMBRACE will diagnose your pet with a condition that is not covered. In my case their diagnosis was the exact opposite of what the vet listed.

If your pet cuts their paw and limps temporarily as a result, they can and will claim it's a skeletal or muscular condition. This means for the rest of your pet's life they will not be covered for any condition that could cause a limp.


Hopefully final edit: I wonder how many of the "unqualified 8%" of claims were qualified until Embrace put on their doctor's hat and fabricated a diagnosis from thin air? When they got tired of lying about my dog's diagnosis they smugly said that if the dog wasn't lame, then they couldn't cover the vet visit anyway, since it was a healthy dog! Not realizing what they'd just admitted to, I jumped at the chance.  

I told them sure, I'd gladly pay for the visit if it meant they couldn't use it against her for the rest of her life! They then went into backtrack mode immediately. Cancelled my policy. This company is disgusting. For the first time in my life I am disappointed in USAA for recommending these predators to me.
title: Untrustworthy and Obnoxious

text:
I am looking for pet insurance, but after reading the reviews of Embrace, I will keep looking. 
Embrace doesn't seem very trustworthy.  
First of all, the 5 star reviews for this company look like fakes. All very similar in their descriptions and always only one or two sentences.  
The website already states that: "Due to high call volume, there may be longer wait times."
Unbelievable, they know that the customer will have to wait longer and instead of changing that, they just inform the customers. So, now you know, take it. 
And apparently you can only reach them by phone?!??
NO e-mail address? Companies without an email address are very suspicious, and there is a reason not to provide an email address. This makes it very difficult to prove anything later. The customer has no proof that they contacted the company.
One-time administration fee: $25.00
What do you have to pay $25 for ....? 
Customers should charge the company for completing the application. 

Answer for Embrace regarding your e-Mail address:
[Quote]Customer Care

Monday – Friday: 9 am – 8 pm ET

Saturday: 10 am – 2 pm ET

Phone: (855) 540-2104 Due to high call volume, longer hold times can occur.

Fax: (800) 238-1042 [/Quote]

I don't see any e-mail address under contact. 
And this is the right place for an email address and not hidden somewhere or only via app?

Answer regarding $25 fee:
[Quote]We charge a one-time $25 administrative, or activation, fee when a policy begins. This fee covers administration costs for starting a new policy and setting up recurring billing.
[/Quote]
If a company starts with a fee, what fees does the customer have to pay later? Complaint fees? Filing fees? Advertisement fees? it a Sunday fee? It's not a Sunday fee? 
In the US, too many companies are very inventive when it comes to fees.

text:
On 1/31/24, I submitted 4 claims for my dog.  One claim was handled correctly.  One was mishandled.  Two were automatically denied as duplicates, which they weren't.  In addition, a new claim was created inappropriately for services I never claimed.  To address all these problems, I had to call Embrace four separate times.  Each time, the Customer Service Representative (CSR) was knowledgeable and helpful.  What I realized was that the automated systems in place work very poorly.
Specifically, the automated system cannot handle documentation for more that one Date of Service at a time.  That is fine.  However, the instructions should be clear for owners to include documentation for only one Date of Service at a time.
Drontal Plus is typically a preventive medication. However, my dog was on it for treatment purposes.  My claim was initially denied automatically because Drontal Plus was the medication used. I supplied appropriate documentation to justify that Drontal Plus was being used as a treatment.  I had to call to request an adjustor read the documentation.  I should not have to do that.
I had two claims for Drontal Plus denied, despite providing documentation that is was used as a treatment medication.  After I called to request the first claim be approved, it was.  However, the second claim was automatically denied. I had to call again to ask an adjustor to review the second claim, even though a virtually identical claim had just been approved.
My suggestion is to have qualified human adjustor review the cases until the automatic processes are accurate.  At this point in time, the automatic processes are highly inaccurate.
title: Automate Review Process Highly Inaccurate

text:
My honest review on Embrace over all would have to be a 3. I feel that generous due to the fact of the customer service and how the company overall can say a pet would have a condition that is considered by them as existing. I do feel if a veterinarian can state and even offered to send whatever he needed to confirm that my dog didn’t have any preexisting issues on something I shouldn’t be punished for that. I’m being told by your company whether that be with your customer service or whom that my dog had preexisting dental issue as well as eye issues etc. she hasn’t had any problems they thought possibly she may be having some allergy issues but they weren’t positive. So in result we decided we would try some things and see who she does. I was okay with the fact we started those before I went with Embrace. However, I feel after so long of not doing those things, I should be able to have that reviewed. Also, what’s being told to be a preexisting condition with her eyes, wasn’t and due to a scratch from a neighboring dog she happens to play with was the cause. However, I said I would do a surgery for her for that and I would pay completely. The dr stated she wouldn’t any longer have any problems with that after that, so when I stated what he said and he was willing to speak with anyone or send a letter whatever needed to provide that she wouldn’t any long have any issues with that problem…I call explain what he stated feeling after this was done we shouldn’t have any issues with anything else as for as eyes that could happen later down the road as for insurance wise, I’m told by Embrace once again that they will have no part anything with the eyes. So basically…at this time I feel like what am I even paying for?? Definitely nothing that helps when it comes to vet bills! So I would state caution on anyone considering….
Thank you! 
Lene’ Gant
title: Over all honest review

text:
Just know that they will say everything is pre-existing even on a six month old puppy and really what are you going to do about it? My own vet wrote them a letter, and still they dug their heels in. He died having seizures and couldnt stop the first ones we had ever seen as he was a puppy and he died that way..with no help from them.  I spent 5k trying to save him over a three day ER period in Austin TX  He had a seizure that wouldnt end, suddenly at 3am.  It was covered.  They said somehow he was pre-existing? Even though all the vets and i said otherwise and all the records too...I mean he just was born a few months prior,  vets said this as well and we appealled...so disrespectful to my boy Waylon my love of a chocolate shih tzu.  My world.    To deny the whole thing, not one single thing did they cover.  Lame, misleading.  Expensive, devastating.  Lame.   Boggles the brain, seems shady.   Can you afford to hire a team of lawyers?  My vet and all their techs avoid this company now too based on what happened.  They didnt pay one red penny.  Thinking it was covered, I am now stuck with thousands to pay.  So I will tell thousands of people and it will be better this way.  I would rather know upfront so I switched to Lemonade and have Care Credit line for urgent issues with a better rate on repayment than embrace as well.  Its going much better.  Make sure  you understand insurance, its not a guarantee at all. That handy little pre-existing loophole they love to jump through it and can pretty much stuff anything into it as a category and as I said what would you be willing to do about it?  How much do you want to spend?   I tell all my clients and all my owners this story. Show all the records,  spread the word so other people dont get taken advantage of.  Dont choose Embrace.  I wish there was a way to block their corporate babble canned food response to this review.  I  think however, the truth can be felt, sensed even on this review...and this consoles me.  
 Lemonade, Chewy and a few others are wonderful. Put your confidence into a better place than Embrace. (In honor of Waylon Brisket Jennings we miss you buddy)
title: BUYER BEWARE choose a better company

text:
Insurance specialists seem poorly organized and not good at what they do, imho. (Maybe they are just overworked.) 

These are my following true experiences with them:
1. Insurance Specialist updated a claim 9 days after their initial document request that the claim was “pending request documentation delivery.” However, the vet sent it the same day they requested 7 9 days prior. The hospital forward me the email and send me the notes in case they still hadn’t receive them. Worse part was that day I had just spoken to someone at Embrace and they said they hadn’t received anything which is why my case was still pending. This urged me to call the vet’s office. 
2. My pet is a puppy. Mind you, we have gone to the vet mostly for routine care. Embrace had already requested all files pertaining to my fur baby. Yet, when I submitted a claim for an infection they requested all S.O.A.P notes because they have come to the realization that additional information was needed. This time it took them 21 days to realize they didn’t have all the files needed in order to process my claim. Once again, I go to my vets office and they showed me they had already send the requested documents.  
3. Embrace specialists also only handles one claim at a time, even if multiples have been submitted. 
4. In one of my claims, they sent the file request to an emergency hospital instead of my normal vet where the service occurred. When I called to find out the reason for this, they said all files need to be accessible in order to process the claim. We had gone once to this emergency hospital and it was for foreign object treatment. There’s no more notes from this hospital. Also, we submitted this claim so you already have the notes. A serious case of the left hand does not talk to the right. 
6. I’m still waiting refund for the one illness infection my puppy have because they are still “reviewing” my case. They said it’s only the first illness that will take a while - approximately 30 business days, however I’m still awaiting that first and only illness refunds. 

Overall, they are just okay in my book. I wish I would have made more research in Nextdoor for real feedback instead of potentially biased websites recommendations. Trupanion seems to be better at handling their cases as well as coverage. A little more expensive but worth it!
title: Poorly Organization or Perhaps Overworked Specialists

text: Unfortunately I have not had good experiences with Embrace and will not be using them for future pets. They take an incredibly long time to process claims, sometimes a month or longer, and getting them to cover issues is a battle. They initially tried to deny any cancer coverage because my dog had an abscess prior to coverage starting. Despite visit notes stating it was an abscess, we had to get the vet involved to further prove it. They also tried to deny coverage for hepatic lipidosis from bacterial infection due to a history of thrombocytopenia. Despite having my vet submit an appeal letter, we are going on two months without resolution for the first claim relating to this issue. Finally, they are now also denying claims for soft tissue injuries due to a history of spondylosis. Basically, Embrace will do everything in their power to not cover claims and make it an incredible hassle to fight with them about it, dragging claims out for months I think in the hopes that owners will simply give up.
title: Refusal to cover valid claims, excessive wait times on claim resolution

text:
This company is just like every other insurance. They will use every excuse they can find to NOT cover a condition. My dog threw up ONCE in 2023 and they used that to not cover all GI issues he ever experiences until 2025. Well throwing up isn't a condition; it's a symptom of MANY conditions. And when my dog then had pancreatitis for the first time ever, they used something totally unrelated to deny $3,000 worth of claims.  Additionally, they don't actually tell you what all of the absurd things they're excluding are unless you specifically ask them to OR you file a claim-- so you spend months and months paying for a premium for a policy that turns out to be useless.
------------ 
Responding to Embrace's response:

I would like to just point out that if my complaint is that you hide behind legalease rather than genuinely communicating what a customer's policy is...

And your response to that is to hide behind more legalease, you're proving my point. 

Furthermore, my dog throwing up one time is not a pre-existing, underlying condition. It is an isolated symptom of something that has long since stopped.  Not only is it in no way related to him experiencing acute pancreatitis long after my policy's waiting period, it is a gross misrepresentation of his medical history to exclude ALL future GI related issues based on an extremely common symptom that is applicable to many condtions.
title: Use legalease to exclude huge swaths of conditions

text:
I'm grateful to have pet insurance 
The positives are that they recognize holistic care. Acupuncture is allowed. 
My beloved husky mix Bella developed hermangiosarcoma in 2019. Her spleen ruptured. The ER recommended euthanizating her. Without 
Embrace I would not have been able to pay for the emergency splenectomy. I would have had to put her down. Bella ended up living three plus years post diagnosis. Embrace's policy allowed for eastern and western medical care which I believe had a lot to do with her longevity.
The negatives are that Embrace was more user friendly when I first signed my dogs up. Things have gotten more complicated. My guess is that they are using ai for interfacing. I have two geriatric dogs that take the same meds monthly. For some reason there is a lot of pushback on these claims. 
The biggest issue I have is that the website is slow. It makes filing claims extremely time consuming. I've complained about this to Embrace. Nothing has been done about it.

All they told me was that since my dog hasn’t had any issues my deductible is at a lower price and that my insurance was more expensive because he has gotten older. Okaaay?? Anyways, I switched to another pet insurance got Accident and Illness coverage AND a package that also covers vaccines and dental all for $34!!! text:
Terrible Experience with Embrace - Strongly Advised Against

I am writing this review to share my extremely disappointing experience with Embrace. My interaction with them has been characterized by a questionable appeals process, selective use of information, and a blatant disregard for the evidence I provided.

One of the major issues I encountered was their appeals process, which seemed designed to be deliberately convoluted and unhelpful. Despite presenting solid evidence disputing their claim of a pre-existing condition in my pet, they continued to ignore the facts. Our initial vet misdiagnosed the condition, and we sought a second opinion that confirmed the error. However, Embrace persistently refused to acknowledge the correct diagnosis.
It became evident that the adjusters and underwriters selectively choose certain verbiage to suit their agenda of avoiding claim payouts. During my interactions with them, I was appalled to hear an adjuster suggest that I personally go back to the first vet for more information if I wanted to appeal again. This is not only unprofessional but completely absurd, as it is their responsibility to thoroughly investigate claims.

Furthermore, the company relies on policy terms and conditions, specifically #32 regarding pre-existing conditions, to justify their actions. However, it is crucial to note that our vet only officially diagnosed our dog after the policy was purchased. This fact seems conveniently overlooked, highlighting their unwillingness to consider the timeline of events and putting their profit over customer satisfaction.

In my pursuit of a fair resolution, I requested the cancellation of my policy. It is clear that Embrace prioritizes financial gain over ethical practices and customer welfare. I echo the sentiments of another reviewer who suggested that the company should employ vet techs. Ironically, one of our adjusters was a former vet tech, and this did not result in a more compassionate or customer-oriented approach.

In conclusion, I strongly caution against choosing Embrace for your pet insurance needs. Their unscrupulous tactics, disregard for evidence, and lack of customer-centric values make them an unreliable and unethical choice. I encourage pet owners to explore alternative options with more reputable and ethical pet insurance providers.

*edit since they responded*: I am no longer in contact with anyone from their company since I cancelled my policy since they have refused to review the appeal in its entirety. They claim they “ultimately go off medical records” during the claims and appeals process. I will reiterate in my review above that they have disregarded the misdiagnoses as well as  the appeal letter from the doctor. Do better.
title: Terrible Experience with Embrace

text:
For the past year we have been extremely happy with our Embrace Pet Insurance. As a family with six cats, we were impressed with how quickly Embrace responded to emergencies once the initial claim is processed. When our beloved cat Rutabaga died, we were reimbursed nearly $9,000 of what turned out to be his end of life coverage fairly rapidly. 
Unfortunately, our experience renewing our insurance has not been similarly pleasant. We were shocked to find our policy had increased from $80 to $113 per month for 5 cats. The only claim we made (that was covered) was Rutabaga's inoperable tumor.
We have spoken to customer service twice about this, and no one was receptive to our complaint – probably because it is obvious that we’d be on the hook for new pre-existing conditions if we were to change insurance providers. We strongly recommend thinking carefully about who you get your pet insurance from. The last thing we expected was our other cats’ premiums would increase so much after losing our Rutabaga.
title: Our cat died and they increased our premium 40%

text:
So far we have been extremely happy with Embrace. This year it was almost $2,000 to renew our policy with a $300 deductible. I submitted a claim for my dog for a very bad hot spot that wasn’t healing. They wouldn’t cover a medication the vet prescribed saying it wasn’t FDA approved.. $44 they charged me for a well benefit which it was for a hot spot.. Not sure why our veterinary staff prescribed a medication not 
FDA  approved but will find out.. The mouse in question is CeraSoothe CHX+KET., Embrace wouldn’t cover this, said it is well care when it wasn’t.. Bad hot spot.. they wouldn’t cover it at all.. So now I guess I have to ask my veterinarian from now on if something is FDA approved to be covered.. kinda ridiculous
I spoke to two representatives to figure this out.. mostly we are satisfied with Embrace, honestly this is the first thing we’ve come across that wasn’t covered.
title: So far we have been extremely happy…

text: In the 6 years I have had this policy my premiums went from$80 per month to $234 per month. That is huge and unaffordable for most. It was my understanding that rates were not increased due to the age of the dog or usage. I have already raised my deductible and lowered coverage, if I do that anymore , it would not make sense to have insurance. Unfortunately, we live with this from all insurance companies. We pay through the nose to protect our health and belongings and are subject to rate hikes and claims being denied across the board. In most states, insurance commissions side with the company rather than the consumer. Embrace, you can do better. One simple thing you can do is let people know upfront what your annual rate increases generally run. There’s a lot of competition out there. I thought I did my homework before purchasing, but sadly I must have missed something. This and huge increases in veterinary care are making pet ownership unaffordable. Someone should do research on how this is affecting rescue and euthanasia. My husband tells me this has to be my last dog.
title: Huge premium increasesIn the 6 years I have had this policy…

I find it unconscionable that beneficial procedures such as shock wave and electro-acupuncture are denied. My state allows 30% increase yearly and Embrace has raised by that amount each time the policy renews. I’ve had to increase deductibles and decrease coverage in order to afford the insurance. I pay more for it than I do my own insurance! On the upside, claims are processed quickly and the employees are pleasant to deal with. I, however, will change to another insurer with my next dog. Trupanion has a wonderful reputation within my dog breed. I will look seriously at that company.

title: Having Embrace pet insurance gives me peace of mind.

text:
So I'll say that Embrace did send an email asking us to rate our experience. They did not ask me to give them a specific number or promise anything in return. Normally I'm very resistant to doing reviews that have been requested, but I think I owe it to Embrace to do so.

Our 2 year old cat began declining quickly in December 2023. We had both our cats insured by Embrace since we got them, thinking that maybe this will be useful when they are old. We poured over our terms and conditions, making sure that all these tests were covered, but we waited anxiously, expecting the rug to be pulled out from under us.

And...it wasn't. They covered exactly what they said, and did so quickly, even for a first claim. They probably saved my boy's life because I'm not sure we could have started the right treatment in time with the tests we could have afforded out of pocket.

Now we have a cat that we can treat, and he will hopefully live a long life thanks to Embrace.
title: Rare Company Gives You Exactly What They Advertise

text: So far amazing. They actually reimburse us and submitting claims is easy.
title: So far amazing

text:
Embrace has allowed my wife and I to pursue expensive treatments for our pets that gave us peace of mind and, in one case, added years to a life. We've never had a claim rejected over 7 years time across three pets, and several claims totaling tens of thousands of dollars in reimbursements. We've had claim follow-up questions and requests for further documentation, but never a denial.

We had an 11 year old Lab suddenly grow gravely ill. All of his tests and procedures were covered. We had a 16 year old cat who was diagnosed with both diabetes and intestinal cancer under Embrace. Everything was covered, including measures costing thousands that added over two years to his life. We just had an otherwise healthy 14 year old cat pass from an agressive oral cancer just 6 weeks after diagnosis. Embrace covered her biopsy, tooth removal, meds (we have the medication add-on), follow-up visits, and what many still consider an experimental medication that likely doubled the time she had left. Embrace never even flinched...all covered.

I get that some folks may say negative things about any company based on frustration or having a claim denied for some reason, but our experience with Embrace has lightened the burden that sometimes comes with pet ownership. I watched my parents struggle with taking a gamble saving an elderly pet at the expense of our summer vacation (it worked and the dog lived another three years). I don't have to worry about that because of Embrace and that's a wonderful thing.
title: Embrace has taken the financial factor out of emergency medical care for my pets

text:
Very efficient at processing and denying claims. Elevated liver values 1.5 years ago, which are now normal, were used to deny issues related to masses on the spleen diagnosed by elevated anemia (which were normal on the same blood test as the liver).  They are unfortunately like so many pet insurers…not worth the money you pay them. You are better off with a savings account than wasting your money and deluding yourself into believing they care about you or your pets. No number of cute pictures can cover up the fact that they don’t pay claims. Period.

My Vet has written a detailed explanation appealing the coverage and yet another denial, at least time only partial, to the visits that occurred in this day. These are large claims totally close to 10k.  Buyer beware. Maybe they will have an experienced person review the claim and make the right decision but if your pet has been in for ANYTHING they will claim that it is related. Liver values to cancer (not found in the liver) as an example.
title: Very efficient at processing and…

text:
To make it short, Do not buy this pet insurance. We got this for our puppy, whom of course you hope your puppy is healthy , but with enrolling, they put you into a area of hold,(if you will) while the puppy is processed and checked through with vet records. While this was occurring by pup got a limp/knee buckle at 4 months. So, I get him checked  and our vet saw nothing wrong. So I asked for a referral to a specialist, 2 week wait, and she tells me my puppy he has elbow dysplasia. Well, I want a second opinion and we went to that appt., and they determined the same diagnosis and that a bi-lateral arthroscope surgery would be best. We agree to the surgery and then the 4-6 weeks of restricted rest. During this time I send in his claims from ALL vets. They tell my upon reviewing the records, that because he had "a limp" this is a pre-existing condition and they will NOT cover any of the expense. So, I should let you know, if you get a puppy and you hope for a good pet insurance, this is not for you!!! How was I to know this puppy had genetics that were bad with elbow dysplasia? Both parents showed no signs, nor  in their lineage either. But it happened and this puppy is loved and cared for and we now have a pup with a life long condition without any insurance. This puppy was only 4 months old when I discovered his limp, and 6 months old at surgery and 7 months when they tell me they won't cover him!! So think long and hard about getting Embrace!

Reply to Embrace: He is a puppy!!!! How is there pre-existing ANYTHING! Disappointment? Just slightly!
title: To make it short

text: January 2024 marked my one year anniversary with Embrace Pet Insurance (signed up in Jan 2023). When I signed my 3 year old dog up for their insurance, they said the annual fee would go up incrementally each year. Well, in January 2024, my monthly fee increased from 49 to 79 dollars (rounded amounts). I called them and of course they blamed inflation, which as Robert Reich points out is actually price gouging. Corporations are blaming inflation to squeeze every penny they can from their customers to line the pockets of shareholders and executive staff. They also rely on vet techs and those with "demonstrated vet experience" rather than actual veterinarians! So they base all their insurance decisions on non-vets, who while may be great vet techs and the like, but they are NOT qualified to be making medical based decisions to inform insurance professionals. So now I am one year invested, but not so much I will be canceling soon, this is a racket, do NOT use Embrace.
title: Over 50 percent increase in monthly fee after first year.

text:
We were cautiously optimistic that the pet insurance we paid good money for would finally be useful when our pup was diagnosed with a soft-tissue sarcoma months after we started our coverage. But, like all insurance companies, Embrace did everything possible to avoid holding up their side of the deal. They denied our claim for surgery and treatment with a hollow and absolutely pathetic argument about their pre-existing conditions policy. 

Just understand that they will, without a doubt, weasel their way out of any obligation they have to cover your pet. And they’ll do it shamelessly, with the most mealy-mouthed legalese imaginable. Maybe the most pathetic thing about Embrace, though, is their utterly transparent lack of competence. While they deceitfully attempted to explain why they are denying our rightful claim to the coverage we paid for, they made blatant errors about the most basic facts of the case/claim (e.g., which side of the body the tumor was on, which anatomical space the tumor was on, etc.).

Don’t make the same mistake we did buying Embrace pet insurance. You’re better off paying out of pocket from the start, since that’s what you’ll be doing anyway.

P.S. If you have any doubts about the unethical  nature of this company, just take a look at the comments they make on the negative reviews here. The feigned sincerity while they spit in your face is nauseating.
title: Scam artists. Sloppy ones, at that.

text: I have had Embrace Insurance about 10 years for my dog. I would never recommend this company to anyone. As someone who at one point who had 2 dogs on the policy that both went through quite a lot of heath issues, I got tired of the nitpick from Embrace on just about everything. Most was about denial because "it's not USDA approved treatment" but they will cover drugs that are not FDA approved for use in your pets. Customer Service gives you lip service and at times can be quite patronizing. Ask to speak with a claims adjuster they take a message to have someone call you back and hear nothing. The hold time is beyond 20 minutes to reach customer service. My favorite from customer service is "submit a claim and see if it's a covered service". Why this company even bothers to have customer service is beyond me. Also, what they will not tell you when you sign up is the amount of money per month you will pay with an older pet. My monthly premium for one dog went from $250.00 a month at age 10 to $355.00 a month at age 11. Paying claims within 10 to 15 business days results in waiting for a payment for as long as 21 days. Granted they paid most claims but at what expense to myself and my pet. With my next pet I will be using another company.
title: Beware of Embrace Pet Insurance

text:
EDIT: Note the canned response and hollow apology below. You can look forward to "but it's actually your fault" when you have an issue with them. They are giving you a preview below.

I wish I could make this 0 stars. What a terrible and dishonest company. I should have spent more time doing research and not choosing based on the discount I received.

They will not pay your claim. They will make it as painful as possible and will drag it out as long as they can to get you to give up. They will throw up roadblocks, ignore you, and ultimately find some weak loophole to deny your claim.

We lost our dog recently, and very unexpectedly. She evidently had heart cancer of a type known to be a sudden killer. There was no evidence of this illness prior to us taking her to the vet due to a cough. We made medical decisions based on the fact we had insurance and were past our "waiting period". 

Embrace not only denied paying anything and left me holding a $5000 bill, but they made me relive the entire thing every time I was forced to deal with their awful adjusters over months and months. My dog has been seeing the same vet regularly for 10 years. We saw an emergency vet and a veterinary cardiologist. All of them stated that even if our dog had been seen a just week before her illness manifest, no one would have found it and it would have been too late by months anyway. Classifying her illness as "pre-existing" is laughable, and all three vets were shocked when told. 

Do yourself a favor and avoid at all costs. They are a terrible, unethical company. Shame on Embrace.
title: I wish I could make this 0 stars

title: This pet insurance is a scam

text: Very dishonest company I believe!!! It took them MONTHS after my claim for over grooming from an allergic reaction, NOT a pre-existing condition, to supposedly get records (they asked for those when we signed up, almost 2 years ago), and they even asked for records from a clinic my cat had NEVER been to. They then denied the claim, saying she had pre-existing conditions, which she does not have, first of all, and even if she did, are not related to an allergic dermatitis from the grass. Very shady, and I have cancelled my policy!!!!
title: Very dishonest company I believe!!

text: I submitted two separate claims for two separate issues. One was denied due to not having enough medical history (because he was a previously healthy indoor cat). The second, a gastrointestinal bleed in my dog's stomach was denied because TWO YEARS prior he had an obstruction - that he ultimately passed naturally. Embrace denied coverage for his gastro bleed because his hospital visit two years prior referenced stomach issues that were not at all related. I had been paying $275 a month for over a year to Embrace to cover my four animals. It was money down the drain, as they never reimbursed me for a singular claim that I made.
title: Waste of Money. Denied All Claims.

text: I have been with this company for 3 years. I sang all the praises for them and their practices. Then the 2nd year started with the attiude each time I called so I would hang up and try another phone person. When I started with this company it was pretty much one person answering the phone at his home as the customer base was still low. I have seen big changes and the attitude is well don't like it then leave. I was so happy the first 1 1/2 years but now things have changed and I have decided I will be changing too. My change is to move to a company that is looking out for my animals and my pocketbook. I have had sarcastic answers and downright dismissal in several  phone conversations. Even nasty when I was trying to pay my yearly bill. Sad state of affairs from the first 1 1/2 years of insurance. I also was sent a wonderful box of delicious cookies as a gift at one time now I can't get a straight or pleasant answer to my questions. Oh, don't expect too much coverage unless catastophic as it won't be paid for unless you have the added expense of Wellness Insurance. Dental hygiene is know to be a key to a human or pet's good health but not here. Will pay for extractions but not a cleaning that could be a preventative to heart disease. So pay the premium then pay more for Wellness !!! I thought health insurance was the path to wellness.                             Dr Kendra Sullivan Godin
title: I have been with this company for 3…

text: I adopted a 8 month puppy from the shelter. A medical review was completed at that time and he was found in good health.  Two weeks after I adopted him, I signed up for Embrace insurance. 2 weeks after that, I had to take him to the vet due to diarrhea. I submitted the  claim along with his medical history that the shelter provided me (again clean bill of health). The adjuster denied my claim stating that the upon medical history review he found that diarrhea was a "pre-existing condition" and any treatment for that condition would be denied throughout the policy year. What? the medical history from the shelter EXPLICITELY states he had no diarrhea and when I go to get it treated it created a pre-existing condition. Of course I canceled my policy. What a joke. It's better to pocket that monthly $25 than spend it on this company.
title: Money Grab Scam - They'll Create Pre-Existing Conditions

text:
We went through a truly awful experience with our female 7 year old Whippet Mix, Thalia, being diagnosed with a tumor attached to her spleen.  She wouldn't eat and was very sick. Taking her to the Vet, she was given meds to help her appetite until we could get her to surgery.  In the midst of this diagnosis, my husband became ill too.  
If it wasn't for Embrace Pet Insurance, between Thalia's vet bills and my husband's medical bills, it would have been horrific.  Embrace's app on my phone made submitting claims so very easy when I needed easy!! They would let you know that your claim was under review as soon as they received the claim.  And would let you know it was processing and when your check was being sent.  Thank you Embrace for helping me in a dire time in our lives.  Unfortunately, we lost Thalia because the tumor had taken over her whole insides.  And even in the end, Embrace sent us a beautiful condolence card when we least expected.  We miss our girl and will forever; but companies like Embrace are there throughout.  I would highly recommend this company to any furbaby owner.  They were there for us.

text:
Before having pet insurance, I assumed it was all a scam. However, I recently put both my cats under Embrace's coverage and could not have been more wrong. I assumed my 10 year old rescue might have some issues come up in the next couple years, so both her and my 4 year old cat are covered. About a month after getting them covered, the 4 year old cat has needed multiple vet visits in a single week for sudden onset of kidney issues. Embrace has covered 90% of all charges after the small deductible I had selected, saving me half a month's pay!  It will take 5 years of monthly payments for both cats until I break even on the coverage provided this past week. I am amazed at the ease of submitting a claim and the speed at which it is processed. Having a sick baby is stressful enough without worrying about finances, and that worry has been lifted from me by Embrace. 

I have stated recommending them to everyone I know with a pet, and will be a customer for life!
title: Now A Believer For Life

text: Every experience I’ve had with embrace has been a great one. I enjoy choosing how much coverage I can choose to fit our needs. We have two dogs insured through them. The policy itself is fair and well worth the peace of mind it entails. The coverage is excellent. We live in a semi rural area, so being able to chose the vet we need for emergency services is an absolute win for both dogs. Whether it be the primary care vet or an emergency vet, embrace has your back through both and whichever vet you choose. The initial medical records review process can be tedious, but well worth it. Highly recommend to anyone who needs a little extra peace of mind for your fur babies especially in a rural area. Love it. 10/10 recommend.

text:
I got off to a rough start with Embrace when I put in a claim for my Dog “Koru” who was diagnosed with cancer in September. I was told that his condition was deemed pre-existing from a veterinary record they had back in January, and I immediately took to google and wrote a scathing review about how bad this company is.
Once I’d calmed down and explored the options that Embrace offered me to appeal their decision, I had my Vet submit information stating that there’s no way Koru could’ve survived if the cancer had been there since January, and gone untreated.
The decision was immediately overturned, and all claims were honoured promptly with auto pay directly to my account within a week of each submission.
Unfortunately Koru lost his battle with cancer on 11/06/2023, but without the insurance I would’ve been out of pocket over $5000.00.
Thank you for honouring your policy Embrace, and helping me get through this difficult time.
title: I got off to a rough start with Embrace…

text: I'm very grateful for Embrace. They make the claim process very easy. text: I very much liked the ease of talking to a rep. All of the company reps were sweet, knowledgeable, and kind. Even the one who took my cancellation notice was friendly and never tried to change my mind or sell me anything. I adopted my Coda one day after putting my 20+ yr old Pepper to sleep for serious kidney issues. I wanted full coverage for the new one so I didn't have to spend huge money if she was found to suffer from kidney issues as well.  She had been to a vet once with previous owner and from that ONE visit, they refused to cover her for any kidney issues due to one lab done 2 yrs previous. I will care for this lil girl the remainder of her days, but them considering her a bad risk due to ONE lab, irritated me beyond my ability to continue with the now over $400/yr. coverage rate which was much higher than her initial yr. coverage. Nope, I am NOT paying for other pets issues and rate increase because of ONE lab. I am a retired R.N. and have worked with insurance companies all of my career. If this had been a human being I would have been appalled, however I am simply angry with it being a pet. My income is fixed. I can't afford outrageous jumps in a policy coverage rate in only one year especially if it will not cover the health issues I most worry over. I will simply put money aside monthly for her vetting. Give me rationale for this massive rate increase at least, before simply billing me. ( she was seen by her vet ONCE in this past year for her distemper inj. and I never bothered to submit it thinking it would push her fee up. I was wrong, and should have known it would go up anyway). Insurance was a waste for Coda and I.

text: One of the Best Investments I've ever made in Insurance. The price of emergency care has sky rocketed. Last year I had a friend that adapted a puppy. After 4 months of bliss his puppy got cancer. Long story short puppy is doing well but it took 3 months of surgery's, chemo (yes chemo) and many visits to Vet and Vet hospital. For real his Vet bills totaled over $16,000. So when we got our puppy this year I checked into animal insurance. I heard all the horror stories that the animal insurance companies never pay but after extensive research and quotes I felt Embrace was the best bang for the buck. I've had pets before and hardly ever needed a Vet for other than basic wellness but my friends experience made me choose to try it out. My puppy policy was not very expensive at all. Needless to say my puppy at 6 months old was either stung by a bee or bit by a snake (never saw what did it to her) and she went into anaphylactic shock and almost died. Well the Vet hospital bill and follow up was over $2500. Embrace paid their contracted share within 2 weeks ($1800 or 90% after my $500 deductable), directly to my bank account. After initial required documentation from me they did all the legwork with the Hospital and Vet. Best thing of all was when the Hospital told me what was needed to save our puppy I didn't flinch about proceeding with the procedures, figuring that's why I got insurance. After all was said and done It sure was nice to know I didn't have to have our puppy either put down or take on an enormous amount of debt to save her. The peace of mind was such a relief. Vets and Hospitals are not cheap these days. I can't give enough praise to my Embrace experience and their part in saving my puppy's life.
title: One of the Best Investments In Insurance I've ever Made

text:
For anyone looking for pet insurance, please make sure they tell you what is covered and not covered from the beginning, check what your pet's pre existing conditions are and what is NOT covered based on that. 

I enrolled with embrace hoping to have some peace of mind in case my cat ever needed veterinary care, they did a vet history check where they get your pet's records and determine what's covered and if there are any pre-existing conditions that won't be covered. At the time of enrollment I did not receive notice of conditions that would not be covered. 

I paid for my cat's Accident & Illness policy for basically a year. She got sick about a month ago (lethargic, vomit, diarrhea) I took her to the vet and she got treated for those symptoms with antibiotics, anti-inflammatories along with an x-ray that showed a possible soft tissue mass in her abdomen. 

When I submitted the claim, they said they had to do another Vet history check and this second time they stated that treatment for any mass including cancer would not be covered because my cat had a mass in her ear years ago according to her vet history. I wonder if they did not communicate this to me with the first history check so that I would keep the policy and then they could deny whatever treatment once a claim is submitted under the pretext of a 'second history check is needed'.

So I had to cover the $730 bill out of pocket on top of paying for all the insurance premiums for a year which were an absolute waste of money. I cancelled the policy because any treatment moving forward would be linked to that and not covered obviously. 

Fast forward, I've taken my cat to the vet once again, and they stated that what looked like a mass is instead an enlarged kidney and she has an infection, we still need more testing to determine the exact cause. The bill is at $1500 right now but that number keeps growing, I will do anything for my cat but I'd be lying if I said these events don't affect you big time financially. 

My recommendation if you're searching for insurance: Get everything in writing from the start, what's covered and what's not, read the fine print and ask for clarification on anything you don't understand and lastly but the most important piece of advise, BUILD AN EMERGENCY FUND for your pet, save what you can while they're healthy to cover vet expenses when they're not. Insurances in general will use anything and everything they can to not pay and not do their part, I've lived it with my own health insurance and with my cat's.
title: For anyone looking for Pet Insurance.

text: Hi, first time in my life (I'm 71!) I've taken out pet insurance, but everything is so expensive these days, and one of my kitties just went to heaven less than 3 weeks ago.  So I took out an Embrace policy for my 11-year old kitty, Buffie and took her in for her annual exam last week.  I bought the wellness package also, so that would help with some of the cost.  I followed directions to submit a claim for her annual exam and toenail trim, and couldn't believe how easy it was.  Better than sliced bread!  All this time I thought pet insurance would be exorbitantly expensive, but I'm retired from military and also covered by USAA for auto and home, so have those discounts with Embrace.  Wish I would have done that years ago with my Benjamin Kitty, my sweet guy who is no longer in pain now.  Everyone I've spoken to at Embrace has just absolutely been the Cat's Meow!!
