text:
DO NOT do business with Embrace.  A different company American Modern Home Insurance owns it and handles the claims. Its adjusters will do whatever it takes to deny substantial claims like mine of $3,800. They like to stretch the “pre-existing condition” clause. Look at some of the other one-star reviews. They don’t apparently consult with veterinarians.
After a routine teeth cleaning in February 2023, my cat Jenny almost died because she had become completely incapable of chewing food. We took her back to her original vet, two emergency vets, and a vet neurology specialist. They decided it was a neurological problem that was preventing her from chewing properly even though she tried.  They said something happened during the cleaning such as too much anesthetic. We had to feed her through a tube for more than two weeks until she very slowly regained her ability.

Jenny was given to me at 6 years old. I knew she had never had her teeth cleaned and  that this was important to do routinely. I told the vet who looked in Jenny’s mouth and said nothing other than that the cleaning would be scheduled.

It turns out the vet put in her notes that Jenny had gingivitis. This was before I got Insurance. I would have had the cleaning even there had been no gingivitis. Embrace denied all claims based on this even after two appeals during which they received three letters from the vets involved stating gingivitis had nothing to do with the problem. How could it? It was an accident or mistake that occurred during the cleaning.
-------------
Here is my reply to your reply. The gingivitis was not medically related to my cat's neurological injury. That is what two of my vets told you. There was an injury to her nerves suffered during the teeth cleaning. The only connection to the gingivitis was that it preceded the cleaning chronologically. There was no medical causation.
The only way i will be satisfied is if you pay me the $3,800 you rightfully owe us.
title: DO NOT do business with Embrace

text:
Where do I begin... I got embrace $15k coverage in the worst case scenario for both my cats. I did a ton of research and they provided dental illness, waived exams if you paid for it, and had a deal for multiple cats. The only red flags were several reviewers said they had a tendency to really exaggerate and define everything as a prexisting condition.

Nothing happened for 3-4 months after receiving coverage. Then on a vet visit, my vet noticed my cat had loss weight. For my first vet visit claim, I found out they had never bothered to review my pets medical records and proceeded to start adding ticky tacky "pre-existing conditions" which included something such as slightly dirty teeth now being an exclusion for dental diseases. I literally purchased them partially because they were one of the few companies that covered dental diseases. But apparently that has a massive asterisk to it.

The best part about my first claim? It took 1.5 months for them to start telling me anything and only after i had to reach out to embrace and the vets because apparently they were just going to string me along until i did anything. So basically i paid them for 4.5 months only to find out they were going to start adding ineligibility.

Flash forward to today 3 months from my first claim, I still havent been paid yet. My cat is now dead. I am now finding out not only did they take 2.5 months to make their first decision on my pets claim, they have suddenly reversed decision and telling me im not paying squat. Between dealing with my pets health issues and death, I have to be the one constantly badgering the insurance company and reaching out to the vets to get information. Not only did i have to stress about my cat, i had to deal with this absolute dog poop of a company that has dragged its feet for anything just to screw me at every turn. I have spoken to probably 4 people at the company so far and im likely going to speak to a 5th.

If you want an insurance company that will ultimately not pay you, expect you to do all the work yourself, try to put anything and everything as exclusionary, and just add stress to you while your pet is dying. Then yeah Embrace is for you.

What a frigging scam. Im canceling my other pets insurance policy. I have 0 trust if anything happened with my other cats they wouldn't find a way to bend me over here too. Could not recommend a company less - end to end, just completely screwing me. I guess its better i find out now, because apparently if my cat had gotten sick 5 years from now they would have told me after collecting 5 years of checks they would just absolutely screw me. What the actual hell. 0 stars if i could.

People are right, set aside the money you need - you wont get screwed. Embrace definitely is prone to flagging everything as pre-existing. Im appealing but i expect nothing and just more stress. Thanks for squat!
title: All Embrace did was stress me out and not pay for anything

text: I’ve had an Embrace Pet Insurance Policy for several years and every claim has been denied. Most recently I took my dog Perry to an Emergency Veterinary Clinic for what was ultimately diagnosed as “Idiopathic Vestibular Syndrome”, a neurological disorder seen in senior dogs. Embrace denied this claim because blood work done during the visit showed the presence of “Azotemia” or Renal Disease, a pre-existing condition. In other words they used the presence of kidney disease to not pay the claim for his new neurological disorder which is totally unrelated. This would be like not paying for cancer care because of the presence of kidney disease. They are completely unethical and I would not recommend Embrace to anyone!
title: Unethical…do not recommend

title: Avoid Embrace

text:
After giving much thought to whether or not I wanted to purchase pet insurance for my fur-baby, I did extensive coverage which was narrowed down to two options - Embrace was one of them.
I was struck by the broad coverage they offer sparing no detail. Compared to other companies, Embrace seemed like the likely choice taking into account the tail to nose coverage, app interface, quick turnaround for claims, and very clear/transparent policy,
Thx far, I have found their customer service to be impeccable from Sales/Onboarding to regular customer care — everyone I have spoken to thus far has been knowledgeable, warm, kind, and patient. 
Additionally, there is a strong coordination of care with Embrace which means when you call Customer care more than once, everything is noted in your file and the right hand knows what the left hand is doing.
Lastly, their pricing is more than fare. And so is the company. After signing up for one plan I had within a day wanted to change the maximum from 30k to Unlimited and I was able to accomplish that with ease only having to pay the difference. The policy change was automatically confirmed via email and all was updated in the app on the following day.
When I first initially called sales/onboarding I had so many questions - my representative was so patient with me and was so well-informed and able to answer every single question I had.
HIGHLY recommend Embrace - you won’t be disappointed. And it’ll bring you a peace of mind that you’re looking for in a pet insurance plan!
title: Peace of Mind - HIGHLY Recommend!

text: I don’t like to give bad reviews unless they earned it.  This company has more than earned it.  I paid $3000 for 2 dogs for the year and I haven’t been to aggressive with filing claims.  $1000 deductible so figure will only do it with big issues.  My pup had radiation for cancer in her lung $30k precondition no complaint not covered didn’t even try.  Well she had a medical emergency while at radiation she bit down on stela cage after treatment.  The DR paid for her to go to dental surgeon again nothing out of pocket for Embrace.  While there they found a life threatening non cancerous tumor that had grow in back of her mouth.  They wanted $3000 to remove and test.  I expected not much but some of this to be covered.  Filed claim 3 weeks ago.  I have 13 years worth of medical docs.  That wasn’t enough they are going through with fine comb wanting every ER visit in last 12 months even if they found something in last 12 month she was covered for this 12 months but they are being completely ridiculous. My renewal is Monday and I told them no way no how.   I suspected them to cover maybe 500-1000 of the $3000 because of one excuse or another but I had no idea just to the extent they would hit pick and they to weasel out of 1 CLAIM for 1 dog out of the whole year for 2 dogs.   They care more about left wing social justice groups than the animals they claim to insure.  Don’t take my word just read up on the companies website there yearly report on their company.  Their agent wasn’t as snobby and elitest as one might expect.  If I could give them negative rating I would they are so bad.  I love my pups and if you are reading this review I imagine you do to.  Don’t risk it they are as bad as if not worst than that competitor Truepanion.   I was able to cover the radiation because I had saved the money over the years from being burned by any time I ever purchased insurance and tried to use it.  There is a reason they make you pay up front and reimburse and that is cause they know there is a near 99% chance they can find some way to get out of it if your dog is older than one week and has maintained sufficient medical records.
title: I don’t like to give bad reviews unless earnes

text: When I took my new puppy to his first Vet visit, May 2022, Embrace was one of three insurance companies my vet recommended.  After going home and visiting websites and reading the brochures I decided Embrace would work best for us.  Best decision ever!  Fast forward to September 2023 and Baxter began having some issues with lethargy, appetite, and leg weakness a visit to my vet and several test later we were referred to a vet specialist who then diagnosed him with Atypical Addison’s. A week later Baxter was back at the vet in full Addison’s crisis and another trip to the vet specialist. I had just gotten around to submitting a claim to Embrace for the first two visits and now would be submitting two more.  This has all been chaotic and emotional and through it all the last thing I needed was problems with the insurance.  Let me tell you the staff at Embrace are wonderful.  They are quick to let you know the claim was received and being processed and then when it’s processed they let you know right away how much is covered and then like magic the refund appears in your bank account. Our last visit was on a Monday and I filed the claim by phone on Tuesday. My refund hit my bank on Thursday of the same week.  It’s so nice to be able to file a claim so easily and then have the entire transaction finished within a week so you no longer have to worry about it.
title: Embrace was amazing during a chaotic time.

Like all insurance, you wish you didn't have to use it. I'm so grateful I had Embrace when I needed it most.

text: I gave 3 stars, because at first, the experience was a bit rocky and rough. I was under the impression that all the medical records had be looked at prior by Embrace, but that wasn’t the case. They took over a month to reimburse me, but I finally got an adjuster who was ready to do her job the right way and keep me as a customer with Embrace as I was ready to leave and file a lawsuit against Embrace. In the end, Sabrina did a great job. She reviewed the medical records of my dog Stormy who the claim was entered in for, and got me my claim reimbursed to me in a very responsible amount of time from when she took on the case for me. Then after that, she offered to do a medical review for my other dog Dakota to prevent this issue from occurring again in the future. I will be honest, Sabrina is the reason I give a 3 star review, because if it wasn’t for her, it would be a 1 star review. Embrace should consider offering Sabrina a manager or supervisor position, because she would be an excellent leader within your company. I am very thankful to her and for all the help in making what was an extremely stressful situation into a much simpler process. Thank you Sabrina for all your work into making this go over much smoother.

text: So I used to promote Embrace Pet Insurance to everyone. I actually would rave about it and really encourage people to get it. However, now I am going to warn everyone on every platform of social media to stay away from embrace pet insurance as they can’t support its policy holders and honor their policies. You have 60 days when the year ends to submit the previous years invoices. However, because they have gotten so cheap, they took that away from me and utilized it towards this year and sending countless emails acting as though they can’t read invoices and every other excuse you can think of. As a United States retired Army combat veteran, to be treated so poorly by a company that supposed to support as USAA members, is beyond disappointing and discouraging. Something tells me this company will be sued and the country will know of its fraudulent activity here in the near future.
title: STAY AWAY FROM EMBRACE PET INSURANCE

text:
This has been my first experience with pet insurance, and every single step of the way, Embrace has made me feel 100% comfortable and confident I made the right choice. I have been a client for over two months now and the quality of care has stayed the same. 

Their customer service is extremely friendly! Also very helpful and reassuring; they offer 24/7 care if you need to call with a health concern or any questions whatsoever. 

The site is very easy to navigate and understand how to submit claims, edit your policy, add a new pet, etc.  I have both of my furbabies signed up and feel relieved.

 For what their plans offer vs what you pay, it almost feels like a steal! They will also work with you honestly about what the best policy and plans are for your pet's needs; they do not try to upsell at all! I had been considering a higher tier portion of my plan, but the representative discussed with me in detail and helped me determine that the mid-tier was the best option for me. 

You can tell everyone genuinely is passionate about what they do, and they love your pets as if they were their own! Do not use another company; Embrace is the way to go!
title: Completely Confident I Made the Right Choice

text:
I had Embrace pet insurance for 1 year, the rate was roughly $95 a month for both of my dogs. I was about to come up on my 1 year anniversary with Embrace, they sent me an email informing me that my premium would increase from $98 a month to $195 a month. There was no explanation why, of course I called in and spoke with a representative. She informed me it could be that my dogs were a year older and possibly do to my location which did not change. She said I could speak with a licensed agent and adjust my coverage to get my premium down.

Obviously I declined, why would I keep insurance with a company that doubles my premium after 1 year of being a customer.  I canceled my coverage and will be looking for insurance with a company that treats it's customers right. I'm disgusted with that Ebrace pet insurance and hope whoever is responsible for doubling rates has an awful short life.
title: They'll double your premium after 1 year

text: I do not like the policy about pre-existing conditions. It's like they look for anything to deny a claim. It should be like people insurance and they should have a waiting period and then cover certain things.
title: I do not like the policy about…pre-existing Conditions

text: Too many stipulations on what can be covered for older pets with issues and having to pay a $500 pet deductible before anything is covered defeats the purpose of pet insurance. I will be changing companies once the renewal period arrives. I was referred by USAA but will be writing to them as well to reconsider their partnership for endorsement.

text: Online filing went well; decision to pay made within 24 hours, deposit in bank within two days. The amount paid matched the contract specifics.
title: Online filing went well

text: Prompt Claim Service, covered what the policy said it would.  Read the fine print folks, I did.  I read what was and wasn't covered, and did a lot of shopping in the two weeks after I acquired my new Yorkie puppy.  I narrowed it down to two carriers and signed up with both, continued to read and research, and then at the end of the 30 day evaluation period, chose one and cancelled the other.  I read the reviews on each, listed to others complaints and made sure not to make the same mistakes they did.  I took my new puppy to the vet within two weeks of signing up, got them to fill out the orthopedic review form, and then at the end of the 14 day waiting period for accident/illness had my vet sent over my pets complete medical records to Embrace and requested they review her history for any pre-existing conditions and advise me of their findings, exclusions if any.  After that, I signed up for direct deposit reimbursement, any claims I needed to file have been acknowledged within 7 days and reimbursed super promptly within the next 5-7 days, no muss no fuss.   My vet sends me a receipt before I leave their office, I pay them and I get home, log in provide the receipt from the vet showing what they did with line item detail for cost/treatment and in 13 days or less I receive an email advising me my claim is settled and to log in and see the result.  After 60 days and multiple claims for wellness/illness/injury, all has gone smoothly and I am glad I bought the Embrace Accident/Illness/Wellness coverage for my new puppy.  So short answer, read the fine print, know what is covered and what is required to be reimbursed, follow the directions and choose Embrace.  I am happy and would choose Embrace  again.

text:
I sent in a set of claims 29 days ago.
1 of the claims was processed and approved in 14 days. All other claims are still waiting for review.
I'm told it takes up to 30 business days to review after receipt of medical history etc.

So, by my math, 4 weeks so far and possibly up to another 6 weeks for review of the other claims.

I am new to embrace, but I have used other per insurance companies in the past.

In comparison, Embrace appears to be either the most thorough pet insurer or they may be understaffed to process claims in a timeline comparable to other pet insurers.

My advice to anyone considering Embrace is to accept that time to process claims may be lengthy.
I am still waiting for the outcomes of my claims.
This review is factual as to my knowledge. 
I would not be writing this review at this time other than because I received a request to do so from Embrace themselves.
I would have preferred to provide a proper review upon completion of processing of the claims submitted.
At this point it is not clear what is happening other than the limited information shared to date as noted above saying it could take another 30 business days (that's another 6 weeks following the first 4 weeks and counting).

I look forward to the outcome of my submitted claims.

text:
When I signed up for Embrace approximately 2 years ago, the cost to ensure my dog was $600 a year. Unexpectedly, Embrace has now than doubled the yearly cost and wants me to pay over $1300 a year for the same coverage. I tried to call to talk to someone at Embrace about this, but they were unable to help and only offered to "change my coverage around" which would only reduce the cost by a couple hundred or so and increase my deductible etc. I understand costs can rise, inflation, pet age, etc. However, more than double isn't right. $1373 for one dog with a $700 deductible is wild...why am I paying more for one pets insurance than my own car or health insurance? 

I want to change providers, however, I'm aware most insurance companies won't cover any illnesses that arose during the coverage period of previous insurer, essentially leaving the insured with little to no options to go elsewhere if they want to stay covered for the same conditions. I think this is pretty unfair to the little guy, scummy, rigged, and not   a practice of integrity.

Embrace shouldn't feel good about these practices. More than doubling, the cost of insurance isn't acceptable, but they do this knowing once you're locked in you can't really switch to another provider.

Also, I've had to fight tooth and nail to have previous claims covered, go through lengthy appeals processes, etc. They take their sweet time and try to deny you when you rightfully submit claims. 

Embrace likes to respond to these types of complaints without any helpful resolution.... just skip the reply unless you're actually going to help.

text:
MAKE SURE THEY HAVE YOUR DOG'S EXACT WEIGHT WHEN YOU SET UP YOUR POLICY. Here's the deal: I'm mostly very pleased with my Embrace insurance policy. They have covered everything I've needed them to and I am grateful to have this policy so I can spring for higher quality healthcare for my dog. However, I found out recently that for the past two years that I've been overcharged (by about 2x) because I noted at the start of the policy that my dog is a "mixed breed" (which he is!). I did not see that on the scroll-down menu, they also list "mixed breed" at various weights, and if you don't select one of those options, they'll just charge you as if your dog is medium-sized. MY DOG IS 12 LBS. I called and got this fixed, and while they're going to re-adjust my policy for the following years, I do not get any sort of rebate or even an apology for the fact that they've been essentially fleecing me. As a first-time dog owner, I had no idea that the entire price of the policy hinged on me selecting the right thing from that drop-down menu (because his exact weight is on his medical records, which Embrace has!!). DO NOT make the same mistake I did! Make sure Embrace has the correct weight for your dog and call to confirm if necessary.

Embrace, I do not know WHY you would allow people to setup a policy without inputing an exact weight, if weight is a primary tool for you in calculating the premium. I recommend changing this to avoid folks feeling confused or ripped off.
title: Note your dog's weight at policy setup!!

text:
I have been severely let down by Embrace. 
My pet became ill suddenly to the point that she did not recover and had go subsequently be euthanized.  
Subsequently and Embrace Insurance has refused to cover our claim due to a notation of us as the owner giving our pet a supplement to help with UTIs in her health record before we started coverage. Embrace has took it upon themselves to not take the advice of the veterinarian that it was for a prophylactic treatment for a proneness to UTI, And instead stated that it was a history of kidney failure/ kidney disease that we were claiming for. 
So with the life-saving treatment that we attempted to do. To save our girl, we expected that our insurance would cover any treatments We had to perform as we had not had a diagnosis before, we started insurance with Embrace. 

We are now attempting our second appeal, however even with multiple vet recommendations that she had UTIs and not kidney failure, which is what the supplements were for, there is a chance that Embrace will be more likely to deny the claim than to accept the word of two different veterinarians.

text:
Terrible insurance company, almost felt like a total scam. They lured me in with the promise of doing a pre-check on my cats' medical records so I wouldn't have to wait when I submitted a claim. 

I turned in all the year's worth of vet records, including the required comprehensive exam through their portal after sign up. Got an email three weeks later to say they never received any paperwork from me so couldn't do the pre-check. I emailed back with all the paperwork again and they responded once to say they would send a request to the vet. 

Several months go by and I don't hear anything so I assumed it had gone through. Then I submit a claim. I get a response back after several weeks and I had to submit a follow up query to say they didn't have the required paperwork to complete their pre-check so couldn't process my claim. 

I asked them what happened with everything I'd submitted and why that wasn't enough. They said the vet never responded to them. We called the vet. They couldn't find any indication they'd ever been contacted. 

I submitted all the exam paper again. Never heard back. I tried numerous times to contact them and never heard a thing. 

To top it all off, one of the claims I submitted for a wellness visit which (according to what I'd paid for) was supposed to be an automatic payout since it wasn't part of the insurance claim. Despite numerous asks on my end, they never paid it out or told me why they wouldn't. 

So, stay far far away from this one.
title: Terrible insurance company

text: I wish I had read these reviews before changing over to Embrace Pet Insurance. I wholeheartedly agree with the people who were taken in by pre-existing conditions of lipomas and tartar, which apparently was the reason my claim was denied...and will be denied in the future for any of these reasons. I told my vet how they are even lumping the catch-all, "including cancer," as a pre-existing condition; she was appalled. Just to be clear, my dog has never had cancer. I spoke with a representative, who was syrupy (and condescendingly) sweet, but could provide no reason why I should even have pet insurance. Each hypothetical injury/disease was met with the standard "well, it depends on XYZ" or "each case is different." Bottom line, they will do and/or say anything to get out of helping to pay your bill. In fact, if I had set aside the money I paid in premiums, I would have saved close to the actual bill amount. Because this company is associated with USAA, I thought it would be better than a basic insurance company. Boy, was I wrong! Save yourself heartache and time by "paying" yourself the premium cost and using that to take care of the bills.
title: Insurance Scam

text:
I’d had a policy for both of my sweet dogs for two years before I had to file my first claim.

In July 2023, my precious boy Wrinkles was suddenly diagnosed with a large tumor in his chest as well as pleural effusion. Over the next 30 days, we did everything absolutely possible to try to extend his life for many more great years.

Unfortunately, by the time we drove down to Colorado State University to meet with the oncologists to develop an action plan, though, Wrinkles started to decline rapidly. 
He was hospitalized in their critical care unit for 36 hours with the hope to stabilize him so we could move forward with treatment. 
The tumor grew so fast during that time, however, that he became unable to breathe without assistance. His body could not fight anymore. 

We had to make the massively difficult, painful decision to have him put to sleep there, surrounded by his family with many hugs and kisses, after enjoying some delicious treats and tasty bison wet food. 

In our hearts, the only thing more painful than choosing to have him put down with all of us there holding him and loving him would have been him dying alone in that oxygen cage while waiting for stabilization and further steps with oncology. 

Because of Embrace, from the moment of his diagnosis, we were able to say YES to everything recommended by his veterinarian, from the additional appointments here in North Dakota to the fine needle aspirate to the biopsy to the multiple chest x-rays and abdominal ultrasounds as well as the steroids. We were also able to go to CSU with Wrinkles without even blinking an eye, knowing that there was no concern with how much treatment would cost. All that truly mattered was that we were going to do everything we could to get this tumor removed so he could live the rest of his beautiful life.

It is devastating beyond words that this cancer progressed so fast that we couldn’t beat it. But thanks to Embrace, again, I know we did all we humanly could. 

About one week after Wrinkles’ passing, I did the painful work of submitting his records and filing the claims. I did not know what to expect. Of course, I was a bit scared of the worst case scenario that Embrace was either going to ask a lot of questions and give me a hard time during this devastating chapter of my life, or even find some components of his treatment not to pay for, for some reason.

After just a handful of days, however, Embrace deposited the contractually stated 80% of Wrinkles’ medical bills into my bank account. In a time of searing grief and sadness, this was one small bright spot- to be able to pay off his bills right then. 

Thank you, Embrace. We really do appreciate you.
title: Embrace keeps their word

text: Embrace bent over backwards, specifically Dan F. in the claims department, to get my little italian greyhound's broken leg surgery covered - despite the odds against me regarding waiting periods. They helped me through the process of getting all of my previous vet's medical history, as well as getting a pre-certification filled out by the emergency veterinary surgeon, so as to have the best chance to get her surgery covered. Thanks to all of their help and guidance Ducky was pre-approved within ONE DAY, 12 hours after my first phone call with Embrace, she was approved. Ducky was then able to get her surgery the next morning. Cannot rave enough about how great they were and un-insurance-like the entire experience was. Embrace and USAA set the standard here and I will recommend them to everyone considering pet insurance!
title: Embrace pulled every string imaginable!

What's most puzzling is why they need records from 2022 again for vet visits from 2023? They already have those records from the 2022 claims. This just seems like a lazy excuse to not honor their end of the insurance contract.

It appears that the quality of the "claims adjusters" has dramatically declined. A silver lining is that the customer representatives are still nice, but it takes an eternity to get hold of one! 

I'll update this review if anything changes, but after over 2 months of going back and forth over the claims, I don't have much hope from this company.

text:
Embrace is a total waste of time and money. I had coverage on two dogs for more than two years at $73/month. Not ONE TIME did Embrace pay out a claim. Their underwriters flatly lied when I asked them to apply a vet bill to my annual deductible, claiming a veterinarian’s exam description of “Minor gum swelling; overdue for cleaning” actually means “indicative of gum disease; preexisting condition.” 

In fact, when I went to file a claim after over a year, they told me that my paperwork hadn’t been finished when I set up my account. You mean you sat there and collected $70 every month and never bothered to tell me that my account wasn’t properly set up? Thank god my dogs weren’t injured and needed emergency medical treatment during that time. 

I gave these useless clowns $1700 and got absolutely nothing for it. I paid for every vet visit and every scrap of medication. They refused to cover ANYTHING, finding loopholes and ridiculous reasons not to pay out until I finally canceled coverage. You are better served putting $75 a month into a savings account and using that to pay for your pets’ medical coverage as needed. 

They offer ridiculous contact times… They literally have an emergency number on their website that is only answered Monday through Friday, 8a-3p Eastern Standard Time— because god forbid you have an emergency over the weekend. I had exactly ONE email out of a dozen replied to in two years. Let’s be frank: Embrace doesn’t care about you or your pet. They sure make certain to bill you on time, though.

I’m a capitalist. I’m all in favor of a company making money, provided that they provide a service that is WORTH the money. Embrace does NOT. 

On March 22nd, 2023, Embrace was reported to the Pierce County, WA Better Business Bureau for fraudulent insurance practices. As of the writing of this review, 09September, 2023, they had failed to even respond to the report. They managed to contact me immediately when I deleted my credit card from their app and they felt it was time to be paid, though. (The app features no way to cancel your coverage via the app.)

In short, do not purchase Embrace medical coverage for any pet you actually care about. They will NOT be there when you need them. Your beloved pets could DIE while these bozos find reasons not to help you.

text:
Mainly the wellness coverage was useful, but if your pet had any preexisting conditions, it will be used against you for everything else. So if your pet was itchy, consider any other skin issue anywhere else on their body to NOT be covered. Even if is different. 

For example, if your pet has skin allergies, and they end up with a bump on their foot, you WILL BE DECLINED COVERAGE. 

They also had a claim open for 5 months and no one followed up on it, until I had to ask. *Please note how their response failed to address this wait time. 

This prompted me to close my account with them.

I’m uncertain why Embrace is requesting for me to contact them any further. I am aware of the policy. They did not make any considerations, or note the possibility of a temporary diagnosis. If you have to wait 6-12 months for coverage, then it is clear that they will not cover your pet.

I do NOT recommend Embrace. Please learn from my experience and read other reviews about Embrace that state they will DENY coverage.

Which is absurd because just about every dog or cat has tarter, yet, they advertise they cover dental problems to include extractions. This is bait n switch as far as I'm concerned. Because of Embrace, we didn’t have to worry about the financial cost to save our dogs life. Embrace covered all the bills, specialists, pills, etc. Because of the treatment we were blessed with 11 more months with our sweet boy. This company does everything they promise. text:
I recently submitted a claim for my dog, Koru. He was diagnosed with cancer and X-rays showed a huge mass on his heart and lungs. I have full coverage that includes cancer and treatment, but Embrace denied my $5000.00 claim because Koru had a cough seven months ago which was diagnosed and treated for. 
When I showed the vet the explanation of why my claim was denied, she said there’s no way my dog could’ve survived with this growth on his heart and lungs for the last seven months and it had nothing to do with his cough which was treated!
I’m unable to afford treatment for my dog and as such have had to put him down. 
Thanks for killing my dog Embrace not Pet Insurance!!

text:
My dog was denied coverage for a new diagnosis that a  vet specialist said was new for my dog and could not be proven to be connected to a previous vet notation about his eyes. The specialist said that the diagnosis was because of my dog's age. Embrace denied coverage because the adjuster said that it COULD be connected to the previous vet's notation, nothing definitely connected. Every problem with a dog COULD be connected, as it is one dog's body. Embrace has never had to pay anything yet on my dog; and when I needed coverage on a new diagnosis, it was denied.  I now believe pet insurance to be a racket, as I have paid 18 months of coverage for nothing; plus, they increased the premium because he turned another year older.  Poor service!
No wonder vets don't appear to support these insurances!  None of the vets I've dealt with have ever said anything positive about having pet insurance.  All it's done for me and my vet is caused there to be circumstances where it appears that I'm questioning my vet's knowledge. Buyer beware!

text:
I am not a person to leave comments to my experiences, but in this case I really want to do it.
When I bought the insurance policy for my dog ​​it was the shock of seeing my best friend how she had to make the decision to put her dog to sleep for not having insurance, her pet was unexpectedly found to have cancer and unfortunately The treatment was very expensive and I saw that pain and sadness that I still can't get over after almost two years, I told my son who is in the navy we must all pay for medical insurance for our dog because I would go crazy if something happened to him and I called EMBRACE and the advisor who attended me told my friend's story and she very kindly also told me that she suggested I cover him for the medical problems that his race has very frequently and that dysplasia was one of them and that he recommended full coverage.
At first I thought it was an unnecessary expense but through USAA they gave us a discount and I decided to take the policy and now I'm glad I did because I had an emergency with my dog, not because of cancer, thank God, but disc 2 and 3 were They separated from the thorn and he was unable to walk and had to see a specialist.
I was so desperate when they told me the cost of the surgery could be between 8,000 and 12,000 dollars.
I called the insurance I told them and they told me that as soon as I paid everything, I submitted the claim that they would refund me.
My dog ​​underwent surgery and was hospitalized for 3 days and the reimbursement was made to me in less than 10 days, 100% of its coverage as stipulated in my full coverage contract.
They covered medications, medical tests, MRI, laboratory tests, hospitalization.
my dog ​​has been operated on for a month and thank God he is walking again and I am very happy to have made the best decision to buy him an insurance policy and EMBRACE I ONLY HAVE WORDS OF THANK YOU FOR ALL THE HELP.

text:
I regret to say that my experience with Embrace Pet Insurance has been nothing short of disappointing. It pains me to label them as nothing more than scammers, as I've struggled to obtain any form of reimbursement through their services. To illustrate the extent of their lackluster support, let me recount an incident involving my cat's ear issues. Despite providing clear documentation and evidence of an ear infection, Embrace categorized it as a pre-existing condition under the umbrella of allergies, promptly denying coverage. This preposterous reasoning reflects their abysmal understanding of medical conditions, leading them to exclude a genuine health concern from their supposed coverage.

 I discourage anyone from entrusting their beloved pets' well-being to Embrace Pet Insurance, as their deceptive practices and lack of accountability make them an unreliable and unscrupulous choice.

text:
My son's cat, for whom I pay the insurance premium, was given a permanent exclusion with a diagnosis of anxiety which doesn't exist in his medical record.   
To make his visits to the veterinary clinic Fear Free, he was prescribed gabapentin to be given prior to veterinary visits.   A letter of appeal was submitted by the prescribing veterinarian to explain the situation but this was not given any merit. 
Pre-visit gabapentin is a very common practice and should in no way be linked to a diagnosis of anxiety.   I'm very disappointed by the interpretation of the medical records review and spent nearly an hour on the phone talking to staff at Embrace.

text:
Dear Pet Owners,

I am writing this review to share my unfortunate experience with Embrace Pet Insurance and to caution prospective customers about potential challenges with their services. My aim is to provide an honest account of the issues I encountered with the company.

After our beloved 8-year-old Shih Tzu dog fell ill and required emergency care, we faced an $800 out-of-pocket expense as our previous pet plan did not cover such situations. To ensure better coverage for future incidents, we decided to explore other pet insurance options and settled on Embrace due to their endorsement by USAA. We enrolled our dog into their program and dutifully submitted all of her medical records for their review.

Approximately four months ago, our dog received a misdiagnosis of a mass in one of her eyes, leading us to consult an eye specialist. Fortunately, the diagnosis was found to be incorrect, and our dog was diagnosed with a yeast infection around the eye area instead. We promptly submitted our claim, only to be informed that it would not be covered due to a preexisting condition. Despite our dog requiring several follow-up visits, each incurring $180 in expenses, our claims were consistently denied on the same grounds.

In an effort to resolve the matter, we sought our veterinarian's professional opinion during one of our appointments, and they confirmed that the condition our dog experienced was unrelated to the preexisting condition cited by Embrace for the denials. To bolster our appeal, the veterinarian provided supporting documentation affirming the distinction between the two conditions. However, despite our efforts, we were met with a generic response from Embrace, persisting that our dog's coverage would not be extended due to the alleged preexisting condition.

Our frustration grew as subsequent communications with Embrace remained unyielding, and we reached out to express our concerns about their stance. Regrettably, we received a standardized, unaltered response, leading us to question the company's customer service, communication, and overall policies.

As a result, we find ourselves locked into a year-long contract with Embrace, obligating us to continue paying the monthly fee of $70 despite our dissatisfaction with the service provided. Our family invested in a product that has not delivered as expected, leaving us disappointed with the entire experience.

In conclusion, I earnestly advise prospective pet owners to think twice before considering Embrace Pet Insurance. While we initially hoped for a positive and reliable experience, our journey with the company has left us dissatisfied with their policies and the level of service received.

I hope this review serves as a valuable reference during your research for suitable pet insurance companies. We believe it is crucial to make informed decisions when it comes to protecting our beloved animal companions.

Sincerely,

John

Received this response on August 17, 2023 from Embrace regarding our negative experience.  My response to their response is...
WE HAVE ALREADY BEEN DOWN THAT ROAD...Several emails regarding rejected claim(s) (plural) with questions about denials were sent and were always replied to with canned responses stating 'pre-existing condition'.  We pointed out what the veterinarian scribed in the Dr.s notes stating otherwise and were still denied any reimbursement.  My advice to anyone considering Embrace as their choice for pet insurance is if you are transferring to Embrace with any kind of medical history on your pet, go elsewhere. I may as well be holding $70 dollars over a candle flame every month and get the same results.

text: I wrote a review before I got my claims reviewed. I mentioned how easy it was to start the claim and how responsive they were at first. I had 7 claims due to an unfortunate week for my puppy were we started with a possible leg injusry and x-rays and ended having bladder and urethra surgery, thousands of dollars. I was  ready for the expected run-around and request for "more information", "more paper work", "time to review" and not having access to the funds (which insurance or not, my puppy would have gotten his care no question about it), requiring mayor life adjustments. 1 week later my claims were still waiting to be in review status, I sent an email requesting an update and the response I got back 5 days later was not what I expected. Five (5) of my seven (7) claims were resolved and approved for reimbursement! 1 week later 5 claims were already reimbursed. No not, the ones with the lowest ammount, surprisngly as it might be, maybe a coinsidence, but the highest amount claims were paid first! (1 claim alone was over 8,000 USD!!) A week later claim number six (6) was paid, there was a delay because of me submitting the recepit, but not the itemized one (instructions say to do so, I failed at that). The last claim, which was one with one of the lower amounts took a little bit to get resolved. Somehow the receipt kept getting "lost" or could not be found. After several emails to the general assistance mailbox I was surprised that I was contacted directly by a case manager asking me to correspond with her directly and she talk to me on Friday, Wednesday morning I had the reimbursement in my account. I will definetely recomend Embrace and my experience was not perfect but was way above and beyond what I expected and I did not even waited a month to have thousands of dollars reimbursed. I have told the story to family members that have other insurers and they even asked me to see the emails, they could not beleive how fast an easy it was! I am definetly glad I chose them.
title: I wrote a review before I got my claims reviewed...

text: Embrace has exceptional coverage and customer service.  We purchased insurance for our dog when she was just a puppy and luckily she was very healthy for a long time.  I even considered canceling so many times because she was so healthy and I thought we were wasting money.  I am so thankful we kept it!  At 8 years old she was diagnosed with Type I diabetes.  The initial testing to confirm the diagnosis and rule out other issues was quite expensive and everything was covered.  Additionally, we had the constant costs of insulin, syringes, a blood glucose monitor & testing strips, sharps containers and periodic emergency visits for concerns relating to her diabetes.  EVERYTHING was covered and claims were processed quickly and easily.  On top of this, a year after her diagnosis she developed a tumor in her mouth which had to be removed.  She had to have about an inch and a half of her bottom front jaw removed to get rid of all the tumor.  This was about $5500 just for the surgery and again all of it was covered.  Even though the surgery went well and she recovered quickly, just 3 months later she stopped eating.  We initially thought it was pancreatitis (as a result of her diabetes) and all of the testing, treatment, etc did not help.  She spent 3-4 days at the vet's office with them doing everything they could to help her.  During an ultrasound, they discovered a mass on her spleen which turned out to be lymphoma. At this point we had to make the decision to let her go peacefully but the cost of the previous weeks trying to help her were quite high. Once again, EVERYTHING was covered.  Knowing this throughout all of these ordeals made it so easy for us to do whatever we needed to help her without worry of a sudden and unexpected costs to us. Thank you Embrace for making the process SO easy for us and providing us the peace of mind to help our girl in every way we possibly could.
title: Canine diabetes and cancer

text:
This is the only pet insurance I have had, but my experience with them has been wonderful! I did a lot of research before deciding on Embrace and a big reason I decided to go with them is because I saw many reviews saying that they generally reimbursed well. As with most of you reading this, I did not want to pay a pet insurance for months only to find out that when the time came, there were a bunch of loopholes for them to avoid reimbursement.

I started with them at the end of 2021 and was so glad I did because a few months later one of my dogs began having a lot of health issues. The hospital bill ran into the thousands and Embrace covered almost all of it. 
They review claims quickly and have a quick turnaround for reimbursement. They also have great customer service and respond quickly if you have any follow up questions. Only thing to keep in mind is that you do have to pay out of pocket first and then will receive the reimbursement either through a check in the mail or direct deposit.

Regarding some pre-existing conditions, some of them (for example periodontal disease or anal sac impaction) expire once your pet receives treatment for it (e.g., dental cleaning, anal gland expression) so even if they initially did not cover a claim for this reason, it became eligible for reimbursement after the first time they receive treatment for it.

I have been extremely happy with this insurance and I strongly recommend it for you and your pups :)
title: Highly recommend!!

Needless to say, the ER visit, the vet the next day, and the surgery a week later, added up to about 10k total. I submitted each claim as I received the invoices, and Embrace was there to help every step of the way. Everything was covered from the X-rays, to the surgery. Not having to worry about money made this (already) stressful event, a little less stressful. I didn’t even need to pick up the phone or send an email. I used the app, took 2 minutes to fill out a very easy to use claim, and had the money in my account a few days later. I was very close to not getting pet insurance, but I am VERY happy I did, and I’m even more happy that I went with Embrace.

text:
As a fellow veteran I signed with Embrace through a tiny discount they offered for military/retired. - Should of never happened. 

I am writing this review to share my utterly dissatisfying experience with Embrace Pet Insurance for my beloved 3-year-old cat. Trust me when I say that this is one company you should avoid at all costs. Not only did they demonstrate a complete lack of understanding regarding my cat's health, but they also cunningly labeled common conditions as permanent pre-existing conditions. Allow me to elaborate on my nightmarish journey with Embrace.

First and foremost, my cat developed chin acne, a relatively common and easily treatable condition 11 months ago which completely disappeared a month later.  However, when I submitted a claim for his ear infection  issue, Embrace shockingly saw fit to classify it as a permanent pre-existing condition. (To not cover his ear infection claim) Chin acne, really? How can an insurance provider deem a temporary skin condition as permanent? It became abundantly clear that Embrace was determined to avoid covering anything related to my cat's well-being from the start. When the vet saw this they nearly had a heart attack. They told me to part ways immediately. 

Adding insult to injury, Embrace went on to claim that my cat had another permanent pre-existing condition—periodontal disease. The audacity! My cat, who is only 3 years old and as healthy as ever, does not have periodontal disease. I literally have medical documents and the word of my trusted veterinarian to back this up. Yet Embrace turned a blind eye to this evidence, refusing to acknowledge the truth and using it as an excuse to deny coverage.

Embrace's blatant disregard for factual medical records and their tendency to classify every minor issue as a permanent pre-existing condition is a clear indication of their unethical practices. It is evident that their primary goal is to collect premiums without providing any meaningful coverage for our beloved pets.

Throughout my interactions with Embrace, their customer service was abysmal. They were unresponsive, dismissive, and lacked empathy. It felt as if they were intentionally trying to discourage me from pursuing my rightful claims. Dealing with Embrace only added to the stress and frustration of dealing with my cat's health issues.

In conclusion, I strongly advise against purchasing Embrace Pet Insurance. Their unfair classification of common and treatable conditions as permanent pre-existing conditions, along with their refusal to acknowledge legitimate medical evidence, showcases their true colors. Save yourself the headache, disappointment, and financial loss by seeking out a reputable pet insurance provider that values transparency, fairness, and the well-being of your furry companions. Embrace Pet Insurance is an absolute letdown and should be avoided at all costs. 

Thank god ive only been with them for like 3 months. 


***Also they are not crystal clear with what they cover. A simple exam that appeared to be covered in the beginning was denied because “I didnt initially sign up with the wellness rewards” - They manipulate the way they advertise/market.

I hope nobody else has a similar experience with mine.
title: A COMPLETE NIGHTMARE EXPERIENCE

text: I could write a soliloquy on the hoops I’ve had to jump through with this company. Quite honestly, if you can afford to pay for this monthly premium, you can afford to pay out of pocket for any care a healthy animal would receive. It would be far less expensive and void of the headache of dealing with them. You’re required to submit certain documents in order to even get the insurance, including a full medical history, plus a new physical exam for your pet in order to secure the insurance. So why they need all of this information submitted with every single claim is beyond me! It is a hassle to you and to the vet because they literally have it all on file. But why do they do it; to delay, delay, delay and ultimately to place on hold or deny any illness claims you submit. When asked where are the documents, you’ll never receive a response. It’s never a hassle for them to take your money, but always one when it’s time for them to pay up. I’d never recommend them for illness coverage. You’ll be paying them and the medical bills, when you can just pay the medical bills, because you’ll never see a dime back from them. The wellness prevention package is worth it because it’s basically like a loan of your money upfront. But guess what; that’s an add on service so you can’t purchase it without the illness coverage. This company deserves to be sued because they are in no way fulfilling their duties and are misleading their services to get your money. Don’t waste your time or energy. You’ll regret it. I certainly did. And so does my dead cat.
title: They Deserve To Be Sued For False Advertising

text:
Pet insurance is something you never hope you have to use.  However if your pet is your "child" and truly part of your family, then having insurance for them is a necessity.  Too many times have I been in an emergency vet clinic and seen pet parents face an agonizing decision for their fur baby when it comes to a  financially devastating expense for treatment. I never wanted to be in that situation.  

Insurance is a necessary evil.  It's better to have it and not need it, than to need it and not have it as the saying goes.  So having a reputable and competent provider is a must.  Embrace is that company.  Their affiliation with USAA gives you confidence that they are a legitimate service provider.  Their website is user friendly.  Their customer service is friendly (and U.S. based from what I have experienced) You can customize your policy to fit your pet(s) needs.  You can tweak your policy to get a premium/deductible that works for your budget.  Claims are straightforward and easy enough to submit.  

Bottomlime, Embrace is an all around great company.  I checked out many others before settling on them a few years ago.  Since then I have been perfectly happy with them.  They give you peace of mind when it comes to something as stressful as pet insurance.  I would fully reccomend them other pet parents!
title: Peace of Mind Pet Insurance

text: I just signed up for embrace pet insurance for my new puppy.  I just submitted my first claim today and it was extremely easy.  I haven’t reached my annual deductible yet but I’m sure they pay you back in a timely fashion, once you do meet it.  They have a lot of options to choose from too… you can choose your annual deductible, annual reimbursement limit, and your reimbursement percentage.  You also have the option for exam fees and prescription drugs.  Depending on how you make your annual plan these add-on’s are cheap and worth it. The only thing that I have found annoying is that I’m still waiting to hear back about a name change I requested twice. Other than that, everything is great

text: Great insurance plan for emergencies, sudden illnesses and accidents. So far, I have been reimbursed for all emergency visits that I have submitted claims for. The Key is to get insurance for your dog/ puppy as soon as possible when they are still healthy, as that way, you will not be denied for conditions that may develop later in the life of your dog. If you wait until there is a sickness or emergency, those will be considered as pre-existing conditions (just like any insurance policy) and any sickness related to pre-existing conditions will not be covered. So do the wise thing and get Embrace insurance as soon as you get your pet. We chose to go with Embrace in particular because of the excellent reviews for claims settlements and their comprehensive coverage.

text:
Pros:(Cats)
- Online claims submission.
- Accept cats of all ages.
- Offer extra services.
- Pay for routine dental cleaning.
-Coverage starts fast.
- Excellent customer service by7 phone.
-Get a refund check via mail.

Cons:
-Frustrating online claims systems have always left me no choice but to email in my claim.
- Must have a very thorough explanation of services accompanying the claim.
- Do not pay for prescription pet foods.
- Preexisting conditions reduce certain coverage.

Advice:
Submit multiple pet claims at least 4 days apart or else the pet's claims may get assigned the same claim number and one will appear as a duplicate claim.
title: Pros and Some Cons to Consider

text:
Let me start by requesting for no response from the frauds getting paid to rebuttal on every negative review. You are happily getting overpaid with the money Embrace steals from their customers. They denied me but said if I could have the vet send an email to confirm the previous appointment had nothing to do with her illness diagnosis from a year ago!!! I, unfortunately, could not afford the vet bills(hence the point of insurance)… or Atleast I thought. text:
I’m not a fan. I paid it for 16 months because I didn’t have the cash available should something serious happen. But my first experience submitting claims was ridiculous. They asked for access to all of my 3 dogs medical records then listed everything that they’ve been seen for as a pre-existing condition. For example - One of my dogs had had diarrhea so they listed stomach trouble as pre-existing and said she wouldn’t be covered for future diarrhea. No, one round of diarrhea does not make a pre-existing condition. My vet agreed that just because they’d been seen for various issues in the past, those issues were treated and didn’t require ongoing care. As such, they weren’t pre-existing conditions. My vet offered to do the documentation for all 3 dogs but I didn’t bother. Between not covering routine care & then the pre-ex bs, I knew that I wouldn’t buy indefinite coverage. 

I purchased coverage from spring 2022-June 2023.
title: I’m not a fan

text:
Last fall, our vet told us that our German shepherd, Ava was very overweight (129 pounds). He said that if she didn’t lose weight, she could develop a lot of health problems. We started walking her right away.  We also adjusted her diet.  However, our cold and snow season started early.  The vet told us about their rehabilitation program of hydrotherapy sessions that would help her lose weight.  After 5 months of hydrotherapy sessions, our dog has lost 40 pounds and is now at a healthy weight.
This would never have been financially possible without the insurance that we have through Embrace.  We are beyond grateful for the insurance process:  the ease of filing claims, the quick direct deposit reimbursements, and the excellent customer service that the staff at Embrace provide.  The insurance that they provide gives us reassurance that we can always access the best care for our furry family.  Thank you, Embrace!!!
title: A healthier dog thanks to Embrace!!!

text:
I gave them a 1 star because they denied EVERY claim I submitted due to pre-existing conditions.  I decided to cancel my policy after I submitted them a claim to have my dog's ears flushed out because he somehow got dirt and debris in his ears.  Unfortunately, he has a history of ear infections, which the vet treats by putting medicine in his ears.  This particular visit to the vet about his ears was not an infection, but Embrace did not cover it.  Plus, I had never submitted a claim to them for this type of visit because this is the first time he was ever treated for dirt/debris in his ears.  This is the response I got from Embrace:

"Accident or Illness Claim: I am sorry to inform you that the diagnosis provided to us by your veterinarian for this claim is not covered under your policy because a dermatologic condition, allergic dermatitis, was noted in the medical records on 4/6/21, which was prior to the policy purchase. This makes dermatologic conditions (including but not limited to debris in ear canal) pre-existing. Based upon the pre-existing condition, coverage is not available for the claim presented.

I understand that this email does not bring you good news. If you feel I am incorrect in my assessment and have additional information for me to review (such as additional doctor's notes or a statement from your veterinarian), I am happy to reopen Lucky's claim. If you could send me any additional information in the next 14 days, I would be happy to take a look."

I did not bother filing an appeal because at that point I decided to look elsewhere.

text: Customer service is very courteous. I adopted my puppy at 4 months and this is my third policy to cancel and she’s only 15 mo old. Lots of jumping through impossible hoops. No reimbursement. We live in a rural setting. She has never been injured. The problem is my vet does not use SOAP notes. The vet does provide medical records but not in the form all insurances require. FINALLY! This customer service made that clear. I can never have my pet claims reimbursed for a reason I learned after a year of premiums. We love our dog and our vet. The insurance constraints make her uncoverable. We hope to have her for years. Very frustrating as no one told me the SOAP requirement but gladly took my money. I had to research vet procedural requirements and contact my rural but wonderful vet to determine the problem. ASK YOUR VET AND YOUR PROSPECTIVE INSURANCE BEFORE YOU PAY FOR INSURANCE. Our pet is not uninsurable because of an unspoken requirement. 1) Your vet is an amazing  practitioner but does not conform to the insurance software/paper compliance. You won’t ever receive reimbursement. 2) Your insurance company will not tell you up front that the SOAP medical records system is mandatory. Handwritten or typed medical records are useless to an insurance company. My beloved pet’s life and future pain unimportant to the insurance company because of our rural location. 3) What exemption will you discover? Having paid all her premiums timely, they were for naught. I suppose insurances will require Electronic Medical Records next. Which will truly be absurd. My pet is uninsured despite our efforts and great care. Buyer beware! Wasted money. No security for my girl. All because of paper compliance. I didn’t know to ask about SOAP to either vet or insurance company. I can guarantee you the vet prices will be higher if specific software is demanded. I’ve wasted far too much time on this already. My pet is still at risk! 4) Embrace did refund my first premium but I was not informed of SOAP requirements until I educated myself. The Fetch and Pumpkin companies continued taking my money while not paying claims. They never told me SOAP was mandatory. I educated myself and asked Embrace directly. Otherwise I may be in the same pay for nothing vicious circle.
title: Ask about SOAP notes or waste your time and money while your pet is not the main concern.

text: Although it's never good to have an ill pet, Embrace was there to help along the way. Don't mistake the process - there are still precautions you have to take out to ensure you're getting help (keeping up to date on records, immunizations and documentation), but once reviewed, they were able to help with some of the hospital bills.
title: Embrace was there

text:
Embrace Pet Insurance is highly rated all over the web, and they are even a chosen partner of USAA (of which we are members). They give multi-pet discounts and were recommended the best deal for my aging dog. What looked promising on the outside differs from that once you are a member of this company. They will go to whatever lengths necessary to question and deny your claims. I would not recommend this company to anyone who has ever taken their pet to a veterinarian and/or has any kind of medical history. Health conditions that seem unrelated? They will dig through your pet’s medical history, find a connection, and refuse to reimburse you. 

I had a 10-month-old puppy for whom I enrolled with Embrace at six months. He swallowed a squeaker a few weeks ago. I took him for scans and imaging, which were inconclusive. But we knew after an exhaustive search of our home he ate it, and we saw him eat it. Embrace refused to cover these items because I had taken my puppy in for vomiting before signing up for Embrace, which was labeled a “temporary pre-existing condition” for one year. Because he swallowed a foreign body and was vomiting due to it, any treatment was considered a “pre-existing temporary condition.” Just this week, an endoscopy located the squeaker, they removed it surgically, and now I have to go back and dispute that initial exam that involved x-rays and imaging. I’m also crossing my toes and fingers that they will cover the removal of the squeaker and not find that he has a “temporary pre-existing condition” of being a puppy who swallows stuff. 

This week, we had to take my six-year-old dog in for lethargy and not eating. I submitted the claim, and now they are doing a review of her medical history 12 months before signing up her up for Embrace. I’m sure they will find something. They must have thousands of adjusters locked up in a big warehouse somewhere pouring over pet medical records. Yes, these claims may eventually all be covered, but I’ve spent a lot of time and heartache requesting letters from vets, asking they follow up with Embrace, and on the phone with Embrace. Even if they are covered, I will likely return to Healthy Paws, which I wish I had never left. 

Moral of this story: Unless your puppy just came out of the womb, don’t go with Embrace.
title: Unless your puppy just came out of the womb don't go with Embrace

text: Quick and efficient process. Easy to navigate the Embrace website and submit my claim. Response and reimbursement happened within a week or two. Thanks!
title: Quick and efficient process

text: We have covered our pets with Embrace Pet Insurance for years.  They are absolutely wonderful to deal with, make submitting claims very easy and reimbursement is prompt!  They remind me of Amica in terms of their customer service!
title: Great Pet Insurance

text: It was VERY easy to prepare and submit a claim...I was impressed.
title: My First Claim Submission

text: So far this Embrace has been very easy to work with. Submitting claims through their app is extremely easy and their response time very quick. I highly recommend this company.
title: Great Company

text: While the claim submission process was pretty easy and communication was clear, I was extremely disappointed to learn that one of our claims was denied because they deemed a symptom that can occur in subsequent illnesses/episodes to be a pre-existing condition.  So because our puppy had diarrhea when he first came to us (like most new puppies do), any illness with diarrhea as a presenting symptom is now being denied as pre-existing.  Convenient way of getting out of paying for claims.
title: Be careful of pre-existing condition exclusions

text: I have been a client of Embrace for a number of years now, I have always had the best of experiences when having to work with them during difficult and emotional times. Just like human health insurance, you don't contact them just to say "Hi!," you contact them when there are issues. The agents and staff at Embrace are some of the nicest people that I have had the pleasure of doing business with. They are empathetic, quick to respond, and very helpful. The prices are reasonable too.  Like many insurance companies, I'm sure they get a bad rap as Insurance companies are easy to attack, especially if one doesn't understand the foundations of risk and cost avoidance that underly the reasons and cost of having insurance. Embrace has been very easy to work with on those times that we needed help with the expensive costs that come with keeping our little furry friends healthy. Embrace agents are also very empathetic, especially when the health news is dire, and this isn't fake caring, they really care. I highly recommend Embrace to anyone with a pet, who wants to make sure they can afford to move forward with those hard medical decisions that may come up during the lifetime of your pet.
title: Excellent and honorable caring company

text:
People complain about things not being covered. 

READ what coverage you are buying BEFORE you purchase. 

I have been with Embrace for over 15 years and have not had a bad experience. One dog needed an MRI on his head which was nearly $6,000 - they paid 80%. Another dog needed spinal surgery which was nearly $12K - they paid 80%. The current dog needed emergency care - they paid 80%. In all instances I was reimbursed within 14 days. 

Read what you are buying so you won't be surprised. They have been fantastic for us.
title: Have had a great experience over the last 15 years.

text: Basically nothing will covered - expect everything to be denied. There is no true coverage, you will get reimbursed practically for the same amount of insurance you are paying for. Review your policy in detail prior to paying for anything. The process not complicated if you follow the instructions. But if you pet has any type of true need for insurance, other than the standard check ups, you will end up paying for it all out of pocket with this company.
title: Expect everything to be denied

text: I could not be happier with my Embrace claim experience. My 5-month-old Corgi puppy ingested a small amount of antifreeze last month. Thankfully, I got her to the emergency hospital immediately and they were able to save her life. The hospital bill was $4200+. Embrace approved all claims and paid them quickly, enabling me to, in turn, pay the charges on my credit card without incurring any interest charges. The claims submission process is easy and fast, and they pay promptly. My Embrace coverage is a sound investment.
title: I could not be happier with my Embrace claim experience.

text:
I have insured our Cavaliers , an 11YO, 7YO, and 2 1/2 YO brother and sister, since the stork brought them as puppies.
When an unexpected, major, life threatening, medical issue arose with the oldest , BLESS EMBRACE, for their veterinary consultants knowledge, immediate response with an approval, and reasonably quick reimbursement, during the diagnostic and surgical phases. I only wish they incorporated direct pay as a policy.
If your breed has known medical issues that you have to be vigilant for, and despite using an ethical breeder who have AKC CERTIFICATIONS going back generations, any moderate to very serious issue, will cost 4-5 figures to treat. Their 90%, $15K policies, is a life saver when that unexpected issue occurs!. I can’t begin to tell you how many times I’ve heard dog owners say, “ I had to put him/her to sleep, because I couldn’t afford the simpke, that can costx4 figures, , but lifesaving, treatment, because I didn’t have insurance”….translated as, “I didn’t want another monthly expense.” Yes, a measly monthly expense, that doesn’t even come close to what you throw out on pure none sense, every month.
title: Bless Embrace Ins Co!

text: After canceling I was assured that I would receive a full refund. I have not received my refund.
title: After canceling my account was charged.  I called and was told I would receive a full  refund. I have not received it.

text: I've used Embrace for years.  Their terms are pretty standard, their customer service is outstanding, their representatives are very nice to work with and conscientious.
title: Embrace Embrace

text: They find loopholes to get out of paying for claims that should be reimbursed. Nearly every claim comes back denied, even if my policy clearly states it should be covered. They consistently tell me they cannot get ahold of my veterinary office when I know this is not true. They use this as an excuse to not provide reimbursement even when I have proof that my vet responds to them promptly and gives them everything they need. Their definition of pre-existing conditions is a joke. My vet says they see Embrace deny more claims than other companies. I wish I would have asked them or done more research before choosing Embrace. Big lesson learned, I highly advise against going with this company. Read the reviews on Better Business Bureau for more accurate reviews.
title: Wish I had done more research.

text:
On 6/15/23, my Service Dog was seen at an Animal Emergency for a foreign body ingestion. I was advised by my claims adjuster, Taylor VanCamp that my claim had been approved in writing (attached) with the breakdown of payments and Explanation of Benefits at approximately 2:41pm PST. Please note, however, that I am highly perplexed after just received yet another email from Ms. Taylor VanCamp (after being advised that she was not in the office today) advising me that my claim is now "Pending", after receiving an Approval email yesterday indicating my claim for Cammi's foreign body ingestion has been paid and that I would receive said reimbursement within two (2) days. I am attaching this Approval email from 6/15/23 for your reference as well. 

I was then told by Ms. Jenna Mahan that Embrace can “correct their error” to start this process again even after I was advised my claim was approved and refunded the claim costs. At this time, I must once again request this matter's immediate attention and resolution, as I have been attempting to reach Ms. VanCamp via telephone this morning as well as Ms. Jenna Mahan -- to no avail thus far. As such and as previously advised, this matter remains grossly unresolved and time-urgent, and I must request said matter's resolution as soon as possible, as I pursue the aforementioned assistance with media Consumer Protection Advocates to ensure that my rights are protected, and that my beloved Service Dog's coverages are honored in full and urgently. It is utterly appalling and unacceptable that this company would approve my claim in writing and then renege on this — meriting urgent resolution and full approval of said claim prior to all aforementioned actions. These insurance companies need to be held accountable for this abuse of its paying customers and I request urgent resolution as a result of the distress caused by this neglect. Thank you kindly in advance once again for your expedient attention to this ongoing and highly distressing matter, and I look forward to speaking at your earliest convenience to ensure this matter's full resolution and closure.
title: A very regrettable experience !

text:
WORST COMPANY EVER!!!
I was with ASPCA insurance (the best) but went with embrace because they offered a promotion for military families. I had 8 pets at the time so insurance was getting costly. 
One of my pigs started getting sick, took her to the vet turned out she had diabetes (new onset) submitted claims to them & all claims were denied. 
They said because I took her to the emergency the year before for what turned out to be gas, (vet said she probably got into something she shouldn’t have at that visit records clearly show no medical history & not on any medications) that it was related to diabetes! I fought with them for almost a year & they wouldn’t budge! Now my baby is sick with no coverage! 
I immediately canceled all of my other pets & went back to ASPCA insurance. 
STAY CLEAR OF EMBRACE!!
title: WORST COMPANY EVER!!!

They gaslight you into it being your fault that you are asking to get a bill covered despite paying their premium every month on time since the cats were barely 10 weeks old.
Embrace your wallet and time because they will be sure to take a lot of both and make you feel like you purposefully made your cats sick and shame you for going to get routine care for them.

Response to their reply: it’s an automated response that they copied and pasted from other users with similar issues. It doesn’t address specifically their denial.

text: I have had Embrace Insurance for about 6 years on 2 of my rottweilers. I have catastrophic insurance & dental only with a 1000.00 deductible, reduced to 750.00 w 2 pets. I recently had my 10 yr old female develop a vaginal discharge & acting lethargic. Took her in for an ultrasound & they found a large mass attached to her uterus which required surgery. Luckily they got it all & it was benign. Embrace without any problems paid 90% of her bills minus the deductible within about a week. After never needing them for almost 6 yrs I had to question how much push back I would get & honestly it went very smooth. Submitted all my bills online & they followed through. It was quite a large bill as surgery & 2 ultra sounds with a lung x-ray does add up. The only part they didn't pay for was her medication at the onset as I don't have medication coverage. Although they did pay for the oral meds during her surgery & her nights stay at the hospital for observation which I feel is important as bringing a dog home 5 hrs., after a major surgery to me is not wise. The only thing I wish is they didn't limit you to 10,000.00 a yr per pet by the policy you choose, 10,000.00 seems like a lot until you experience something like this. With the price of vet costs I think the limits should be higher depending on certain circumstances. Other than that I highly appreciate their promptness & concern for the pets.

text: 2nd dog I’ve insured…first with Embrace.  They denied a preventative dental cleaning because she has “some” tartar and a luxating patella (loose knee/hip joints). They said those “pre-existing conditions” meant she wasn’t covered for the preventative teeth cleaning.  I disputed the relevance of hip joints to teeth and even “some” tartar.  Her joints have nothing to do with her teeth.  Some Tartar is found on every dog bar none.  They they said I filed the claim with the wrong part of the company?  I said…I filed a claim…your job is to make sure it gets to the proper people in the company.  Rather than argue, I cancelled as the whole reason for denial was absurd.  I cancelled and will go with someone else.
