text: I took my dog into the vet for vaccines and a check up and they discovered she needed to have two teeth extracted and a lump mass removed. I sent the estimate for this procedure over to Embrace to be pre-certified and they told me over $2,000 of the procedure estimate was approved for coverage. I proceeded with the procedure and when I submitted my invoice after the procedure, Embrace only refunded me a quarter of the amount they originally told me. I contacted Embrace twice after receiving the news about my low refund and they told me someone would get back to me with the details the next business day, no one did. No one can explain to me why they told me one amount and then refunded me something completely different. I sent Embrace another email outlining my experience with the coordinating claim numbers, amounts, details, etc. and haven’t heard anything back. I just keep receiving emails to review my experience, which I was waiting to do in hopes that Embrace would resolve this before I had to leave a poor review but they did not. This is incredibly disappointing, I don’t know why I pay for insurance for my dog when it doesn’t do much. Embrace is not a trustworthy company.
title: Misinforms their customers

I adopted a puppy and purchased Embrace pet insurance in Jan '23. From Apr 5th through May 9th, I submitted 3 claims, May 9th being surgery. On May 11th, all payments were deposited into my checking account! It took a little while to get the 1st claim going as they had to go through verifications and history with my vet. I was being kept informed of the progress throughout the process. I was quite shocked and impressed that I was reimbursed for the surgery 2 days after it was performed!
Their telephone customer service is phenomenal as is their update communication via email and portal.
Thank you Embrace !!

text: We are very satisfied with Embrace. Customer service has always been friendly and helpful, but the real test of an insurance company is if they pay and Embrace has been exceptional. We chose a high deductible plan (just for serious issues) to keep costs down. Other plans I researched weren’t as flexible and cost more. Cancer turned up in one of our cats which involved two surgeries so far. Embrace kicked in after we reached the deductible and we received the checks promptly. Initially it took awhile for Embrace to get the initial (pre-existing conditions) paperwork from our vet, but since then we submit the invoices online without issue. I will always get basic pet insurance for all our adopted cats from now on, and Embrace is my first choice. Highly recommended.

When I inquired about the discrepancy between the confirmation email I received in December versus the new communication, all I got was the run around. I was charged interest on my credit card twice because of the delay in process. They also provided a fax and email address for claims documents to be sent and upon faxing, they stated nothing had been received. At the end of these policy periods, I will definitely NOT be renewing with Embrace. It has been such a headache and so frustrating!

text: If I could put a minus star on this company I would. I insured my dogs with no pre-existing conditions (except for seasonal allergies for our boy dog) and they were receiving excellent and regular vet care from the top rated vet practice in our city. My girl got a ruptured disc and had to have very expensive surgery, along with medications and special equipment post surgery. We were so relieved that we had pet insurance. You could have scraped us off the floor when our claim was denied. They said our dog had an "UNDIAGNOSED pre-existing condition" Our vet couldn't believe it. She sent letters, e-mailed and called multiple times telling them and proving that this was not something that could be considered pre-existing. We appealed three times and each time they denied it. Be aware. . .they do not have Vets in their company to review medical information. So the people that are looking these claims are just everyday people off the street with no experience working with animals. My dog's breed is not known for having this condition. We took it to our State Insurance Board. After reviewing the information, they agreed with us that the condition could not have been pre-existing. Although they could not force Embrace to pay in our state, the investigator recommended it and the company again said no. The investigator recommended that we sue, and we probably will do just that, because we have compelling evidence that our dog did not have a pre-existing condition.  If you decide to use Embrace after this review, just know that they will worm out of every opportunity to pay for necessary and life saving surgery. Then you, after paying for insurance, will be left with a big bill that may take you a long time to pay off. It is hard to make the choice between saving your pet and knowing that you will be incurring debt that may affect you for a long time, even though you did the right thing and bought pet insurance that you thought would protect you. To be honest, it is my goal to tell every person about our awful experience with Embrace, so that they don't fall into the same trap that we did.
title: Has anyone heard of an "UNDIAGNOSED pre-existing" condition?

text: Though this review is from my April 19th experience, this is representative of what I have been dealing with Embrace Insurance. When we brought our 2-month old puppy home in June 2022, I made an error of filing a claim within the 14-day waiting period with this insurance. The puppy had loose motion from chewing something in his new home and the doctor gave medication for diarrhea. This was marked as a pre-existing condition and ever since, they keep applying this excuse to every claim we make similar to this. The dog never had any prior medical condition to be marked so. Even for this April 19th scenario, he had gastroentritis and doctor a medication to help with that. Embrace marked it as another diarrhea and now extended the waiting period. This has been frustrating and causing us to lose money. Myself and the dog's vet have tried to explain this but Embrace won't listen.
title: Misrepresentation of Pre-existing conditions

text: The claims procedure couldn't have been easier. You just submit the vet bill and a reason for the visit. We have a dog and two cats.  Over the last few years we have submitted minor claims which were always paid promptly. Then, in the Fall of 2022 one our cats went into kidney failure.  Our bill was $24K. After accounting for the co-pay (90%) and deductible ($500) Embrace promptly paid the claim. Needless to say we were delighted.  The reason we got pet insurance is because in the past I've had to do the gut wrenching calculus of how much my pet's life is worth versus how much I can afford, and I never again want to be put in that position again.

text: I've used Embrace Pet Insurance for years and they have always covered the expense. During COVID their reimbursement time was longer than normal, but now all claims are usually processed within 14 days or 10 business days. They sent flowers when me and my dog were hit by a pickup truck two years ago. Embrace is always there during Kona's severe IBD diagnosis, when he at 22 oz of raisins, when he got attacked by another dog and had his ear reattached. Embrace may be more expensive than other insurance companies, but they've stuck with me and Kona when we were dropped by other carriers because Kona was too expensive. As a puppy Kona had been severely abused and required extensive veterinary care and rehab. Embrace stepped up the plate. I wouldn't dream of going with another carrier. I wouldn't have my dog if it wasn't for Embrace always covering Kona's expenses and helping me with bills. I would have run out of funds a long time ago. In the 5 years since I adopted Kona, I've spent well in excess of 20K. Yesterday Kona had 3 lbs of socks surgically removed from his stomach and saved his life.
title: Having Embrace Pet Insurance has saved my dog's life

text:
Embrace is a scam. Make sure you read all the fine print. Days after my 12 week old puppy got a clean bill of heath from my vet, I decided to be safe and get insurance. I signed up online, purchased my policy, and my Embrace profile showed that my policy was active and I read that if my pup had any conditions, Embrace would get the medical records from my vet after I filed a claim online. Seemed easy enough. 

The following month, my puppy began urinating frequently. I took her into the vet, who said that my puppy hadn’t grown out of her loose puppy skin and it likely caused a UTI. When I filed a claim for medications, Embrace said that I hadn’t taken my puppy to the vet for an examination after purchasing their insurance, even though she had an examination just days prior, so they used that day’s examination as her initial examination. They determined that my puppy’s UTI was a pre-existing condition based on this technicality or, as I call it, one of their traps. Now if my puppy grows up and has any problems down there, although unrelated, it’s not going to be covered.

They would happily look at my puppy’s medical history if it benefited them, but they will exclude any previous evidence if they can. My puppy was just weeks old when she got her first exam! Nothing was pre-existing! Embrace knows it wasn’t a pre-existing condition, and they were taking my money while they were not insuring my pup.
title: Embrace is a scam

Because no pet insurance companies cover pre-exiting conditions, I feel like I'm stuck with them now because I'd have to start from square one with any other company. We're definitely stuck with them for a year, because I was given misinformation about the Wellness Rewards program. Be careful signing up for that because they can charge you for it if you want to cancel. I didn't even want it but the salesman upsold me and lied about it.

text:
For all of the problems I've had with this company, you'd think they'd stop sending me emails asking me to rate them. 

My 13 year old senior cat recently started showing signs of being ill so I ran her to the vet. Turns out she somehow ended up with an infection. 

I do my part on my end. She's listed with Embrace as a permanently healthy pet and I pay my premiums every month. I know I do because the only option to pay I have is for them to automatically take a payment off of a credit card and there is no way to change the payment date. So, all good on my end as the paying customer. 

I submitted the paperwork for her appointment that clear as day showed the date of her vet appointment was on Sunday, 4/16/2023. I submitted the paperwork to them the same day as the appointment, and the one thing they usually have done well is get the paperwork processed quickly. But up to Thursday I hadn't heard anything. So I called and asked, "Is there a problem with the documents I submitted?" and the girl said, "No. I'm looking at it. Everything looks good. There should not be a problem with your claim." 

This next morning I get an email from Embrace that Zeva's $237 infection claim was being denied because her vet appointment that took place *last* *Sunday* as of the day of this writing was more than 60 days ago. 

Again....

They were denying her claim because her vet appointment that took place *LAST* *SUNDAY* was somehow more than 60 days ago. 

Whomever processed her paperwork just didn't want to pay the claim. So they decided that her appointment that happened last Sunday actually happened on 4/16/*2021* and thus that's more than 60 days ago so they weren't going to pay it...and they were willing to risk that I was just going to take that.....that I was not going to stand up for my baby girl who is sitting at home with an infection. Why is this company offering pet insurance services if they don't want to help sick pets and their owners in emergencies like this? So I proceeded to light up someone over there and remind them that my insurance policy is a binding legal contract, so is the documentation that proves I was at the veterinarian’s office on 4/16/2023, not 4/16/2021 like they want it to be. The testimony from the people from the vets office backing me up that I was there on 4/16/2023 wouldn’t look great for them either. They do not get to alter reality to decide where I was and when so they would be wise to pay the claim. 

The guy looked at the documentation and was like, “Yea it clearly says 2023 on here." I was then told it would take another 15 days for it to process, again. But I got an email in about an hour that the claim had been approved in full…but not for the full amount. I was only getting back about $56 because they were taking out $175 for her deductible.

So, with this my full deductible is paid for her now...on top of being a permanently healthy pet and receiving my premiums on time every month. But, let’s see what excuse they try to find to not cover a legitimate claim until I call raising hell next time.
title: For all of the problems I've had with…

Now that my dog has had diarrhea will that not be covered since it is a PRE EXISTING CONDITION? Its not like my dog is sick all the time but when he gets sick he gets sick!  Just like a child.  So in my mind throwing up and diarrhea will never be covered.
title: Concern about Per Se "Pre Existing Condition"

text: Worst experience I ever had with a pet insurance company. They will deem everything as pre-existing even if the medical history says the opposite. The phone reps know zilch about insurance in general and tell you a claims adjuster will get back to you in 10-15 and sometimes 30 days and then it takes 3-6 months for claims to be reviewed. They even said my dogs diarrhea was pre-existing! Please stay away from this horrific company. They will make you jump through impossible hoops and provide medical history that doesn’t exist. Don’t get me started on the orthopedic report card, that’s a joke. 6 month waiting period and NOTHING is covered unless you get the form filled out. Adjusters are a literal joke and just send you automated messages. Save up, have an emergency fund and pay out of pocket for your pets. Or waste your money on pet insurance like I did.

That’s come and gone alongside 4 more conversions with representatives ensuring the sameness of my refund.  The real issue I have is that every month for 4 consecutive deductions of 122.96 they have continued automatically paying themselves but I still haven’t received a credit.  Just as recent as March 30th I contacted Embrace coincidentally reaching Kati she took a look at my account stated they noted it and sent it up for a refund process but couldn’t give me any explanation of why I am still being charged, She Spoke with her supervisor who said they would expedite this refund process….. Here I wait for now accumulated $400 that they have STILL NOT REFUNDED.

text: Avoid Embrace at all costs. My dog was a rescue, and over the course of her life, I paid Embrace over $5000 in premiums and only had two claims approved, for a total reimbursement of around $400. Even worse, I was told after the fact that one claim was approved in error. The reasons for denying claims are extremely shaky -- their adjusters will look for any anomaly in the dog's medical history or bloodwork and use it as a blanket denial for all subsequent claims for the rest of the dog's life. Due to a single anomaly on a blood test when my dog was 7 years old (that resolved on her next bloodwork), Embrace denied all claims relating to her digestive system because a symptom of the bloodwork anomaly was "nausea." This included vomiting and illness after ingesting a candy bar, which required emergency care. I appealed multiple times and was rejected at every turn. They made the process as difficult as possible, and they're more unpleasant to deal with than human health insurance companies, which is saying something. There is no circumstance in which I would ever recommend someone consider them for pet insurance.
title: Avoid Embrace at all costs

text: I would say, I really do like have the pet insurance so far they covered pretty much everything. However I will say I was beyond frustrated with a claim I had for my dog and they tried to tell me it was pre existing condition from 2021, when if you read his records his issue in 2023 was 100 percent not related in any way shape or form. They denied covered of the claim, and constantly asked for records when they already had them. I work in vet field. His condition was new and not pre existing I found it really obvious that they did not through his records carefully enough. It felt like a 2 to 3 month battle of going back and forth meanwhile waiting for my dog who is limping  and in pain to wait to proceed with medical treatment due to the wait on this claim I made. I felt as is they were trying to get out of his claim by comparing it to something he had in 2015. Then when I argued they said it was not considered pre existing in an email, then stated that it was. Little inconsistent  overall I am pleased I just found this particular situation very frustrating.
title: Overall good, minus this claim setback

text:
I’ve been with Embrace since 2019. Up until this experience, I had never used my plan. I feel like it is important to mention because, at one point last year, I questioned why I would continue to insure my 13-year-old dog. 

This year, it became clear. Embrace went above and beyond in ways I cannot explain. For several weeks, I thought I would not be able to afford a critical surgery for my dog. Embrace, and their employees, made it happen. 

It may have taken several years, but I’ll never forget what Embrace did for me. They did not behave like an insurance company. Instead, they treated me as a stressed out pet owner who needed a little extra help and understanding. 

Embrace enabled me to afford a surgery for my 13-year-old dog that otherwise I couldn’t logically spend on him. 

I believe they gave me a little more time with him. And that, is worth so much more than I can possibly describe… as I’m sure anyone reading this will understand.
title: Embrace Made All the Difference

text:
My dog was seen at a vet for a possible ear infection on 12/4/2021. He was treated and released. My dog was taken to the vet on 2/18/2023 and I was told he is not covered because there is a 12 month waiting period. The gaps between the 2 vet visits is approximately 15 months which is much longer than the 12 month waiting period. Embrace is saying he wont be eligible for coverage until 2/18/2024. 

Also, my dog has a small mass on his chest his whole life which is roughly the size of a dime. This mass has remained the same size his whole life. Embrace rep, told me since we dont have exact explanation of the cause of the mass, my dog is no longer covered for any time of cancer.

In all, avoid Embrace pet insurance at all cost. They lie, they deceive, and they dont uphold their policies. I dont understand how they are still in business.

Response to Embrace(3/24/2023)

I am posting this as a response to embraces comments since I cant respond directly. I just want to clarify that the response by Embrace is intended only to support their interests without any accurate information. I have purchased hygiene products from my vet for my dog's entire life. Whether it was ear cleaning liquid or toothpaste and because of this, they wont cover my dog. They handpick the facts which fit their interest and exclude the others. The dates referred by Embrace's response are hygiene product purchases because I couldn't buy the same products at my local Petco. It's normal upkeep and maintenance just like brushing their teeth and clipping nails. With Embrace's logic, if I continue to clean my dogs ears on a consistent basis then he's not covered, but if I stop and actually let them get infected, then he's covered. What kind of stupid nonsense is this? I am so glad they responded to my complaint because their response shows how fraudulent and incompetent they really are.
title: Very untrustworthy - they lie and deceive

title: Not worth the trouble and money

text:
I picked Embrace out of the pile at the recommendation of the shelter I adopted my dogs from. I have filed a half dozen or so claims for my older dog. Thus far, every significant claim I have filed resulted in a protracted period where I awaited response (at times longer than the 15 business day turnaround advertised), only to be told (erroneously) that my claim was denied due to the issue being a preexisting condition (which has been an incorrect assertion every time). These have been with different adjusters, so it’s puzzling that I’m seeing a pattern where the rationale is either fundamentally incorrect or they’re misinterpreting my dogs history. 

To make matters worse I am a human physician, so when the rationale doesn’t make any sense it’s straight forward for me to point it out. Yet only a few times has the decision reversed after my input. Other times they demand an appeal letter from the veterinarian to reconsider the decision, which most recently involved denying a claim because a preexisting condition was listed as one of ten potential explanations for an acute illness. Appeal letter writing is a tactic used by human insurance companies in the hopes that the doctor won’t have time or the patient will give up, which would be the equivalent of getting a bluff through in a game of poker and is functionally practicing medicine without a license. It makes me wonder how many Embrace customers accept claim decisions in good faith simply because they don’t have medical training. 
Thus far my experience has been frustrating due to delays and nonsense arguments from adjusters. Insurance is meant to be “peace of mind” and to protect those one values. Embrace advertises the letter of that sentiment but is quite brutally missing the spirit. Prospective buyers beware.
title: If you enjoy fighting for every claim, choose Embrace

I took my dog to the vet and told him I needed the health report for insurance. That’s  what the insurance broker had told me.
 I called Embrace’s customer service to ask them what I was supposed to do with the Health report now that I got it, and that person said there was an actual orthopedic report form that had to be completed by the vet? The person that sold me the policy did not tell me that.

text: I don't see how this company has gotten any 5 star ratings.  I went through them because of being a USAA member and i received crazy good discounts.  But like another client said they drag and draw out paperwork to the point it is frustrating.  I've been a member for close to a year and half and  between hearing, that issue is connected to a preexisting condition, you have not met your deductible amount, and oh that is part of our wellness plan.  I have a wellness plan already why do i need another.  All i wanted covered were my pups meds.  As another customer stated don't be fooled by the low rates. text: This company is horrible. The going rate for Embrace cat insurance is $15 - 25. They have the nerve to charge $72/mo. for one kitty! If you cancel, any treatments that they have sporadically paid for will then become pre-existing conditions that the next insurance company does not have to cover! Once there is a condition the pet has, they will refer to that condition and refuse to pay for things like cancer treatment, because there may be a “chance” the kitty’s condition caused the cancer or what ever the symptoms are. This is a legal scam that needs to be addressed, along with the obvious price gouging during a Pandemic. Insurance Commissioner, here I come. This challenge has been ongoing for three years of overpriced premiums and faulty claims copying equipment. Their equipment requires the processors to read blurry documents uploaded to their site unless the customer has the claim info professionally emailed. This costs more money!

text: My experience with Embrace started off well, with understanding and helpful customer service representatives and informative welcome packets. However, it quickly turned sour as my first claim took two months to process and then was denied. My claim was for a visit where my pet had not received a diagnosis at all, her tests came back negative and the reason for her illness remains unclear. Embrace, however, decided that because she had presented similar symptoms before my policy started, she is not eligible for reimbursement anytime these symptoms are present. I was paid $6 of an $840 claim because Embrace certified that *symptoms* were enough to confirm a preexisting condition that she was never diagnosed for by a licensed medical practitioner. After multiple calls and emails asking to appeal this decision Embrace closed my claim without further inquiry. I am extremely unhappy with their services and will not be returning after my first year's policy is complete.

text:
Our dogs and cats have been insured by Embrace for over a decade.  We currently have a senior lab/husky, one cat who is astonishingly the queen of the house at 20, and three other cats.  Embrace has insured other animals in the past, including a dog who we recently lost after an extremely difficult year.

Embrace has been an essential partner in insuring that our four-legged family receives excellent medical care. This company offers a choice in coverage and deductible.  We did not opt for the wellness coverage.  The traditional coverage also includes acupuncture, chiropractic, and integrative medicine care, all of which are increasingly mainstream and very effective care.  

The Embrace website is clear and very easy to use.  Phone calls have always been answered by friendly, knowledgeable, compassionate representatives who quickly respond to questions and obviously love animals.  Email provides the same excellent service.

Invoices are very easy to submit either via email, fax, mail, or a phone app.  I use the phone app exclusively now unless Embrace has a question that requires an email response.  Like the website, the app is easy to use and there’s an acknowledgement of receipt within a day.  Claims are processed quickly and reimbursements are made via direct deposit to our checking account within a few days.
title: Outstanding company

text: We adopted two cats in August and took them to the vet for a check-up just to make sure everything was okay. Fortunately, they were both in good health although the vet did detect a slight heart murmur in both cats. At the time of the examination, the vet informed us that this could be attributed to the stress of being taken out of their new home after they had just gotten used to us. (Fear that we might taking them back to the shelter) Sure enough, on subsequent visits, the heart murmur was no longer heard. In early January one of the cats started coughing. Usually just once a day, but just to be sure he was okay I took him to the vet. They did x-rays and gave him a shot for asthma. On the x-ray, they thought his heart looked a little enlarged so they recommended an echocardiogram. I knew this was an expensive test, but I thought, better safe than sorry and also felt at ease because I had Embrace pet insurance. Luckily the echo came back fine and the cough cleared up from the shot. What a relief! Well, until I found out the claim had been DENIED!!! After waiting over a month both claims were denied by Embrace because they declared him as having a pre-existing condition. Apparently, the heart murmur that no longer exists nullified the claims. My vet wrote a letter to Embrace assuring them that the heart murmur was "white coat syndrome" but they still denied the claim. Disappointment is an understatement for the way I feel about Embrace, not to mention the $1,500 bill that I am now stuck with paying. I would NOT recommend this company!!!!
title: Disappointed and feel duped!

text: I never got pet insurance for my furbabies before but, for some reason, I did when I rescued 2 cats in 2021. One of my boys started "coughing" in Spring of 2022, turns out he developed asthma. Embrace has been nothing but phenomenal as a pet insurance company. They review my claims and pay my share quickly. I have never had a pet with asthma before but am certainly happy I chose Embrace, they are a great partner in helping keep boys healthy. I have submitted 3 claims so far and they pay them promptly. I would highly recommend Embrace!

text: We have had embrace for a few years. We have already lost one dog and almost lost our new rescue. Embrace was very helpful in covering our VERY expensive emergency bills. There are a few catches you need to ensure though. Your dog needs to get to the vet asap to confirm a clean bill of health. It is very easy to end up with pre existing conditions that will never be covered. Second, the waiting period needs to be followed. Be a good pet parent and get your animals tested for EVERYTHING. Especially your rescues. If you get in front of things and are willing to pay out of pocket at first, embrace is fantastic. Between this and our care credit card, we were able to save our new doggo girl. Without it, unaffordable vet bills become euthanasia. Every time I call, they are pleasant. Pre certification was offered and quickly accepted in our case. Claim reviews did not take more than 2 days.

Although it took a couple more days than advertised to repay me for my cat's wellness expenses, Embrace did follow through with repayment on that. I was mostly pleased with that.

However,  Embrace took far longer than they advertised to fulfill claims (around 14 business days to process a claim). It actually took more than 30 business days due to required medical history reviews that I thought Embrace would have already requested and completed around the beginning of my policy.

Last week I reached out to the Embrace claim team asking for an update on why it was taking so long to get past the 'pending medical history' stage on my claims. The lady told me that they had still not received the records from one of the vets. I don't know why I was not informed beforehand that they had still not received them, as quite some time had past by then, but I reached out to the vet that day and made sure that the records were sent. 

The claims lady confirmed that she got them and ensured that she would have the adjuster expedite my claims. She said that they should be done by Friday night, if not that evening. They were not done until today.

After having to wait for over a month to get a resolution, I've been told today that Embrace will not cover the expenses I paid for my cat's pleural effusion (fluid in the chest) because it is being considered as a pre-existing condition - the only thing they'll cover is the euthanasia and cremation. The reasoning I was given was that the emergency vet noted he had a heart murmur back in September, which was before I started the policy and the vet that I took him to last month was never able to determine the cause of my cat's fluid.

I am extremely displeased with Embrace. Not only was I made to wait twice as long as advertised to get my claims resolved (and they did not even reach out to me to let me know what was causing the delay), but Embrace decided to not cover a condition that did not have a determined cause just because a heart murmur was noted a few months ago. Per what I was told by the vet, the cause could have been at least 3 different things. There is no proof that the heart murmur is related to the fluid. 

Not only has Embrace not been helpful, but they've also made my financial situation even worse than if I had just handled the expenses on my own. I have already started the process of appealing this decision and am requesting the cancellation of my policy. I do not want to waste my time and money on this company any longer.
title: Unhelpful and Messy Insurance

text: I’ve had embrace for 13 years now. Embrace is easy to work with, and pretty transparent. something to be aware of, you should get preapproval on surgeries. You just never know, as some items may not covered. Also prescriptions for home are not covered unless you add to your policy (few dollars extra). All in all, it’s a good insurance. Surgery for my dog was $12,500, not to mention the previous visits. I was really glad to have embrace, as together they covered the $10,000 after my yearly $500 copay. I wish they would cover more as I ended up out of pocket after that as well. The policy goes up in cost every year, and for my 13 year old dog, I was paying $105 a month so that is something you need to keep in mind as well. Yes, I will totally recommend embrace, and I still have them for one of my dog. The process is pretty quick. If you have the app you just download your documents and then you have a few days to a week to wait on your reimbursement. Reimbursement is made via check or direct deposit in your account. Thank you Embrace for being there when I unfortunately needed you!

text: Our experience was poor with Embrace. The issue is an overly broad interpretation of any symptom or complaint being used to declare any diagnosis as preexisting. Our 1 dog had been noted by a conscientious vet as being witnessed to lick her vulvar area. She later suffered a urinary tract infection many months later which was excluded from coverage. I don’t know  of any dogs that don’t lick in that area so therefore UTI s and their side effects should just be excluded up front. Essentially if you have a conscientious vet you will be left uncovered for years to come. On the issues they occasionally covered they did a passing job. For the most part it is like not having insurance
title: Our experience was poor with Embrace

text: We bought a policy in 2016 for a puppy who was born late 2015.  After the processing period, our puppy lived seven years.  Sadly too short for us but Embrace was there every step of the way!  We just purchased a policy for our new puppy.  Process took like ten minutes.  Wouldn’t be without it.

text: One would think that having insurance will ease the concern of having to pay medical bills. My dog was throwing up and having diarrhea with no other health concerns. After many months of trying to get the bill covered, it is considered a pre existing condition even if 10 months have passed. Can you imagine? Dogs get into everything. You have to wait 12 months before your animal becomes ill.

text: My dog has been having post-op rehab. Sometimes the claims are paid and sometimes the same treatments are denied depending on the underwriter. Also, different underwriters give different interpretations of identical covered modalities. They have become a nightmare to deal with. and every claim turns into a phone call.

text:
It takes 15-20 days to process claims, normally. I had to wait even longer. My vet was sending the docs but they kept saying they didn't have them. At one point they couldn't review it because an invoice had two dates on it, on for a Rx pick up and one for a B12 shot but then after I called they decided it was okay and they could process. After all the back and forth they decided a high lab mark was enough for pre-existing and I basically spent hours on the phone and chat to not have any coverage anyway. 

I'm still waiting on my second dog because they can't read the medical history. It's a huge pain. I will keep the insurance for my second dog for emergencies. If I were to go back I would request reviews of the records before I do any claims so I wouldn't waste money on premiums. 

Overall, people are nice enough but at the end of the day it's just like other insurance companies out there.

text:
Worthless. No, worse than worthless. Actively malicious.

My beloved ESA (a cat) had mammary cancer prior to my purchase of my Embrace policy. After I purchased the policy, my cat developed salivary gland cancer that is terminal (it has metastasized to the lungs). Despite all evidence to the contrary, including a letter from my cat's oncologist, Embrace judged that my cat's salivary gland cancer was of mammary origin and therefore a preexisting condition, refusing to cover the literal thousands I have to spend per month on my cat's care. The mental gymnastics required to call an obviously novel condition preexisting are nothing short of unbelievable, and obviously motivated by greed. Embrace doesn't care about animals, only about money, and they are willing to ignore the truth to save money. I will be pursuing legal action. They are making an already nightmarish situation--having a terminally ill pet--exponentially worse. If I could give zero stars, I would.

DO NOT USE EMBRACE, or be prepared to get your state's department of insurance to intercede on your behalf when they deny your claims for dubious (read: BS) reasons.
title: Worse Than Worthless

1) They appear to be inconsistent regarding what a pre-existing condition is. Sometimes covered; sometimes not. Frustrating.
2) Our vet sent them our dog's complete medical history but they seemed to lose it. I had to re-send it to them myself. This should not happen. Once they got it (and they've received this before) they did act quickly.
Again, cannot really complain as their customer service seems to be very good and their coverage, while not quite as extensive as I was hoping, is good, we'll stick with them for a long, long time.

text: Embrace Pet Insurance is by far one of the most shady companies that I have done business with. They have found a way to deny claims for a puppy that I have based on a previous condition of parasites, which is common for most puppies. My puppy has been treated and cleared of any worm or other parasites, but still has GI issues causing diarrhea and Embrace has denied both of my claims so far for a "pre-existing condition". After speaking with their claims analysts, there is zero concern for the customer or for the pet and the only concern that the adjustors have is whether they can find a way to deny the claim. Because they are denying claims for something as minor as GI upset, I have zero confidence that this company would be in my corner if something more severe were to happen to either of my dogs. Instead of helping, they would find a way to deny the claims so that not only am I paying for the full vet bill, but also wasting money on monthly insurance payments.
title: Embrace Pet Insurance is by far one of…

But overall it was a smooth experience getting claims. I do everything via the app and it’s takes about 1-2 weeks to get the money back. Given the mix reviews of other pet insurances out there, I’d say Embrace is doing pretty well.

text: In 2019 my dog had fat mass on his chest.  In September of this year he had a bump removed inside anal.  Embrace said it was related and refused to pay.  My Vet had to write letter to dispute what they said before they paid.  It was 2 months after surgery before I was reimbursed.  They question every invoice and you always have to have your Vet explain the reason for the invoice which is time consuming.  They are very slow in paying because every invoice is scrutinize.  I stop using any pet insurance from the experience I went through.  When I submitted first invoice I was told that his chest mass needed to be tested.  When I did that and resubmitted invoice that is when they appealed it and I had to get Vet say it wasn't the same.  It took me 3 weeks to get testing done and at that time I was told I had to get a letter from Vet saying it was not the same.  The invoice was over $1,000.  So be aware that you will not get your money right away.  They will question every invoice you send in.
title: Worse experience ever

title: Claim procedure very good

text:
I have had Embrace for a few years and have never had to submit a claim, the only thing they did was increase my rate each year under the guise of my pet getting older. They don’t cover what you really need such as a yearly visit, vaccines and routine bloodwork or a dental cleaning. Plus you have to buy into a seperate plan for that. 
As your dog ages the premium goes up too. 
I have cancelled my policy and will be saving the $180.00 per month they just raised it to without the "extra"coverage" for the routine care.
Also, be mindful of what states pet insurance covers because Embrace raised my rates and explained they did an inquiry of my state and said my premium needed to be adjusted  because of where I lived and at that time raised it from $75.00/mo to $125.00/mo and I just was informed three days ago it will now be $180.00/mo. 
I was trying to protect my dogs health, but that didn't work. 
Don't be fooled by all the great ratings because they are all the same. I should have listened to myself before spending all this money for insurance I thought would be useful.
Very disappointed in the way I got sucked in. The shelters and streets are full of animals people couldn't keep due to not being able to keep up with vet bills or the cost of pet insurance.
title: Not what you would expect from insurance

We sent in an appeal letter and Embrace amended their original decision based on updated documentation showing that the cancer was not related. We were really stressed over this and Embrace provided us with a massive amount of relief. We want to do everything we can to keep Snoopy with us for as long as he wants to give us and keep him as comfortable as possible. Having Embrace and the great coverage they provide makes the financial aspect of his care not be the focus.

text: I got Health Insurance for my dog right away when I adopted him as a little ball of fur in the palm of my hand.  I researched health insurance online and ask fellow pet owners.  I chose Embrace Pet Insurance because of the woman who contacted me.  Prices are pretty much comparable for the insurance options out there, when you figure what you are paying and what you are getting.  Embrace was the only company who reached out to me and explained the options and how it all worked.  She asked for my dog's name and from that point on all of the questions about my dog included his name.  She asked about his breed and let me know what his breed may be prone to.  She gave me quotes and options, I didn't feel like I was talking to a car salesman. I spoke to 2 other insurance groups and didn't feel as though my dog was a priority, and both were kind of pushy to get me signed up when I barely had any information.  It really was a no-brainer for me, and I am so glad I chose Embrace.  He is now 5 years old and has had his share of incidents and illnesses.  Everyone at Embrace has been helpful and very pleasant.  My dog was just diagnosed with Diabetes, and I have had several trips to the vet and prescriptions filled.  The claims are so easy to submit and are handled very quickly.  My last claim I submitted and had the reimbursement in my bank account 2 days later.  Each time my best friend needs medical help I am so glad that I have Embrace.
title: Each time my best friend needs medical help I am so glad that I have Embrace.

text: Buyer Beware - I wish I could give less than 1 star. This was my first experience with pet insurance and it was an eye opener! When I submitted claims to prove I had met my deductible, within 24 hours I received notification for my renewal, which was over two months away - at an increase of nearly 40%. When I called to question, I was told that a 40% annual increase was 'normal'. I never actually intended to file a claim, only prove my deductible had been met in case I needed to file a claim and EVERY SINGLE claim I filed to prove this was disputed and denied even though I had the vet complete Embrace's forms. Embrace looked amazing on paper but I don't think they ever would have approved any of my claims.

text:
On 6/1 I completed the applications for two pets’ insurance.
I submitted my dog’s healthy medical visit documents and was awaiting to set my cats next vet appointment, however, I received an email from Embrace that indicated that both my pets were now fully insured. This confused me so I called Embrace again thinking perhaps I misunderstood the policy.  I called in to see if Embrace had all that was needed for my cat’s health insurance, I was affirmed  from the customer service agent that nothing more was needed, they had everything for my cat and he was fully insured. I  asked again whether they needed another healthy wellness check prior to affirming my cats insurance was good, however, I was affirmed 2 more times that Embrace had everything they needed. Then I emailed on 7/12 and asked if his insurance is active, because I wanted it in writing. “Thank you for reaching out regarding your policy. I did take a look at Anikin’s policy and it was purchased the same day as Koda’s policy… it is active. “

This was over three months ago. When my cat had a uti I took him to the vet 8/26 and then it wasn’t until AFTER I SUBMITTED THE CLAIM TO EMBRACE that Embrace contacted me 9/14, 9/19, to say that it is missing his heathy vet check. Now I am being denied my claim because they said they never received the healthy wellness check from my vet. I am beyond furious because I have been paying for the insurance for MONTHS. When I asked to be sent the phone call recording /chat recording I was told that the request was against compliance rules. I was also told that regardless what I was told on the phone, needing the health check is written in the 17 page manual, so that is what they refer to, regardless what their rep told me. I am furious. When I asked to speak to a supervisor I was told one would return my call within 48 hours. What a joke!

If I was a customer service representative or someone who worked for this agency, and a client was missing important paperwork for three months, I would be calling them. The email I received said there is nothing that I needed to do, so I was foolish enough to believe them. I will publish this review as often as I can until I get an appropriate response.
title: Incapable service knowledge

text: Excuses were found not to pay for services. And now excuses given not to pay for future claims due to what has been presented. So why should I continue to pay for your insurance?????
title: Excuses were found not to pay for…

text:
I'm not a serial complainer and don’t post a lot of bad reviews, but Embrace deserves one. I originally chose Embrace because of their discount to USAA members and my rationale that, by affiliation, Embrace would be the same sort of top-notch and scrupulous insurance company that USAA is. I was mistaken and very disappointed. Embrace isn't a terrible company, but like many insurers, they will bend every word and phrase in the insurance agreement to their benefit in order to deny coverage, and they have provisions in their policy that are one-sided and irrational to the point of absurdity. Then they'll lay on the fake sympathy when they tell you how disappointed they are that they can't cover your claim. Here's an example.

First, the exact policy provision: "If your Pet showed Clinical Signs of any Dermatological Condition prior to the end of the Waiting Period, your Pet must be free of any Dermatological Conditions for twelve (12) consecutive months before any Dermatological Conditions may be covered again."

Next, here’s how that shook out in real life. Our dog had a sarcoma (cancerous growth) between her toes removed in January 2022, several weeks prior to signing up for pet insurance with Embrace, so we understood and agreed that was a pre-existing condition for which we would not expect coverage. In August 2022, my dog irritated that same paw on a walk when she stepped on something. We took her in to the vet, who suggested that we soak her paw in an Epsom salt bath for a week, which resolved the issue. Embrace denied coverage for that vet visit (~$100), claiming that because the veterinarian didn't specifically rule out a recurrence of sarcoma in her visit notes, that they couldn’t rule it out as a pre-existing condition. This is despite the fact that the recommended course of treatment (Epsom salt baths and no recommendation for a biopsy) was not consistent with a recurrence of sarcoma. At our request, the veterinarian amended her notes to specifically state the obvious - that it was a skin irritation of the foot and not a recurrence of carcinoma - which we forwarded to Embrace as an appeal a couple weeks ago. After digging for a couple days to find a new reason to deny the claim, this time around, they essentially said "well, you got us on the sarcoma thing, but we're still denying coverage” because – and get this – she had folliculitis ON HER SCALP in September 2021, four months before taking out the policy and eleven months before the FOOT irritation. Yes, they denied the claim for a reason they didn't originally think of the first time they processed the claim, which shows how much work they'll put into finding reasons to deny a ~$100 claim. Imagine the time they’ll put into larger claims. Adding insult to injury, they wrote their denials with way-over-the-top patronizing fake sympathy, stating how "unfortunately" they could not provide coverage, and how sorry they were that they couldn't, as if they shared in my misfortune, and as if denying claims didn't positively affect their bottom line. “Unfortunately” and “I’m sorry” seem to be their favorite words, and they’ll likely appear in Embrace’s response to this review, along with a statement that it pains them when they can't provide coverage for a condition.

Don't be fooled like I was. If you're looking for a different kind of insurance company, look elsewhere.
title: Get ready for a bunch of "I'm sorry's" and "Unfortunately's"

text: Embrace has been one to the easiest companies to work with as far as customer service. I would recommend them for pet insurance to anyone! Without them we wouldn't have been able to save our Blue!
title: 5 Star Recommendation

text: I have been a customer of Embrace Pet Insurance since 2010, when I purchased coverage for my Shih Tzu, who was then a very young puppy.  Through the years, my husband and I have become so attached to her and consider her our 4-legged child.  She was blessed with very good health until the past several years, when some serious issues developed, which we have been intensely dealing with recently.  We are so pleased with Embrace Pet Insurance for so many reasons.  Their customer service has been excellent any time we have had any questions about our coverage, the claims process, etc.  Also, I have heard friends complain that it takes such a long time for other pet insurance companies to settle claims that they have filed and this has certainly not been the experience we have had with Embrace.  Each claim that we have filed has been settled in a very prompt and professional manner.  We know that we would not have been able to provide the excellent care that our "4-legged child" has been so fortunate to have, had it not been for Embrace Pet Insurance!  This has definitely improved our stress levels when dealing with upsetting medical situations and we are so happy that our girl has greatly improved and at times even seems like a young puppy again!  I highly recommend this company to any person who cares enough to provide the best possible care for their pet and am confident that Embrace will not disappoint!
title: Outstanding Pet Insurance!

Unknown to me, they emailed a request to collect $218 for unused Wellness benefits (I just found out it went to "Junk Mail")  They had paid us $450 for cremation and Vet expenses after our dog died in February, 2022.   Since their email (nothing was mailed to us and no phone call to us) went to "Junk Mail" so we never knew they were trying to collect from us.   So, the bottom line is they sent this to a collection agency.   We paid the collection agency, which I believe is a rip off - $220 for coverage that represented the months left in the year after we had cancelled the policy.

text: Embrace has denied all but one claim I’ve submitted since we purchased the policy saying they are pre existing issues. He had an issue prior to the policy taking affect and Embrace is basing their decision on that piece of medical information even though we never submitted a claim. We were told to wait 30 days for policy to take affect which we did however they are making decisions based on what occurred during and prior to buying the policy. In addition, he had a cough one time which is now a pre-existing condition. We took him in for what appeared to be megaesophagus and because it had a cough with it - they wouldn't cover the cost of anything related to it and now it considered a permanent existing condition therefore I can't get any insurance to cover this. A cough and megaesophagus are two totally different things, yet they have decided they are the same.  The same for diarrhea - what puppy do you know doesn't have diarrhea being in a new environment and being taken from his puppy family. We had one payout of $25.00 over the years time.  Everything we submitted either went to the deductible (which we understood) or what they have decided is pre-existing condition. To me it was a way for them not to pay.  Insurance companies are all the same whether human or animal insurance - just want to make money!!
title: Do Not recommend this company - everything will end of being pre-existing

text:
Ive devoted my life to training service dogs and got a Maters Degree in Canine Life Sciences with an emphasis at Bergin University of Canine Studies. Ive experienced several pet insurers. VPI only coverd 50%. Healthy Paws doesnt pay the vets examination fee so it discourages you from getting canine healthcare as many dont have money to pay the vet on top of their ever increasing premiums. Trupanion wouldnt cover my insured dogs surgery if he wasnt neutered after age 1. All the above are DISGUSTING! 
Then came Embrace. This company restored my faith in an insurance company. Ive NEVER had a claim denied. When I transitioned away from Horrible Healthy Paws to embrace...Embrace pre certified acceptance to eliminate any coverage vulnerabilities..pre existing excuses to deny claims in the future.
EMBRACE is THE company you owe your canine kid to go with! I share this with the love of dog.
Ps There are places in hell for a health insurance company that doesnt cover a doctor examining your loved one aka UNHEALTHY PAWS that claims to be number one though just sued class action for raising coverage costs so unrealistically.
title: Decade of pet insurance experience

title: Any time I have ever called Embrace I…

text: Unless your pet is brand new to the world, the insurance is a scam and not worth it. My cat Lucina had to go to the emergency room - twice - this summer because of bladder stones that have developed. I spent thousands of dollars on her diagnosis and treatment, and Embrace refused to cover any of it. Why? Because in January, she had a UTI. Apparently because we never did the tests to rule out bladder stones then, they won't cover bladder stones we know she has now. It's one thing to say you won't cover things she's definitely been diagnosed with before, that makes sense - but to not cover something because she might've had it? Come on. I ended up cancelling my policy because I might as well spend the money directly on treatment rather than feeding it to a company that won't cover anything my cat actually needs. Thanks for nothing.
title: They'll penalize your pet for so much as a sneeze

text: Absolutely terrible company. My husband and myself are prior military, and where recommended to use Embrace Pet Insurance through USAA. We opened the insurance around January of 2021, for our two German Shepherds. We adopted one of our German Shepherds after the policy was opened and took her in to get vitamins and deworming as you do for puppies. They took care of the claim. Fast forward about a year later our youngest German Shepherd turns one. She is loosing weight rapidly, eating everything in site, has issues going to the bathroom. We take her into the vet to get blood work done to find out she has a pancreatic disorder which will not show in dogs until around age one. I submitted a claim and got denied because it was a pre existing condition. I appealed the claim With a letter from the vet stating that this is NOT a pre existing condition. And they once again denied my claim. I got an email for the denial at 1:48, called the office at 1:50 the same day, to ask a few questions and cancel the insurance I've had for over a year and paying $200 a month for, and for over a year now. But of course no one was able to answer my call. No one was in the office stated the woman I spoke to, to cancel my insurance. How is it that in two minutes, no one is able to speak with me?  And why have I been paying $200 a month for the insurance and them not cover something when I really needed it. USAA should be doing business elsewhere.
title: Absolutely terrible company

text:
After I struggled paying for my late cat’s vet bills earlier this year, I vowed to always have pet insurance to help with their medical bills. I set out to find the perfect pet insurance option for me and my fur babies and I landed on Embrace Pet. 

I’m so glad that I did. They have been wonderful helping me with not only illnesses, but they have a great wellness plan too! My best friend of nine years, Major Watson, is wagging his tail for all their help. He recently got diagnosed with congested heart disease. While that is very difficult news to learn, I can rest a little easier knowing that Embrace is here to help us through this challenging time. Our new kitten, Max, says it’s paws-atively amazing that his big brother is getting the best veterinary care with Embrace’s help so they can continue playing.

A pet parent shouldn’t have to make a decision based on financial limitations when making crucial medical decisions.
title: The Coverage You & Your Pets Deserve

text:
I should have believed the negative reviews!!!

My pet sprained a muscle and was limping. We took her to get evaluated by the vet since it was an injury. Luckily, we ended up only spending little under $100 at the vet. We decided to report this to Embrace just in case the injury is worsened overtime. 
To “review” this claim, they asked for my dog’s entire medical history. But they already had received this information less than six months ago but they asked again! Thank goodness, my vet just sits around to submit medical histories to insurance companies. 
It has been 40 days since we filed the claim.    And 30 days since my vet sent over my dog’s full medical history. NOT ONE UPDATE from embrace, it still shows as “pending info” even thought my vet already provided the information 30 days ago! 
I’ve called and emailed. They just keep saying they’re reviewing, but the claim status shows us “pending info”!!! So are they really reviewing it???
This experience has caused me to lose trust in Embrace. If they’re taking such long time to process a claim that is under $100 for a small injury, how can I expect them to be there for me and my pet if a bigger injury comes up unexpectedly??

Trusting Embrace as my pet’s health insurance has been waste of money and time!!!

text: Our Maincoone was diagnosed with cancer. She was tested, hospitalized in intensive care oncology, treated and in the end passed away because she was too sick. Embrace paid her bills per our policy almost daily as I submitted the bills making it possible for us to continue to try to save our cat. If I could say 1 word about Embrace it would be COMPASSIONATE! They were there with us every day financially and supporting us as we did all we could to save Pepper. We have 2 other cats covered and the peace of mind is immeasurable! Thankful they are in our pet care corner.

text: Extremely disappointed. I gave Embrace a  chance because on paper they seem great; low monthly payments, coverage for emergency and up to 90% reimbursement. However this was not my experience. When my cat first came home from the shelter, she had an upper respiratory infection which I had to pay out of pocket understandably to treat. 7 months later she had another one totally unrelated to the first and after I spoke with someone regarding my concern they assured me I would be covered. $1500 later, Embrace refuses to reimburse me a dollar because they claim her upper respiratory infection as a preexisting condition. I was concerned getting an older cat because I had a feeling insurance companies would be jerking me around like this, but I gave Embrace a chance only to be let down. Make sure you talk to representatives and do your research prior
title: Extremely disappointed

text: They paid the claims in a timely manner over the course of my first year with them. However, when it came time to renew for year two, they raised my premium for my two dogs by over $40 a month which increased my annual premium by about $480! In my view, it appears that the initial year's lower rate was a ploy to get me to sign up with them. When I complained about such a large increase, I received a condescending email from them saying they "understand it (premium rate increases) can be frustrating" and that I could buy less coverage if I wanted a lower premium. They also blamed the rate on many factors, including inflation, policy changes and the underwriter (American Modern Insurance Group) who determines the base rate. Too bad they have no say in what they charge, huh? To me, it's a bait (lower initial rate)_ and switch (2nd year large rate increase).
title: Beware of rate increases

text:
I took my 1 year old Labrador retriever to the vet for a urinary tract infection. During the exam our vet happened to examine her ears and noticed that she also had an ear infection which the vet explained was most likely due to her swimming.
I submitted the claim from that visit and Embrace denied the costs associated with the ear infection with the excuse that because our dog had  at a wellness visit been noted to have a tiny bald spot on top of her head (which the vet at the time said was most likely due to trauma from brushing into something) The diagnosis of alopecia was put into her record. Embrace now says that she had a preexisting dermatology condition so the ear infection is not covered! There is no connection between her transient bald spot that totally went away and never came back and an ear infection acquired from swimming! In addition, they categorized the antibiotics for the UTI as a “wellness” expense and said we had used up our wellness benefits so did not cover the antibiotic.
This is an insurance company looking for any excuse not to pay.
We have met our $750 deductible in addition to paying $650 in premiums.
I will not be renewing this contract if that is how this company operates!
title: Buyer Beware

text: My experiences with Embrace have always been great, and this past time was no different. Embrace makes it easy to submit a claim through the app by simply taking a picture of the vet paperwork and uploading it. The response time is fast, and reimbursement occurs in a timely manner as well.

When the illness was remedied we were left with a sizeable bill.  Thank you Embrace as you not only covered the majority of the cost but did so quickly
Our baby is now on the road to recovery and thanks to Embrace we can watch her recover and not spend all our time worrying about the expense

LOVE THEM!!!!

text:
Appalling! I have a one and half year old Newfoundland who needed chiropractic care. He had two treatments over two months and the vet advised to continue once a month for a while.  I submitted two claims which went against my deductible.  The third claim was denied as Embrace have a limit of 12 weeks of chiropractic care for the LIFETIME of the dog.  So not 12 treatments. Not 12 weeks of treatment - but a 12 weeks time period.  So I could have done a treatment every day for 12 weeks and claimed every day - but because he didn’t need that - I chose two treatments over 10 weeks.  My third treatment fell outside of the 12 weeks window so now he is not eligible for any chiropractic treatment for the REMAINDER OF HIS LIFE.   This is absolute insanity and just such a rip off!  Additionally it could potentially save embrace thousands of dollar if I choose later to do X-rays or MRI as the issues are not resolved.   Shame on you Embrace for ripping off your customers again!


UPDATE TO YOUR RESPONSE 

I just read your response dated 13 minutes ago.  This doesn’t tell me anything!  It’s also mid leading when you say per covered condition!   Condition is the problem as far as I’m concerned.   So assuming he has a different issue that needs chiropractic treatment - different from his first condition!   He is still NOT COVERED.  Your policy is misleading as it should clearly state you only cover treatment for 12 consecutive weeks for the  LIFETIME OF THE DOG!!!   So if he hurts himself four years later and needs chiropractic care HE IS NOT COVERED!   Additionally your “ sales “ team does not understand this either.  I called to ask for a new policy.  I specifically asked about the 12 weeks and was told “no you can claim as often as you like”.  This is how you reel us us in - by lying!    Shame on you
title: Appalling

text: Just st signed up yesterday and I will be dropping it today if I can’t get some satisfaction. Customer service is ill informed and are vague and evasive. The policy does express everything that will not be covered, but no mention whatsoever of specific surgeries for breed specific genetic problems. Which is the most important to me as I explained when I signed up. I needed comprehensive accident coverage and breed specific surgery coverage, none of which are visible in the policy that I purchased. So disappointed. text:
This company is terrible, please don't give them your money. You are better off starting a savings account for emergency pet costs... I signed up 2-3 months ago. Provided all medical history.... well, when I submitted claims for my pup the fun has began... one claim was for a fractured tooth, another one for an emergency vet visit due to allergic reaction. Again, I submitted all records and notes provided by all vet but... that was not enough. They just kept sending me messages requesting more records... which simply didn't exist. So, I found myself in the endless loop of trying to figure out WHAT ELSE CAN I POSSIBLY PROVIDE?!!! I finally gave up (which I guess exactly what this company was trying to do). I ended up canceling my policies. Basically, the way this "insurance" works is you pay and have a piece of mind that you have coverage until you actually need to use it. Then, they will send you on the endless loop of bureaucracy until you give up. I probably could have continued to fight and escalate but life is too short and I don't need this scam company and the negativity the brought my way. Please don't give them your money, they don't give a crap about your pets. Just another greedy fat corporation...
____
Update: Thank you Embrace for your useless canned response! 🤣

text:
Over a month to process a claim: the site said certain tasks were started weeks before they even sent the emails they claimed were already sent. Of course, my claim was denied so I am a little bitter but even it my claim was approved, the rate at which this claim took to process and the constant repeat of stock answers which half the time weren’t relevant to my claim at all each time I called has sent me on a shopping spree for another insurance. It would have been much easier to get denied a week in instead of strung along for weeks. Very condescending staff, with that typical “well just look where you signed here accepting X and X” crap you expect from an insurance company. 

I can’t wait to read the stock answer response that all the other negative reviews garnered. 🙄

Edit - And there’s the stock answer. So when they tell you that they needed to review the records and SOAP notes, that is of course true. What insurance company wouldn’t. That said, when they change the status of your claim to say that happened and they CC the pet owner to every email sent to the care provider, color me a little surprised that the *day of the denial of benefits* is the day the CCd email occurs. I have the emails with the timestamp, Embrace, so say whatever feel good spinned message you’d like. I can’t forge your own emails to make my story the real one. They are what they are and you all definitely dropped the ball in handling my claim.

How I wish I could upload a screenshot of that email. 👎🏻
title: Takes Forever

text:
Update (In response to Embrace's response): How is "vomiting" and "diarrhea" a pre-existing condition? Imagine if when you tried to get the health insurance they said "we see here that you've had ankle pain in the past and you've also vomited and had diarrhea. So anything related to your ankle or that involves vomiting or diarrhea is not covered." That doesn't make sense to anyone but pet insurance companies. Vomiting and diarrhea are symptoms, not conditions. Also, thank you for condescendingly pointing out that all of the information about pre-existing conditions was sent out in the terms and conditions. My point was that you never told me those cases applied to ME! You never said, we found these pre-existing conditions in your dog, just you know those won't be covered for a year. Unbelievable. Their response should tell you everything you need to know about the company. They are fraudulent, do not care or understand dogs or the difference between symptoms and conditions, and they will leave you stranded when you need them most. 

After a little over a year of solid service from Embrace, I had the dreaded negative experience, everyone, with pet insurance fears when filing a claim. I submitted a claim for one of my dogs who was vomiting and having diarrhea. Easy day, I thought. Just as I was starting to realize that the claim was taking longer than it had in the past, I get CC'd in an email from Embrace to my vet asking for my dog's medical history over the last year. Confused about why that would influence the status of my claim, I call Embrace who then proceeds to tell me that my dog has "pre-existing conditions" on my policy. I ask the Embrace representative which policy document would have those pre-existing conditions listed to which she responded that I don't have access to the document that lists them and that I could online get them sent to me if I had known to ask for it. Complete scam. I had been trying to make myself feel better about paying more for Embrace than every other competitor because I thought when I needed them, they would be there. Turns out they are just as conniving and dishonest as some of the others seem to be. Do yourself a favor and either get a policy somewhere else where you can get more coverage for a lower price.
title: Conniving and Dishonest just like all the others

text: I went with Embrace for insurance and regret it. In the process of processing my first claim (my dog got a tick-borne illness and vestibular symptoms), Embrace reviewed my dog's history. During that review, Embrace focused on the fact that a year ago I asked the vet about a small bump on my dog's leg. At that time, the vet examined and tested the bump (needle aspirate) and said it was benign. Embrace, however, found this in the record and has declared that my dog has a pre-existing condition and will now not be covered for any future masses or any type of cancer. All this because of a benign cyst in his medical history! When I protested they said the only way to get back my dog's coverage for cancer would be to biopsy the bump to determine cytology--a procedure my dog *does not need*--no vet would say this is medically indicated. And if I don't do that, Embrace will deny him coverage if he ever gets cancer in the future. I'm a longtime USAA member and have always respected and appreciated USAA, so I'm really dismayed that Embrace is doing this sort of thing under USAA's name. At this point I'd like to change insurance plans, but now I'm stuck: Embrace has created a barrier to future coverage for a huge category of illnesses for my pet, and the only way I can get rid of it is through an unnecessary procedure and expensive lab work (lab work Embrace won't cover, despite the fact that they're requiring it). But if I switch insurance companies now, any future recurrence of the vestibular / tick borne illness will be considered a pre-existing condition by the new company. So I'm stuck. But you don't have to be--avoid signing up with Embrace!
title: Created a pretext not to insure

text: I really appreciate the way Embrace claim representatives handled the claims from their end. text:
It's a SCAM.  Their business is based on denying claims.  I have paid $600 in premiums to cover $2300 in out of pocket medical expenses, and Embrace is covering ZERO.  Their pre-existing condition policy is outrageous (as commented by many other reviewers).  An example:  My dog had to have 2 teeth pulled and her teeth cleaned.  Because a previous visit identified plaque (the reason for the teeth cleaning), the company denied the claim because plaque was a "pre-existing condition". 
Imagine if you went to the dentist for a cleaning and they said because you had plaque we are considering any of your treatments a pre-existing condition and denying coverage.  Thats why you go to the dentist!  Additionally my dog has a skin allergy, so they denied any skin related charges due to pre-existing conditions.  And when my dog got an ear infection they denied that because of her skin allergy.  Because now ears and skin are the same thing?!? ADDITIONALLY they have another category called "Wellness Rewards" which unless you have added it to your policy they will not cover preventative care.  In short they designed another way to deny your claim.  This is a SCAM.  This industry needs to be regulated. DO NOT USE.

*Insert canned response from their PR team on how its in the fine print and I can contact customer service.
title: It's a SCAM

text:
I too have come here to warn the public that Embrace.com and American Modern Home Insurance Company are an internet pet insurance scam. I enrolled in two plans for my cat Titus Maxwell Lewis I on 11/16/2021. One plan for wellness visits the other for major medical. $80.47 per month which is pretty steep as Titus was then only 9 months old (DOB 02.14.19) at this point. Initially, I had Trupanion insurance (referred by my vet), but they do not have a wellness plan. After spending hours of internet research (but not enough. I never looked at reviews) I was drawn in by Embrace because of their (non-existent) well care reimbursement (neuter and such) $650 annually. 
My Cat Titus was cleared for heart murmur and general heath twice by my vet. The reason I paid such attention to this is that my previous cat died at 4 yos due to CHF. Titus was found to have no signs of any issues prior to his neuter (I paid hundreds of extra dollars to specifically ensure that he was healthy this includes an echocardiogram). He was cleared for surgery on 4.27/22. On 5/11/22 we noticed a sudden cough and ran him to the vet. To our dismay he was diagnosed with CHF. The vet confirmed again that he had no issues prior to surgery and that the surgery caused no issues. CHF is congenital. 
We are again heartbroken. We have compiled thousands in medical bills, but we are covered now, right? My Embrace plans annual maximum is SUPOSSEDLY $10K. I can give Titus the treatment and extend his life without worry right? Wrong! Wrong! Wrong! Wrong! Wrong! I submitted all the bills we amassed to Embrace including the Neutering under the wellness plan. They have dragged their feet for over 30 days and have now come back and DENIED all claims citing pre-existing conditions – which we were cleared of by them in Dec. 2021. They will pay nothing apparently and underwriter whose entire job is to send vacuous expressions of empathy, deny valid insurance claims making no effort to explain why “any pre-existing conditions” were not called out when Embrace received Titus’s medical history back in November 2021. They cannot explain why Embrace continued to take a year’s worth of insurance premiums without such notification. I did receive $540 of my $650 for wellness finally someone followed up. I missed it as I'm looking for more $$$. They are happy to cancel my nonexistent coverage now that they have my $643.00. Amid all of this they notified me that my July premium was due, and they could not deduct it.


HA!


Before selecting this company, I pursued Nationwide. It is unfortunate that I was drawn into Embrace by their Wellness plan and DID not do my homework. However, I am glad I did not sign my Pug here. Embrace is an insurance internet fraud they now have $643 in premiums from me and will cover nothing. 


Titus will continue to get the best of the best treatment Embrace.com, and American Modern Home Insurance Company will be the villain in his story!
title: Buyer Beware...Embrace Pet Insurance is an Internet Scam! They do not pay claims at all
