text:
This pet insurance co is RIDICULOUS!!! Like soooo many others, and BTW, don't trust the "majority" of reviews at being highly positive on this site. The actual "majority" of reviews of Embrace pet insurance are HIGHLY NEGATIVE!!! 

This company will give you the run around of every excuse you can imagine about how they're diligently working on reviewing and paying your claim. Trust me, they're NOT!! I spent $3,500 on vet bills for my dog (stray dog attacked my dog) and it's been months and still NOTHING!! This claim will have NOTHING to do with a "pre existing condition", but that's not stopping them from insisting they do a thorough background check on my vets notes for the previous year to see if they can apply something somehow and if not, they'll just not pay it and hope I go away! I won't. I"m going to sue these fux and when I'm done they're going to feel like they had a proctology exam with a cactus 

DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS SCAM OF A COMPANY!!!

p.s. Take note of ALL the "positive" posts here. Odd many of them do NOT mention their payment reimbursement isn't it? "They picked up the phone quickly and treated me well..."This is the first time I had to use Embrace, and when I needed help the two young ladies that answered the phone in two different occasions were friendly, helpful and understanding!" and "I have had great experiences with this pet insurance. The response time is amazing. I recommend this pet insurance to all of my friends and family that own pets!" and "Everything seems to be very organized and everyone that I have spoken to has been very kind and helpful. Hopefully my puppers will remain healthy so I don’t have to go into it deeper than I have already" Also note someone at Embrace is trying to respond to negative comments about them then inviting the individual to contact them so they can "see what they can do to solve the problem." More b*llshit!! Beware...
title: Embrace pet insurance is HORRIBLE!!

text:
Update: after numerous email and phone conversations and resubmitting veterinarian notes to Embrace, the company did approve our recent claim(s).  We are saddened that it was such a frustrating journey to achieve these results. And, we are now very aware of the huge limitations and loopholes of pet insurance.  


The reason I decided to try pet insurance for the first time was because USAA was partnering with Embrace.  I thought I could trust a company that USAA put its faith in.   Embrace has not live up to USAA's standards of taking caring of customers so far.  At a time when I need something to be easy and supportive, the emotional toll of dealing with jumping through hoops for insurance claims to be denied over and over is not worth it. 

Embrace has denied all claims on ridiculous exclusions on our dog who has been incredibly healthy until a recent ER visit.  How lymph node issues, lethargy and no appetite can be denied because over a year ago we had a fatty mass checked out by the vet but not aspirated is beyond me.

They have permanently excluded almost every possible condition for our dog now.

Please be aware that if you find a mass on your dog (even just a fatty tissue one) and you do not needle aspirate it, Embrace will deny all claims going forward for ANY new masses (and other health issues as well).

Shame on you Embrace.
title: Embrace Pet Insurance - a learning experience

text: Embrace pet insurance was a total waste of time and money for me. I was better off just paying out of pocket for medical expenses as opposed to paying high monthly fees for an insurance policy that I could not even use. I was paying into my policy for about a year and then all of a sudden my monthly fees go up 55% out of nowhere. Embrace pet insurance claimed that my cat had a pre-existing condition. This is not true because my cat was not diagnosed with this condition until after I started my policy with embrace. Embrace would not pay for any claims that I submitted. So basically I was paying into a policy that I could not even use and my cat was only dealing with that one condition only. Embrace pet insurance is a total waste of time and I would never recommend this company to anyone on earth or any other planet for that matter. Embrace pet insurance would not accept any of my claims yet they can abruptly raise my monthly fees by 55% without a warning. I am totally disgusted with this company and I will never join this company nor recommend this company to anyone ever again in life. If I could give this insurance company zero stars, then I definitely would have. Also the fact that I have to put out medical expenses first in hopes that I get reimbursed by the insurance company is also bogus. Is there any pet insurance company out there where you don't have to come out of pocket UP FRONT and you can just use the insurance card and it will cover most if not all of the bill??? Embrace pet insurance is insane and none of the monthly fees are fixed. They can increase it at any given moment they feel like. Where are the BBB private investigators when you need them? POLICY DEFINITELY TERMINATED!!!

text:
I purchased Embrace policies for my two cats, one of whom had eye damage from an infection as a baby, before I adopted her. I was of course aware of this condition and understood that any complications related to the previous eye damage wouldn't be covered by Embrace.

Then my cats got into a fight, and my kitten sustained a new, unrelated eye injury. She had to have an eye removed, and then had a post-surgical infection. Throughout the stressful and expensive procedures, I took comfort in the knowledge that her bills would be covered by Embrace... until Embrace rejected all my claims.

Their argument is that this injury counts as a pre-existing condition, because my kitten's previous eye damage increased the RISK of complication in the case of another unrelated injury. This is based of their own assessments, not the opinion of the vet who actually saw my pet. But even more concerning is that this criteria does NOT appear in the policy.

In Embrace's own Policy Terms & Conditions, a pre-existing condition is defined:

"Pre-existing Condition(s) means:
   a. A Chronic Condition observed by you or your Veterinary Provider prior to the end of the Waiting Period for your Pet(s) and any related conditions; or
   b. An Illness or Injury that first occurred or showed Clinical Signs prior to the end of the Waiting Period for
your Pet and any related conditions.
   c. Undiagnosed conditions with the same Clinical Signs as those in a. or b. above are also considered preexisting."

This definition does NOT extend to any future, unrelated, new injuries where a pre-existing condition could have elevated risk factor or made a pet pre-disposed to future complications. It's simply not in the policy.

I have attempted to get clarity from Embrace representatives about what criteria they used in their denial of my claims, what future claims might be denied on these grounds, or to point me to where the policy mentions complication risk factor as determining a preexisting condition. The adjuster I spoke to, Taylor, insisted that she is unable to answer any of my questions.

I'm in the process of filing a second appeal, which will involve getting ahold of the ER doctor who saw my cat, since a letter from my regular vet who knows my pet best was not sufficient for Embrace.
title: This company doesn't follow their own terms & conditions.

text:
When my dog Summer was just a puppy I purchased Embrace pet insurance . I knew I would spend any amount of money to save her if she should get cancer or something major . 
  Fast forward 10 years and we ran into trouble , a hugh tumor came up right at the anal gland , three Vets told me it would most certainly be cancer and even if benign  it would be all into the nerves controlling colon and bladder . 
   The biospy came back benign , our vet  was so excited to tell us ; however, it had to come out , it was growing very rapidly and would take over and kill her even though it would not metastasize to other organs .
  I started looking for Vets that specilize in these type tumors , I located one in Nashville Tennessee . I made and appointment and she was operated  on three days later . It was baseball size , went very deep and had many fingers branching out ; however , it had not grown into the nerves !! 
  She is five day out of surgery and doing great ! Embrace was easy to work with , I filed claims , embrace approved within days . 
   This was the first claims I have had with embrace , I couldn’t be more pleased with their service .The Vet told us most dogs are euthanized because of the expense of removing these tumors  . All I can say Is Embrace took the expense worry away and I got to keep my precious Summer ! I would not have a pet that was not insured ! Highly recommend Embrace !
title: My precious dog Summer didnt have to face a death sentence , thanks to Embrace .

text: If you want to fight tooth and nail for the coverage you're paying for and have your pet recieve differential diagnosis from unqualified claims adjusters here is the company for you. This company has covered exactly 1 of my claims without requiring weeks of appeals and letters from my vet. They have a very fickle definition of "pre-existing" and "wellness" vs "illness" which they use to pay as little out as possible. They will not piecewise invoices. Instead if they find they can possibly reject one line item on a 20 line item invoice they will reject the entire thing. I have had pet insurance through different companies for about 8 years now and this is the only company that I ever had this many issues with. I ended up filling a complaint with my state regulatory committee because it was so ridiculous. Please also note that embrace performs a review of medical records to identify pre-existing conditions in the past year. HOWEVER, they only do so once a claim has been submitted and it was abundantly clear that when I submitted my first claim, which was for an emergency visit, that they looked through my cats records with the specific goal of finding any evidence that the reason for the visit was for a pre-exisiting condition. To the point of using insignificant findings from routine tests. Furthermore they exercise the right to arbitrarily assign new pre-existing conditions. My cat tested positive for FIV  when we went to reup his vaccines. Embrace used every single note of anything that could possibly be construed as autoimmune to indicate that he had FIV before the coverage period despite my vet pointing out that none of these "symptoms" are recognized clinical signs of FIV. in fact his load is too low to indicate a chronic infection. Embraces response was to tell my vet that she was wrong and assigned FIV as a pre-existing condition. They now reject almost every single medical claim from dental work to ear infections because "he has FIV". They wouldn't even cover the cost to test for FIV in the first place, once he tested positive, it was a "pre-existing conditon which they don't cover".
title: If you want to fight tooth and nail for…

text: Excellent insurance with an easy to use app.  We chose Wellness (the max amount) and Accident/Illness with a $200 deductible for our 6mo old puppy. Thankfully he's healthy and had no issues prior to obtaining insurance.  Both parts of the insurance have already proven to be invaluable.  We used the Wellness for our pups neutering, grooming, training, anal expressing, vaccines, ticks/flea treatments, etc.  We still have money left for use on our wellness plan and have until April of next year to do so.  Recently he began vomitting and had diarrhea.  The bill was $245.  I didn't want to also pay a $200 deductibl so i didnt file a claim.  Well a few wks later it happened again.  This bill was $200.  I decided to submit both claims and just pay the deductible.  Turns out that they just took the deductible from the 1st claim and I was reimbursed $45!  So for the 2nd claim I will be reimbursed in full!!  And no more deductible to worry about until we renew next year!  It's horrible if your furbaby becomes ill.  To not be able to get the medical help needed could be devastating.  So thankful for Embrace Insurance.  Our claims have all been reimbursed within 1 week.  Just make sure to get a copy of your vet's notes as well as the invoice for accident/illness claims.  For Wellness, you just need the invoice receipts.
title: Excellent insurance with an easy to use App

text: I purchased a policy for my 12 year old dog. I submitted a claim after the two week waiting period.  The claim was to test for Cushing's disease. My dog had NEVER been diagnosed or even suggested by a vet that she had this prior to this. After 45 days of waiting I received an email from the adjuster saying my dog would not be covered for Cushing's because she had symptoms prior to the waiting period.  I purchased the policy a the end of Feb 2022. Waiting period was over by first week of March 2022. They combed through all of my dog's medical history looking for a way to link something to her current diagnosis. The adjuster referred lab work from April 2021 where my dog's liver enzymes were SLIGHTLY elevated and said 'We cannot rule out that this is related to Cushing's Disease'. Let me repeat that no vet EVER said to me that this elevated lab value could be related to Cushing's Disease. As a matter of fact the Vet was treating my dog from a recent gall bladder removal surgery which can affect liver values.  This company is a rip off. They will try to find any lab value that can support their claim to deny your claim.  Don't buy insurance from them unless your dog has NO LAB WORK on file ANYWHERE or you have a puppy.  They get paid to find a way to deny your claim while still collecting your premium.
title: Rip off

text: I would not recommend this service to anyone. It is a complete waste of money. I signed up for my 9-year old Staffie and every single claim filed got denied because of "pre existing" conditions. In my case they considered an upset stomach as a pre existing condition. Which insurance companies are not supposed to deny treatment for either way. I think this company is a scam. Stay away!
title: Don't use this service

text:
So far I don’t think this company is worth anything. My 4.5 year old dog is completely healthy and had only seen mobile vet clinics for vaccinations and flea/tick prevention meds up until last month. When I started my policy in September I was under the impression that there was a waiting period for coverage to start if no act was taken on my part, and if I wanted immediate coverage I needed to go in for a checkup to verify there were no pre-existing conditions within a 2 week period. Since I am a busy emergency room nurse during a pandemic, and since my mobile vet clinic kept rescheduling due to covid, I ended up opting for the waiting period. 
So imagine my surprise when over 6 months into paying for insurance, and well after the waiting period has ended, my dog gets a tick bite and embrace tells me that it may not be covered because they didn’t have a well visit sent in the first 2 weeks of coverage. AS IF A CURRENT TICK BITE IS A PRE-EXISTING CONDITION!!
The tick head was literally still in her body. 

I called customer service last week (be prepared for a 45 minute wait on hold), and I re-sent the doctor’s notes to the agent I spoke with. I still see the claim status as “on hold” pending documents today. 
Crazy. If they deny this claim I’ll be calling a lawyer for full reimbursement of all payments sent.
title: A rip-off? TBD

text: This is how insurance should be- no, it isn’t necessarily cheap, but a fair cost- we pay our annual premium and when it’s time to submit a claim we simply upload the paperwork and we get our percentage of reimbursement back. It has been simple and fast each time we’ve had a claim.  There are no surprises and no long waiting period.
title: This is how insurance should be

text: Filing the the first claim too a while, due to my vet being slow to send records, but once Embrace received records it took about a day to process my claims and then maybe 1 to 2 days before my reimbursement hit my bank account.  So far its been a good experience with Embrace and I would recommend to other pet owners.
title: Good first experience!

text: We filed 2 claims electronically (for dental cleaning and wound care) and were notified of the results within a week. We were pleasantly surprised to learn that some parts of the dental procedure were covered as dental illness, apart from the wellness portion of coverage. When I contacted customer service about the other claim, the Embrace representative explained the results in a very friendly and satisfactory manner.
title: Great service on claims

text: Although I didn't hear back thru email after almost 3 weeks I did finally get through via phone and I was very happy with the service I received.  So I highly suggest that you call and not email if you want a response.
title: Call, don't email

text: Clear concise communications, professional responses verbally and written communication.  Claims were handled very quickly.  Thank you!
title: Clear concise communications

text:
I left a high review after my experience of easily submitting a claim. What I did not count on, was how IMPOSSIBLE it would be to get my claim processed. In spite of completely submitting not only visit notes, but including an unremarkable medical history, because my puppy has never had anything other than healthy pet and vaccines, my claim was put on hold for not having medical history. Nothing I could do would change this.  I could not include a history to show any prior conditions because there was none.

Out of frustration, I cancelled our policy and would give 0 stars if I could.

As for the reply. I can add that these people are also illiterate.  There WAS NO pre-existing condition.  This was a puppy that had been insured with EMBRACE for 7 months.  Frankie is now a healthy 11-month-old Brittany.  She was treated for ENTERITIS -- a condition you get when you eat something bad and get diarrhea!  

No one wanted to look at the vet notes, I guess.  Each visit was listed by date as "Healthy Pet" and a corresponding date for puppy vaccinations.  We have additional dates for weigh-ins because I monitor her growth.

This is a case of willful denial.  How can you provide information about a pre-existing condition if none existed, and the condition treated isn't predicated by one?

Again, these people suck.  I have a conformation dog and I want you people to know that I am spreading the word in my world to avoid your comany.  Your idiotic response and lack of effort to even try to remedy the situation just proves I am right.

People, don't waste your money with this coverage. It's not insurance, it is bait and switch, false advertising, a sham.

And if you want to resolve it as indicated below, pay the claim.  I don't have an hour to wait on hold. I gave up on that already.  I have filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.  Just pay 80% of my vet bill and be done with it.  It was only $150.  Not a lot, but apparently too much for you to want to pay.
title: Horrible…

text:
Had my first claim with embrace and so far I'm very unsatisfied!  Of course it was denied.  My Doberman got her paw smashed in the gate.  I took her to the vet because it was a bit red between her toes.  When I submitted her claim it was denied because I didn't submit an orthorpedic report.  My dog has been checked and is OFFA certified by orthopedic experts to be good!!! Anyway, how is a hurt paw an orthopedic issue?!?! 
When I tried to call to get this straightened out I was on hold for 46 minutes!  When I finally got through I was told they were going to review my claim again.  Now I'm getting emails asking what name she was under at University of Illinois!  She has never been to University of Illinois or even to Illinois!!!!
I'm assuming all pet insurances are the same.  This is the reason I didn't go with TruPanion again and so far Embrace is even worse.  At least I never sat on hold when I was with TruPanion!

I made a mistake by selecting Embrace and would let  anyone know who is considering pet insurance to steer clear and investigate having their pet covered by another pet insurance company's policy.

text: As all insurances companies exist with the sole intention of denying as many claims as humanly possible, this one is no exception.  We were literally within "hours" of the time period required for the policy to go live, and they denied us.  We felt that they were truly "splitting hairs."  Several emails and conversations with them yielded elusive responses, coupled with extensive instructions about how to file an appeal.  Certainly those details were also intended to discourage the average person, as they were involved and time-consuming.  There was no effort to understand the unique circumstances we found ourselves in with a new puppy, even though I went to great lengths to explain.  Also, we received a card in the mail indicating that our prescriptions are covered, so when I inquired about that, again, I received a convoluted, roundabout reply.  Again, the bottom line was they were not interested in applying any logic or human element of understanding. We were not sure what was going on with our new puppy, and neither was the vet, so he erred on the side of caution and prescribed meds.  We later discovered there was no need.  In any event, the entire lame experience was all about "pushback."  We spent a great deal of money and received nothing in return.

title: My dog needed to have an ultrasound…

text:
Embrace is the worst pet insurance I have ever had! Do not be fooled by their price and coverage! They are the epitome of what insurance companies' true intents are. They want to take your money and when it's time for them to pay up they will try to find every loophole in the book not too. I went with embrace because they are partnered with USAA. NOT THE SAME SERVICE!
Embraces policy states that your pet will need to have had a medical evaluation at least 12 months prior to or two weeks after activation of service. If this does not happen then any accidents will have a two-day waiting period, illnesses will have a 14-day waiting period and orthopedic issues will have a six-month waiting period. But their policy also states that if the evaluation does not happen your coverage will revert to accident only. Very confusing... on purpose I am sure.
My pet insurance was activated on the 15th of March. 
On April the 4th my dog was attacked by two strays who were walking the streets unleashed. After taking my dog to the emergency room. I filed my claim with embrace and they stated that they were not able to get a hold of my veterinarian so they needed me to send his medical records so that I may be reimbursed. When I sent them the records they refused to reimburse me because my vet had not completed a medical evaluation due to his aggression. Of course, I did not know this but it should not matter the two-day waiting period had passed!. He was seen by my vet, I thought I was good. My dog being attacked is not a pre-existing condition so I do not know what the problem is?
My dog is a very loving dog he just does not like to go to the vet and admittedly so needs to be muzzled to go. Now Embrace is sending me emails about how since he is labeled as aggressive they will not cover him at all! 
To me this is plain and simple there is no medical evaluation but the two-day waiting period has passed so he should be covered.
title: Embrace is the worst pet insurance I…

text: I have had Embrace Pet Insurance for a year now.  Their portal is easy to upload and follow the claim and their service has been excellent.  It does not matter who you speak to when you call up they are courteous and friendly and everyone of them have pets (that I spoke to) and understand and sympathize with whatever is going on.  I highly recommend this company! My personal experience with them has been outstanding.

text: I contacted Embrace while my dog was at the Emergency Vet and let them know what the Vet said is possibly going on with my dog. Embrace responded via email within the hour notifying me that they were "pre-approving" his predetermined diagnosis and would accept the claims. We paid for the vet bill out of pocket but submitted the final bill to Embrace the day he was discharged. Within 12 days we received our check in the mail for the portion that Embrace would pay. I also contacted them with follow up questions after submitting the claim. Kind of drilled them with questions (in a very friendly matter) and was very content with all answers I was given. I more so was wanting confirmation to my questions. I have never purchased pet insurance and this was the first time I've ever used it. I'm thankful we have Embrace insurance, will continue to carry it on two of my pets, and recommend it to anyone if you're considering.

text: YOUR DOG BETTER NEVER GET SICK AND BE 1000% healthy for the rest of their life, NOT EVEN WORMS! Nothing is covered! ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING IS A PREEXISTING CONDITION AND WONT GET COVERED. text:
Scam with preexisting conditions

Make sure your pet has 12 months with a clean bill of health (that can be proven with records from your vet) before you apply otherwise any preexisting condition and ANY "clinical signs" (meaning anything that could potentially be attributed to the preexisting condition, even if it's caused by something else) will be used to deny your claims.

My dog has a preexiting condition (Cushings) and Embrace was not upfront about the fact that this disease basically allows them to deny most of my claims because it has such a huge list of "clinical signs".  The dog had a knee injury and a few thousand dollars worth of vet bills, any vet bill that had a mention of a clinical sign from Cushings was denied, even though all complications where precipitated by the knee injury.

If the company was upfront about this and had not taken my money for 3 years I wouldn't be as furious as I am now.
title: Scam with preexisting conditions

text:
$500 to $900 for thesame service, how, why, wait what?! Honestly just avoid these charlatans. I was astonished to learn that after being a customer for the last two years, having never missed a payment and Embrace rewards me by doubling my premiums over the last 2 years. 

BTW I went online to get see what a new quote would be as a new customer, and the price was? you guessed it $500 for a new customer for EXACTLY the same service!! This is a despicable practice, and I wonder how many other embrace customers (victims) are falling into this trap. 

They have auto-renew on your account, and when you try to call them to ask questions or cancel their customer service team is never available to take calls, but if you call the sales line number they answer IMMEDIATELY! 

Naturally the sales team "has no idea why this is the case and we can only help sell you a new policy not help with existing ones" This is seriously bad practice. 

I have now been waiting in line for over 2 hours and NO ONE has answered the phone. I am sickened by this practice. I would seriously consider avoiding them and I am genuinely surprised how this outfit claims it is the #1 provider. 

They don't care about anything other than taking your money and leaving you in the dust! 

Such a frustrating company to deal with.
title: What a con! Avoid.

text: So disappointed with Embrace Pet Insurance. I signed up 10 months ago and submitted my first claim for a $30 medication prescribed by my vet. I received an email saying that my claim would only be processed once they received detailed medical history from all veterinary offices where my dog was examined 12 months prior to the start of your policy through the end of the waiting period. A month later, I was informed that my claim was denied and that additional exclusions were added to my policy. Very disappointed that this was the result for a $30 insurance claim, which made me lose all confidence for any future claims, especially for major injuries. Needless to say, I am no longer an Embrace customer.
title: Disappointing

text: Embrace Pet Insurance was a huge disapointment. When my puppy was 3 months old they had an episode of vomiting that was very expensive to treat. So I decided to get pet insurance with Embrace. I submitted one claim in the first 5 months of coverage (for a potential payout of around $800) for another vomiting issue. Over the next 7 months I was constantly calling and emailing and uploading the same documents they'd request again and again, all the while saying they still needed more information and past records when I had already given them everything. It was a tremendous stress on myself and clearly not worth it as I never was reimbursed. I cancelled my coverance plan. Do NOT use Embrace.
title: Embrace Pet Insurance huge disapointment

text: If you don’t get pet insurance from the time your dog is born then they won’t cover anything. I got insurance with them when my miniature schnauzer was 8 months old and they consider things like vomiting a temporary pre existing condition and if he has it again it can become permanent etc. They don’t make it clear that even without a formal diagnosis they can prevent things from being covered even when you don’t have a known problem yet. They also will make up any excuse to not cover something like I submitted a claim for my dogs specialist appointment for pancreas issues and I almost wasn’t going to since they decided he has pancreatitis prior to ever being diagnosed but I did. They came back and told me it won’t be covered not because it’s a pancreas issue but because he had giardia 10 months ago and the specialist listed it in his history. That had nothing to do with why he was there and then they make it a permanent preexisting condition. It’s a lot of BS and I don’t recommend them.
title: If you don’t get pet insurance from the…

text: Embrace pet insurance was SO worth it. The price to payout ratio was incredible. Our cat, who we adopted at 14 years old in perfect health, developed a severe oral disease that caused ulceration and lesions to develop on her tongue. I had gotten pet insurance for $34/month just as a precaution since we developed a senior cat. I am SO thankful now that we got Embrace. After our first year we added wellness rewards and paid $82 a month. Ultimately after over a year of fighting, our cat gave up and had to be put down. Embrace covered her euthanasia, cremation, and keepsakes 100%. Embrace is a wonderful pet insurance company.
title: Excellent cost to payout ratio

text: Very prompt response to claim. Very thorough explanation of benefits. Please with my interactions with Embrace.  Easy company to deal with.
title: Very prompt response to claim

text:
I recently signed up, all went super smooth.
Unfortunately, my dog passed after 3 days. They cancel the policy and return the money in one day, and even wrote me a super thoughtful note.
Great experience.
title: The right choice

text: I could not be happier with Embrace Pet Insurance. My yorkie was mauled by a pit bull and required emergency surgery. She had a ventral hernia (her intestines were ripped out of her abdomen) and necrotic bowel from the dog bite which required a bowel resection. It was an awful experience and very traumatic. I was so relieved when I remembered that I had a pet insurance policy. The representatives were very friendly and guided me through the whole process. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because it took a little over a month to get reimbursed. I wish that happened faster. Overall, highly recommend. Accidents/Injuries are costly and pet insurance is a must!
title: Pet Insurance is a MUST

text: We have had embrace for 4 years and never had needed it. My dog had emergency surgery recently and we weren’t even sure how embrace would cover. They were so fast in covering everything in our plan. Gave a clear explanation on why it wasn’t covered. Embrace saved us thousands of dollars and it was so easy to use the app and submit all the claims.
title: Saved us thousands

text: Embrace Pet Insurance is probably the most aggravating consumer product I have ever purchased. At a time when your pet child is severely hurt, and you've paid out thousands and thousands of dollars in vet bills, and you can't stop crying, some junior moron they've employed keeps demanding ever more proof that there were no loophole "previously existing conditions" that could get them out of paying my claims. They were mercilous and relentless in trying to do this. One girl wrote me an e-mail demanding records from a date a long time before I purchased their policy. I had those records available, so I sent them. The company sent me a notice two days later, saying those records were from before I purchased their policy!!!! Well, I knew that, so why in the world did their employee demand those records????? Actually, before I bought their policy, they claimed THEY would do the contacting of my vets, but I got many demands from them to contact my vets myself for information FOR THEM when they were digging for preexisting condition information. Liars! The FINAL STRAW was when one of their stupid underlings tried to claim a ridiculous preexisting condition would negate their paying nearly $6000 worth of cancerous bone claims because I had my vet freeze off a SKIN WART!!!!! Really!!!! After I threatened legal action and getting the state Insurance Commision involved, they FINALLY paid, with no apology, no anything for all they'd put me through. Just horrible. I still cry nearly every day, not because my sweet greyhound had a leg amputated, but because she only has a few months to live. Embrace pays for her chemo therapies, but these rotten creeps sent me notice that they will NOT be paying for her some of her sister's future problems due to made-up preexisting conditions!! Her greyhound sister is covered on the same policy, and although I have made NO CLAIMS for her, they went right ahead and did a major investigation on this dog's medical records WITHOUT MY PERMISSION!!!!! This company is UNBELIEVABLY HEARTLESS.
title: Embrace Pet Insurance is HORRIBLE

text: I often see complaints on social media regarding pet insurance. Recently, complaints around skyrocketing increases in premiums without cause. I can honestly say that I haven't had that experience with Embrace. If I file a claim I'm reimbursed within a week or two at the most. Their rates are fair and their claim process is very simple.
title: I often see complaints on social media…

text: The turnaround time on my claim was surprising and appreciated. I was unable to reach anyone by phone as the wait time was way long.  I did email and the response time was very good as well.  All and all, a great experience.
title: Embrace Rocks!

text: I made my first claim after two years of having this insurance.  I received e-mail notice of claim acceptance within 1 day,and received a check within about a week.  I was also informed that any dental disease claims would be denied as pre-existing (did not apply at this time) since the vet notes mentioned very mild tartar.  It said that if my dog gets a dental cleaning done, that pre-existing condition will be removed.  This seems ridiculous for very mild tartar, but I do appreciate the heads-up.  It also said that if she ever has an orthopedic problem, it would not be covered until they got vet records from the 6 month orthopedic waiting period.  Since they just got vet records for the current claim, they should review and document those now, instead of possibly requesting them 5 years from now.
title: I made my first claim after two years…

text: The Embrace policy is a total waste of money.  They pay for very little or nothing at all and always have some reason for not paying.  Our dog ate a stick but we were told accidents are not covered and would not be reimburse.  Since when is a dog eating a stick an accident?  On another occasion he jumped out of the car and sprained his shoulder.  They classified it as a pre-existing condition and would not cover it.  How is a sprained shoulder a preexisting condition?  We will not be renewing after this policy expires.
title: The Embrace policy is a total waste of…

text: I would highly recommend this insurance to all pet owners. They are fast and efficient, and they get refund to you fast and above all they care about animals and their health.  What more can I ask for.
title: 5 Stars to Embrace Pet Insurance

text: The monthly premium is affordable compared to other insurances. However, I think they do a great job of trying to find the smallest things to deny a claim. I was told vomiting is a chronic condition for my puppy due to me calling my vet to ask a simple question in which they told me in a 3 month puppy, vomiting bile in the morning was normal and to feed him an extra meal. Now that is considered a chronic condition when my puppy wasn’t treated for anything or diagnosed.
title: The monthly premium is affordable…

text: I have 2 pet insurances (one for another pet with a pre-existing). While Embrace is less costly/mo than my other insurance, I find that they are much more tedious to file a claim. I think it doesn’t make sense to be required to provide all the info they request if they are only going to request the medical records anyway. Also my last claim was frustrating as they took a completely non-related prior finding as a reason to deny my claim. I had to have the veterinarian ultimately write a letter stating the claim was in no way related due the claim yo be paid. It seemed like such a waste of everyone’s time, when it was clearly not related. It just seems like Embrace was trying to get out of paying vs making sure they provided quality service.
title: Tedious to file claims that may be denied for unrelated medical findings

text: I have never used pet insurance before so I did not know what to expect.  I was pleasantly surprised how easy it was to file a claim.  I received an email instantly letting me know the process and within a week I received confirmation of my benefits and the amount I will be reimbursed for the claim.  Unfortunately my beautiful dog did not do well after the surgery and we had to put her down shortly after but it was comforting to know that we had insurance and I was able to do everything possible to save her. I am deeply grateful to Embrace.

text:
Here’s my experience- purchased a plan for $107 a month for my 9 year old cane corso. Had my vet send Kaya’s health records so I would know everything they consider preexisting conditions. I had a feeling there would be a few things bc she’s 9, but let me tell you- they got back to me 2 weeks later telling me that they won’t cover basically ANYTHING.

There were things under preexisting that the vet has never said are a problem! They said she has plaque buildup yet the vet has always said she has perfect teeth and does not even need to get a cleaning. They also said that she has arthritis so any hip problems are preexisting which has never been diagnosed. Her Vet has always said her mobility is fine. And they said any cancer &/or lumps will not be covered bc she has had a few (we had them all tested and none were cancer so idk how they can exclude cancer as preexisting). Also, bc I called the office to ask about swallowing something (she had not actually swallowed anything, it was a phone conversation) so Embrace said that’s not covered either. 

Now I’ve been waiting on the phone for 30 minutes to try to cancel my plan which is also an issue bc they pick up right away to sell you a plan. 

Overall I do NOT recommend this company.
title: This company has too many preexisting conditions they add for senior age dogs

text:
If you love your pet Insure them. 

Everyone says don't get pet insurance. For me I purchased for Catastrophic Illness and for the last 18 months that's exactly what my little guy has. Taking the financial burden off a furbabies illness has allowed us to make better decisions. And as our journey nears its end, I know I have had my little guy longer because I insured him and I picked a great company that pays my claims and didn't cancel us when we got diagnosed with Cancer. Fantastic people. Fantastic company. No words can ever express my gratitude for them.
title: If you love your pet Insure them

First of all, all the emails you sent me where asking for mor medical records. I advised you multiple times, hey she’s a puppy. I gave you her records that the breeder gave me and you kept asking for more records. Your emails kept asking for a years worth! Lol this is almost comical. She was an 8 week old puppy. Seriously? I kept emailing you guys telling you this and I would get the same automated response. 
Don’t get me started on my other dog I have a claim open since April 2021 that’s supposed to be A WELLNESS VIST! He got his shots!!!!! They gave him anxiety medication because he was scared of them. 
Yet you send me the automated responses need 12 months of records. 
I have contacted his vet and they sent you everything, not sure what I need for a WELLNESS VIST. 

EMBRACE IS A JOKE. 

None of my friends nor family will get it. I am very vocal about it on Facebook.

text: My dog had a problem with her eye.  I thought she was going to go blind as she was bumping into things and couldn't find her food or doors.  She was sent by her Vet to an opthalmoligist for tests and it was an infection in her cornea and she had to have medications and drops and return in 2 weeks. Within 2 days she was seeing really well again but the infection was not completely healed.  We went again this week and the eye is healed and she only needs drops until her next visit in 3 months.  I was very pleased with the amount that Embrace paid for her visits and also their customer service when I called with some questions.
title: My dog had a problem with her eye

text: Embrace has been truly helpful and wonderful for our dog. The new claim uploading process has made everything so much easier. Customer service has always been great. My only complaint is that the premium has continued to increase.
title: Embrace is wonderful!

text: My dachshund had IVDD a while ago and needed to get back surgery asap as he suddenly lost motor function in his legs. This incident happened to occur at a very unusual time regarding my insurance policy. When I called Embrace they informed me that my 6 -month waiting period did not end until midnight of that day. So basically, if I put off my dog's surgery until 1 minute past midnight, I could have gotten the surgery covered (at least that's what they claim). They told me there was nothing they could do, no options or suggestions were offered to me, they offered to cover NOTHING. I understand the 6-month waiting period policy not covering the surgery itself but I was surprised that I was told I couldn't get coverage for a single thing outside of that surgery either (medications, blood work, hospital stay fees, nothing). I paid in for 6 months and couldn't utilize anything from the insurance because of a couple hours between my dog's surgery and the end of my 6-month waiting period. I would have thought that basic services would have been covered at least such as the initial vet visit at my local clinic and the services they provided. Needless to say, I have a different insurance company now.
title: Very Disappointing

text: My large dog had emergency surgery and Embrace reimbursed the cost, less my deductible quickly.  Process was easy, seemless, and transparent which was much appreciated after the chaos leading up to needing the emergency surgery. Thanks Embrace!

text:
We adopted a dog in February, 2021. Since he was transported from down South with a van full of dogs, he developed kennel cough that needed to be treated shortly after he arrived. He fully recovered from that with antibiotics. That was the start of our issues with Embrace.

He developed another cough, with no close contact with other dogs, several months later. This was determined to be a "pre-existing condition", apparently simply because it was respiratory, and even though the earlier cough had completely cleared up and he had been healthy for months.

Our most recent interaction with Embrace was the topper. He was diagnosed with heartworm, and you guessed it, the claim was rejected as a pre-existing condition, even though I see no connection between respiratory infections that have been cured and newly-diagnosed heartworm, and neither does our vet.

Apparently, everything is now a pre-existing condition in Embrace's eyes. I don't see what the point is in pet insurance if nothing, even things that are seemingly unrelated, aren't covered.

It may make more sense to cancel the policy, save the premiums, and pay out of pocket, since that's what we're doing anyway.
title: Everything is a pre-existing condition with Embrace

text:
Good Insurance with good coverage at reasonable prices.
Coverage of medication cost is good. I use embrace for all my pets and will continue to do so.

Unfortunately there is no coverage for anything preventative, they have a wellness rewards program that is a literal money pit so I have never used it.
( explanation below )

You put money into it the rewards program ($450 or $650 per year) and then when you take your pet for grooming/training/preventative care treatments you pay completely out of pocket. Then you submit a wellness rewards claim and they reimburse you. If you purchased the $650 option and you only spend $200 does the money roll over? do they give it back? NO, they keep it, you didn't use it so you lost it, it's theirs now.

Summary: Wellness Rewards program is a "budgeting tool", where you lose all money you put in that you didn't use and where you put twice the strain on your wallet. (1st money into the wellness rewards, 2nd money at treatment purchase)

Ruling:
Get the insurance with Embrace, get RX reimbursement with Embrace, they are really good.

Wellness Rewards are useless, if preventative care is your primary concern get your insurance or a budgeting tool elsewhere...
title: Good Insurance (treatment + RX) Bad Preventative Care Program

text:
I gave one star as it doesn’t allow “0”.

I did my share of checking and Embrace initially appeared to be a decent above board company that offered multiple options on policies.

What a friggin joke! I purchased a policy for my dog in July 2020. I was well aware of waiting periods for sickness and orthopedic care, or having an exam to essentially “clear” them for coverage.

In August 2021, THIRTEEN months after purchasing my dog suffered a broken leg. Now I’m being told she isn’t covered because I didn’t have a screening exam, with one agent telling me “maybe”, as if it could be, a pre-existing condition. WT actual F? A severe spiral fracture pre-existing? As if I’d wait more than a year for treatment.

After much back and forth and a truckload of condescending BS the Embrace rep I spoke to, with apparent support from management, are denying  benefits because she wasn’t pre-screened over a year ago for orthopedics for an accidental broken leg now. I understand the 6 month waiting period for ortho care when you sign up.

I was informed that the waiting period is extended if no exam occurs. So I’ve been paying on a policy now for 16 months and it still wouldn’t be provide ben fits, with ortho waiting period beginning again because she’s had a broken leg. How’s that for circular logic?

The recent rep told me that I was sent emails explaining these conditions. Really? An email? Not one that identified my specific issues but the general ones describing their policy. I have never seen them but that’s not a surprise. I don’t scan my “spam” folder for messages. I also had a few other things to focus on. Deployments tend to keep you occupied.

They “graciously” (heavy sarcasm here” offered to refund my payments to this point and allow me to start over. As if there were any way in HELL I would use, recommend or even consider their company at this point.

This is the second dog in less than a year they have denied benefits. The other one died. I won’t even bother describing why they denied the claim. Let’s just say it as equally ludicrous.

I went with Embrace initially as among other things it was sponsored by USAA. I will most definitely let them know the company has NO issue screwing over veterans.

Save yourself time, money, stress and your pets welfare. Find a company that actually honors their policy.

In addition to this review I plan to do the same on Google, FB, the Better Business Bureau, NCPB and any other site I can find to forewarn others.

I’m not into anonymity when reviewing. I WANT them to know who wrote this review.

Sincerely,

David Cunningham

text: My dogs are currently 12. I got Embrace policies for them as puppies, because I wanted them to have coverage when they were older. Embrace did allow me to see any vet and did pay the claims. If you are looking for pet insurance for a puppy, hoping it will carry protection when they are older, Embrace raised the cost of the policies such that it would cost $1,000+ more year to have pet insurance, on a max claim, than to not. I didn't catch this earlier, the higher premiums started when they were 9-10 but I didn't pause to do the math. I regret not going with a different pet insurance company from the start and want to warn others who are shopping for insurance for puppies. They told me it is not based on health conditions or claims- simply the age of the dog, breed of dog, and zip code. My recommendation shopping for pet insurance for a puppy is don't make my mistake- shop based on quotes for an older dog. There are other companies that offer reasonable plans for older dogs that, if I had gone with from the get go, I wouldn't have any concern of pre-existing conditions. Also, when Embrace offered the option of increasing the limits on the policy so that the high amount I was paying would make more sense (with a higher annual limit), pre-existing conditions would then be an issue. A customer service agent told me repeatedly that because my 12 year old dog had diarrhea as a puppy, which was cured with antibiotics, any disorder that could potentially have a symptom of diarrhea would not be covered- be wary of their interpretation/response to pre-existing conditions. What dog won't have diarrhea within it's lifetime?
title: My dogs are currently 12

text:
Our Labrador mix was unexpectedly diagnosed with a Cancer tumor.  Surgery was the best treatment as we headed down the path of finding specialists, big words, and multiple visits to animal hospitals.
During my first call to Embrace, Dan calmly walked me through the process and had words of encouragement.  I was a person not a number - in today's world, that was nice.
I expected to wait weeks or even months to be reimbursed, but was pleasantly surprised it only took 72 hours, and everything according to our policy was covered.  The saying "you get what you pay for" can be applied in our situation.  I've paid on the policy for months with very healthy dogs and thought that perhaps I was wasting my money.  I was wrong.  We were blindsided with this diagnosis, but our dog was able to get the very best medical tests, surgeon, and care because it was covered.
I am happy to say our dog is cancer free and back to chasing squirrels.
title: Back to chasing squirrels

text: I have 2 dogs covered by Embrace. Overall, I have found Embrace easy to work with and the coverage most important to me is affordable and comprehensive. My only complaint is a exclusion in the policy on our recent shelter adopt. I took her directly from the shelter to my vet for him to verify health info provided to us . She was scratching and he documented that. Now  any claims for “itching” are not covered. Turns out she was filthy and the next stop was the groomer who washed her several times- no scratching anymore but the exclusion stands. So much for being conscientious and rescuing from the shelter.
title: Great,  except for exclusion

text: I tried Embrace on a lark, not really believing in pet insurance. I figured we’d try it and our first claim would get denied, but hey at least we tried. I am shocked and so pleased to say the opposite happened. My dog started having seizures suddenly, had to be taken the ER and then was out on expensive medicine. So I filed a claim and within days, I got a refund that covered a large majority of the cost of his care. Like I said, I was shocked. Then, he had a really big seizure, was taken to the ER and, thousands of dollars later, we were told he has terminal cancer. But with surgery we can buy him a few more happy, healthy feeling months. We can’t imagine how much harder it would have been to be losing our beloved pet and thousands upon thousands of dollars at the same time. We are so grateful we chose Embrace. Their staff and their wonderful, easy to use app has made a horrible experience so much easier.

When I got 8 week old Bella my mom told me to get pet insurance. Hands down, Embrace seemed like the best across the board. They were clear on their annual cap and reimbursement percentage per claim so that’s who I went with. I would have never expected to need to them as soon as I did when Bella was viciously attacked at just 3 months old. Without Embrace, I wouldn’t have been able to afford Bella’s life saving ER care after the owner (of the white Malamute which was off a leash while she rollerbladed) took off leaving me with not just a disheartened heart in humanity, but also left me with a hefty medical bill followed by a year of intense home health care, medication, re-integration therapy, and doctor visits for Bella. Embrace annual fee is worth every single penny!

text:
My puppy got pneumonia within a couple days of the end of the waiting period for pre-existing conditions. Based on that, after months of not approving any claims, the finalized a review of my puppy’s medical history and responded with the broadest possible interpretation of what would be excluded based on his illness as a puppy. 

The claims adjuster said that they would not actually enforce the limitations as broadly as the exclusions are written because they “try to cover” as many claims as they can. Clearly, that’s not the case if they even have pre-existing conditions exclusions to begin with. More importantly, I basically have no idea at this point what my policy  covers. They can’t explain what is covered so I know if I can bring my puppy to the vet and have coverage for him. And, if I bring him in for anything that falls under those absurdly broad exceptions and they decide not to cover it, the clock resets on his exclusions. Basically, at this point, I have no confidence that I can afford my pet’s care and I can’t change my insurance because, since they took so long to come back with their terrible and overly broad interpretation of exclusions, there would now be additional exclusions for pre-existing conditions if I went with a competitor. 

If, as your representatives say, you try to cover as much as you can for your members, then just do that and provide them the confidence that their pets will receive the care they deserve. Excluding pneumonia makes sense. Excluding every possible symptom that could be related to any respiratory infection is a way to minimize coverage, maximize profits, put pets at risk, and increase the financial burden put on pet owners.

The company’s response below perfectly illustrates the problem. They’re writing these exclusions so that they can deny coverage on anything related to diarrhea, vomiting, coughing, eye discharge, or any upper respiratory infection for 1 year whether or not those symptoms are related to what my puppy was actually sick from during the incident in question. He could get any of those symptoms from a WIDE variety of illnesses. If he gets any of those symptoms and I take him to a vet, not only do I likely bear the full cost, Embrace gets to reset the clock on these “short term” exclusions. Representatives from the company would say they would never do such a thing and would only refuse coverage if...something, something...that they can’t explain. Why should I believe you? Also if, as you said in your reply, you just “have to comply” with all the fine print you hope your customers don’t notice when they sign up for a policy, then please don’t say that you try to cover everything. You don’t. And you haven’t provided any clarity on what is covered. In reality, your organization has made choice to exclude coverage in the broadest terms possible. Don’t hide behind “have to” when these situations are a result of conscious organizational choices to enhance company profitability at the expense of your customers and their pets.
title: Unreasonably broad and unclear exclusions

text:
My puppy was seen by a canine dentist for a misaligned canine tooth 2-1/2 months ago. I submitted a claim, which has not been credited toward our deductible. A follow up for a second opinion with a better qualified vet 2 months ago also still on hold. In the mean time, in lieu of surgery, using an inexpensive device and with the approval of the second dentist, I was able to encourage his canine tooth into the correct position, saving us and Embrace money. 

I have given Embrace every single thing they've asked for as far as medical records are concerned. I have provided information for the out of state vet that did his well puppy check where he was deemed healthy with no medical issues. Had he come from a shelter or "rescue", instead of a responsible breeder, he would have no medical records to check, so I guess Embrace is penalizing me for owning a well bred dog from a responsible breeder.

I received yet another email stating that the claim is on hold for want of medical records, that I know have already been provided to Embrace. Because we have a high deductible Embrace isn't even paying any money on this claim, merely crediting a portion of the bill toward our annual deductible. Embrace seems to be making no effort to resolve this claim without me calling them every few weeks to inquire why it hasn't yet been resolved.

Embrace used to be a wonderful company. They've obviously changed.

Edited to add: I have already provided ALL of my puppy's medical records to Embrace. Their request that I do so again, is just another example of their continued foot dragging. No employee that I have talked to has been happy to research anything to get this claim credited. It's all on me, as an owner, to call Embrace repeatedly and hope I get an employee willing to actually address this specific issue. When Embrace got records that did not answer their questions, they did nothing except send me yet another non-specific email refusing to credit my claim toward my puppy's deductible.

Edited to add: Just received yet another foot dragging email from Embrace that concluded with the following. "This process can take up to 30 business days once we've collected all necessary medical records, and it is likely you will not receive any updates during this time." and "Feel free to contact us if our requested time frame has been exceeded." This says everything you need to know about Embrace - we're gonna drag our feet and it's on the customer to keep following up as we do. Zero-star service.
title: Months of foot dragging to credit claim toward deductible

text: Better off just saving what you pay a month. I recently took my dog to vet and ended up  with over a 600 dollar vet bill. I paid out of pocket to be reimbursed later. I pay over 65 dollars a month. I have had them 8 months. So about 520 dollars is what I’ve paid them so far. I filed my claim, which took forever , it was way more than the two business days that was stated to me because I was a USAA member.  Moving on, once my claim way filed, out of the 600 something odd dollars, they took 500 something for the deductible. So it’s left me with 70 something odd dollars for my 600 plus vet bill. Apparently this is something you must pay every year, then and only then you’re only eligible for up 80 percent reimbursement. If you ask me, you’re better off putting aside 150 a month for your pets, that way when you need the money there is no wait. Makes no difference since you’re paying out of pocket to begin with. Just another thing you pay tons of money into for what? Maybe your healthy pet needs some surgery or something? Most dogs never have issues till they are older anyways. If you feed your beloved best friend the best and love them. Most times that’s enough till later on in their life. So if you set aside 150 a month, that’s 1800 a year, so I’m going off of my dogs, the oldest which is 8, I would have saved over 12,600 for vet emergencies etc. trust me when I tell you, this is way better than eating a 600 dollar vet bill because of a deductible. Do the smart thing and start saving now. That way there is no maybe, that you’ll get reimbursed. You will have the money and not worry about dealing with a damn claims department and wasting 68 plus dollars a month on some crap. When you get a pet, start saving as much as you can every month. Like I said just my two cents, on the service here. I would rather have my money and use it when I need it.
title: Why waste over 500 dollars a month? Start saving!!

text: I have been very pleased with the service Embrace insurance has given me.  Because of my dog's health issues, I am very happy that I decided to obtain coverage for him,  Thank you for your excellent service.

text:
Embrace has been a pleasure to do business with.  We first had Embrace years ago with an older dog and it sure came in handy.  When he passed, they were kind enough to send a note and still processed the final claims in record time.

Now, we have a new puppy and she gets into everything.  We had an unfortunate incident and she ended up at Emergency Veterinary Services, with a costly emergency surgery. Since we had all our examinations/checks done before this incident, we had everything covered, and it truly is a savior.  A few thousand dollar bill became manageable since the policy kicked in.  We just needed to pay for the deductible, our "co-insurance", and the rest was covered as expected.  The mobile application and web portal made it very easy to follow the process along, and the complete reimbursement process from submission to direct deposit of funds took less than two weeks.  

All in all, I highly recommend Embrace to anyone looking for a pet insurance policy.  We also have the Wellness program and it pays itself back over the course of the year making it easy to budget for necessary vet visits.  
 
Read your policy documents and follow all the advice, and you'll be extremely happy!!  The policy comes in handy when you need it.  The stress relief alone is worth it. 

Thank you Embrace!
title: Embrace has been a pleasure to do…

text: I’ve had Embrace for years and needed to submit a claim for the first time. Incredibly prompt and caring service and a very worthwhile policy.

text:
My dog needed very expensive dental care. Embrace was helpful throughout the process. They quickly answered my inquiry before the procedure so I could determine whether or not the procedure would be covered. 

Then after the procedure, they helped me file the claim, indicating that doing so through their app or website would make the claim process much faster. 

Embrace kept me informed throughout their review process so I could know what was happening. Then, when the review was complete, they did reimburse me for about 70% of the cost. The entire process, from filing thr claim to reimbursement took about 3 weeks. 

After they completed their review, they also sent me a detailed email indicating the effects this reimbursement would have on future claims for dental work. 

Overall, I would rate Embrace as outstanding. I have also told my primary veterinarian and the dental veterinarian how well Embrace did for me. Both will be sure their colleagues know about my excellent experience
title: Excellent support

text: Our brilliant dog swallowed a popsicle stick hole one night.  My husband had to take him to the emergency vet, where they originally quoted close to $3,000.  My husband got very concerned about the amount until I reminded him we had pet insurance.  We had a general estimate on what would be covered, but we were very appreciative at how quickly Embrace processed the claim.  We would've done anything to save Flynn regardless, but saving money (and getting paid back quickly) made it a lot less stressful.
title: Our brilliant dog swallowed a popsicle…

text: Two years ago I lost a beloved dog to diabetes, the loss left a huge hole in both my heart and my pocket as she was not insured.  I decided at that moment to insure my Boston Terrier and researched different pet insurances.  I decided on Embrace and I am very happy that I made this choice.  The first year my healthy Boston earned a reduction in deductible going from 200 dollars to 150 dollars.  I thought we were going to continue that trend when 6 months into the second year of the policy I noticed my Boston short of breath.  I took him to the vet and upon testing it was determined that he had developed cardiac problems.  I am so happy that I will be able to continue with the best care for my little guy because of Embrace Insurance.  They have been an absolute pleasure to have as a partner in my dogs health.
title: Two years ago I lost a beloved dog

text: I've had insurance on my GSP for over five years and never made a claim, and I'm a glass half empty type when it comes to insurance. I expected a bad experience when my boy needed emergency surgery. I got quote the opposite. Claim submitted and within a week I received a check, less deductable. Can't complain about that no matter how hard you try. I have already recommended Embrace to others
title: Worth every penny when it counts

text: Pet Embrace Insurance has been great for our Pom.. Thanks.
title: Pet Embrace Insurance has been great…

text: My dog needed surgery for swallowing a fist-size toy. I submitted the paperwork as soon as I got it and Embrace reimbursed me every penny of 90% over my deductible, no questions asked, within two weeks. Great experience and so helpful and reassuring during a stressful time.
title: Fast and Reliable!

text: Have had Embrace Pet Insurance for a few years now, and this year was the first time having to put a claim in. Contacted Customer Service beforehand and the rep was very friendly and knowledgeable and was quickly able to answer my questions. The claim process was simple especially with the app to upload docs and see the progress of the claim. Once approved the funds were in my account the next day. Will continue to recommend Embrace to our friends and neighbors who are looking for a pet insurance company.
title: First Claim with Embrace

text: We lost our 15 1/2 year-old dog in November, which was very difficult. Around this same time our two other dogs started having health issues. This is all very emotional, scary and expensive. As the medical bills were mounting, I finally got to the point where I needed to take the time to gather the paperwork (which I already had, but needed to scan) and submit the claims. To my pleasant surprise, the claims process requires no claims forms to be completed by me or the various veterinarians; all I needed to do was upload the detailed receipts and provide an explanation, as well as upload any supporting documentation I had. This could not have been easier! By checking the status of the claims online I could tell that the claims reps had started to work on them, as well as the status of each. There were 18 claims that I initially submitted. If there was any additional information needed from the vets, the claims reps requested what was needed. Some claims were processed and paid within 2 days, and all were processed and paid in just under one week!!! This far surpassed any expectations I had. Because I pay all bills in full, It was nice to be able to replenish the savings account that had taken quite a hit in a relatively short period of time. Unfortunately there will continue to be medical bills for both dogs. Hopefully the issues with one dog may not be as bad as originally diagnosed, but one dog has a couple of different cancers and is going through treatment, which will be ongoing for a while, so fingers crossed he does as well as another dog of ours who had cancer many years ago and lived 6 years after diagnosis and treatment (to nearly 18!!!). Anyway, because there will obviously be more expenses to come, it’s nice to know the claims process is so streamlined and the claims staff diligent in processing the claims quickly - one less thing to worry about! My experience with Embrace has been stellar!
title: Embrace has far exceeded expectations!

text: I have been very happy with Embrace.  They process claims online and they don't question or require undue paperwork.  This last claim was after my dog swallowed a corn cob.  Xrays and Ultrasounds were required.  Luckily the Doctors ultimately ruled out the need for surgery but that still left me with $1,700 in vet bills.  Embrace took care of the vast majority just as my plan coverage was designed.
title: I have been very happy with Embrace

text: Excellent customer service. I received my payments very quickly. I highly recommend the company!

text: I've found Embrace Pet Insurance easy to work with. They have been great answering my questions and helping me to understand their process. Once the medical review was completed claims were handled immediately. If I had a question on the resolution of a claim they reviewed it right away. When surgery was required they reviewed the surgeon's proposal and ruled on on pre-approval within 24 hours which made it so much easier to plan. I would love to never have to make a claim but when it does happen I feel confident I have a partner with Embeace to help with the financial planning of my pets' care.
title: Trusted partner for helping with my pets' health care.

Yoi see the veterinsrian words are infallible . Their words are law and cannot be questioned. Predatory and beneficial at the same moment.  Contradictory and confusing. Bailey is fine now. Thank God but, I always think what if....no noney meant no service or mountain of debt.

title: Claims were easy to submit and the…

text:
Embrace has the best offerings for coverage that I have seen.  This helps fit the monthly payment into a tight budget while still being a huge help if something awful happens.  It has always been my opinion that the function of insurance companies is to avoid any payouts.  Embrace has proved me wrong.

The only complaint I have about this company is the time it takes to get reimbursed.  Our first claim was early in the pandemic, and it took a very long time to get results.  The second claim was more recently, and the timing was better.

If I understand correctly, once I file a claim Embrace has a defined amount of time to process and pay or deny.  In our cases that's not exactly what happened.  I was told several times that they have 14 days to process a claim.  

As it turned out our claims were paid 14 days after they contacted our vet and processed the paperwork.  But the problem was, the vet was not contacted for several weeks.  Once the vet responded, Embrace started processing. So 14 days from claim-to-result was not quite correct and a bit deceptive.

Other than that, our coverage is fine. I do enjoy the Embrace website and all the information provided.
title: Excellent coverage, good options, slow processing.

text: The reimbursement for a claim I submitted was very quick.  The company's communication is excellent.  I would recommend Embrace for your pet's insurance.
title: The reimbursement for a claim I…

text:
The worst pet insurance company! Although their operators are very pleasant, they as a company are nothing but vile. Waiting for an average of 5 months to get every claim i ever filed to be closed and that was after having to call them multiple times to get them to do their jobs. I also awaited payments which was never as much as they claimed to cover. After I had to euthanize my ESA under emergency circumstances, they emailed me back and forth for a month because they couldn’t find the information that was sent to them. When it was all said and done, they only covered $39 out of the $819 bill because I didn’t have a wellness plan? What is the point of having pet insurance if it won’t cover emergencies? Not to mention this was the fourth trip to an ER vet with my dog since we opened the policy with them in a 18month period, they always covered his ER visits. 
If you care about your dog, don’t trust Embrace to cover you. They are a scam of a company, spend your money elsewhere.
title: The worst pet insurance company

text: I used embrace for the final 3.5 years of my senior’s kitty’s life. They were great and always explained the whys and how’s of everything. I think showing compassion in a situation like that is really amazing coming from a company and I appreciated it so much!

I was appropriately reimbursed and didn’t have any issues with them trying to get out of reimbursing things they said they would. Would recommend Embrace to others.
title: Satisfied with my experience

text: We have had Embrace for a few years but finally had to use the insurance for a large medical expense for one of our dog recently. Every customer service rep we spoke with was very friendly and helpful and resolved issues on the first quick phone call. Once our claim was submitted, it was a little confusing as they split it up into multiple claims which I assume was splitting each day our dog was in the hospital as a separate claim, which was fine. We were able to set up direct deposit for our reimbursement which was incredibly convenient. It took about one week from submitting the claim to receiving our total reimbursement (we maxed out our policy). There were no issues with anything not being covered or issues getting our refund approved. Overall the process was quick and painless and the insurance worked as it was supposed to. We are very grateful as we would not have been able to move forward with the surgery for our dog had we not had this insurance policy. Also grateful for those customer service reps who on top of being great at their jobs seemed to be very caring in regards to the well being of our dog and our stress level over the whole situation.

text: WARNING:  If you decide to sign up when you have a puppy, they WILL NOT PAY YOUR CLAIM and will find every excuse NOT to pay it.  Everything is considered a "pre-existing" condition.  I signed up when I had my dog for 4 days and somehow everything is a "pre-existing condition".  It took them 3 months to actually process a claim (meanwhile I'm paying premiums).  I cancelled and went with Trupanion who actually pays claims.
title: WARNING

text: I have had Embrace pet insurance for 6 years now and would like to warn people before getting involved with this company. We've thankfully only had small claims for our 2 dogs and claims customer service and processing has always been great. Our original policy was affordable but every year Embrace has increased our policy by about $40 (~25% increase) per month (!!). Its completely PREDATORY because they know that once you have a policy its hard to make the decision to cancel or decrease coverage, especially for all of us to care deeply for our pets and want to protect them. We've had to carefully reduce our coverage over the past few years to keep our premiums reasonable. I've made numerous complaints, especially when asked to pay an additional $40 per month for our most recent renewal during COVID.  They're tone deaf and don't care about keeping you as a customer. Please be careful in considering this company for insurance--you're much better off setting aside some savings on your own. Beware.
title: Beware of this company - Honest review from customer of 6 years

text: We're very happy with the way our claim was processed and with the lightning fast reimbursement.  I recommend Embrace pet insurance to all of our friends that have pets.

title: We are currently stationed in South…

text:
We got a young, healthy rescue dog and immediately took our an insurance policy through Embrace. Less than three weeks later his eye had an infection that went from bad to worse within hours. While treating him, his eye ruptured and we needed to have emergency surgery performed to salvage any vision for him in the infected eye. 
We've dealt with insurance for humans before and I was prepared to have to fight and submit ridiculous amounts of documentation and battle through denied claims several times to get reimbursed for the very expensive treatments our dog needed. But much to my surprise Embrace treated us with integrity and beyond accommodating customer service. I needed only to submit our vet paperwork, as asked for on the website, and send a few additional clarifications for the Embrace Vets to better understand the nature of our claim. And best of all we our reimbursement checks were processed in under two weeks.
It was so refreshing to work with a company that wasn't out to fleece me but actually provided the service they advertised with no strings or smoke screens. We plan to use Embrace for as long as we are blessed to have our dog and for any future fur babies. I would highly recommend Embrace to any pet owner.
And by the way, this is about the third positive review I've ever written, so let that speak for itself.
title: Insurance with Integrity

text:
In the past, we didn't insure our dogs. This time, with encouragement from our breeder, we decided to insure both of our dogs. We were in complete shock when our younger girl, just 14 months old, became severely ill. 
After consulting with the emergency vet, I decided to call Embrace to explain what was going on and ask questions about our policy. The rep immediately opened a pre-cert to let me know where things stood. 
I was able to breathe a huge sigh of relief that the tough decisions we might have to make about our girl wouldn't be influenced by lack of money because our Embrace insurance was going to help us take care of her.
Our girl is on the mend, though we still have a long road ahead of us, but Embrace has processed our claims in a timely manner to help us manage the financial burden of her care. I have nothing but praise for the customer service and quick turn-around time for claims processing! 
I'm so thankful we listened to our breeder's recommendation and insured our girls!
title: Best Decision Ever - Insuring Our Dogs with Embrace!
