text: I cannot even begin to tell you how impressed I am with the coverage of the insurance for my dog Buddy. I am a senior care manager and I deal with insurance claims all the time. It takes weeks and sometimes months to get claims paid. I did not know what to expect with regards to getting approved and paid under pet insurance with Embrace. I just heard about this company last September. This is when I purchased insurance for my dog. This November, he had to have surgery to repair a torn acl on his left knee. The cost was $3000.00. I submitted my claim the same day of the surgery. I was approved and the money was in my bank account in less than a week. When you hear that it is too good to be true, I am telling you that Embrace is the exception to this. They are too good to be true and i can tell you that they are excellent beyond any experience I have ever had with any type of insurance. Thank you for helping me out with the most important thing in my life - My sweet Buddy.

text: Our dog has had some really bad luck medically, but Embrace has always paid each of the many claims with speed and accuracy.  All one has to do is fill out the claim form, attach copies of the invoices and payments made, and they quickly send a reimbursement check.  Our dog needed spinal surgery...Embrace paid for that and all connected meds and appointments.  Our dog also needed bladder surgery due to stones...Embrace paid the reimbursement rate as per the policy.  Our dog has an ongoing problem with white blood cell production (Immune Mediated Neutropenia) and needs monthly blood work, specialists visits, and medications.  Again, Embrace pays as per the policy as expected.  Any time I call for information, someone who is very kind and cheerful helps me.  Even with such a silly thing as how to print out a form...and they send you the proper forms in snail mail.  Nothing seems to be too big or small for Embrace to help us with.  Great Company!!!
title: Our dog has had some really bad luck…

text:
In my experience, Embrace Pet Insurance only cares about their bottom line and cares nothing about animals.  They made me jump through every possible hoop to not even consider a claim that I ultimately canceled.  Their customer service is the lowest form that it can not really be called service.  They were rude, untrustworthy, unhelpful, and could not be trusted.  To make matters worse, months after firing the company, they emailed me a list of items they wanted to "review with me" to let me know they they would not be covering for my pet based upon a review of her records.  I'm fine with a company having exclusions for pre-existing conditions, but Embrace has gone above and beyond to exclude every possible thing, they have taken months to review files, and ultimately have been grossly and negligently mismanaged my pet's records and been horrible stewards of her health.  This company is the most vile, untrustworthy, horrific, outrageously sinister organization I have yet to deal with.  Please people, do not buy from this bottom dweller company.  Here is the letter they sent me months after I had already fired them. Clearly they have no desire to cover anything yet they wanted to continue collecting my money.  Run people run!

Hello Robert,
While gathering medical history or chatting with you, one of our Embracers indicated it would be a good idea to a medical history review for Lucy. A medical history review is an email with an outline of any possible pre-existing conditions based on Lucy's medical history. It is just a way for us to communicate any coverage exclusions so you are not caught by surprise. We want you to have a full, clear understanding of your policy and any possible exclusions.
This medical history review tells you what is and is not covered based on any clinical signs and diagnoses noted in Lucy's medical history we have in hand over the last 12 months.
The following pre-existing chronic conditions shown in Lucy's vet records are excluded permanently:
1. Joint crepitation (of the stifles [knees], bilaterally); and any underlying/related conditions and/or clinical signs; including but not limited to osteoarthritis.
2. Tartar accumulation; as this abnormality was noted prior to your policy start, the condition is pre-existing and is therefore ineligible for coverage under your $1,000 dental illness sublimit. Reimbursement for this issue is available to you under our optional Wellness Rewards Plan. Wellness Rewards does not exclude pre-existing dental illnesses. Once Lucy has a dental cleaning performed, this pre-existing condition will expire, and future dental illness claims will be covered under your dental illness sublimit.   
3. Cranial cruciate ligament tear (CCL/ACL), bilaterally; and any related conditions and/or clinical signs. Osteoarthritis (of the knees), bilaterally; this is excluded as it is at a greater risk of developing due to the cruciate ligament tear.
4.  Adverse drug reaction to Nexgard; including but not limited to conditions caused by or related to the drug reaction.                   
5. Skin mass; the vet notes indicate that on 3/22/2019, Lucy had a mass on her back. I do not see that any diagnostics were performed (i.e. biopsy or fine needle aspirate) in order to determine the composition of this mass. As such, this and any future masses (including cancer) would be excluded from coverage by the policy. Having diagnostics performed on this mass (so that it can be determined what type of mass it is) will allow us to narrow the coverage exclusion down to only that type. If there were indeed lab tests done at the time, and those results just were not sent to us, please have them sent over so we can see the result records and modify the exclusion accordingly.
The following curable (temporary) conditions are excluded until Lucy has been free of them or any treatment of them for 12 months:
1. Vomiting; and any related/underlying condition. This exclusion may be eligible for expiration on 12/9/2020, provided Lucy remains free from symptoms and/or treatment for 12 months.
2. Abnormal lab value (elevated alkaline phosphatase, a liver value); this was listed as abnormal on lab work performed on 12/27/2019. Any condition related to this abnormality would not be covered by the policy unless we can clearly determine they are unrelated. This exclusion may expire on 4/30/2021 provided Lucy remains free of clinical signs and/or treatment for this for 12 consecutive months.

Note to follow up on Embrace’s response. I do not disagree with their terms to review history. I would like people to know that Embrace’s policies are unlike other similar companies and their customer service is combative and dismissive as you can see from their response to my review. This is a horrendous and appalling company.
title: In my experience this company is vile and abominable

The issue is that the condition never goes away and worsens but the coverage does forever!!!! They changed the policy after I had it for years.  You are best exploring other providers as this change impacts our puppy family in a horrific and unpleasant way.

text: I've had dogs for 20 years and currently have three. I have never purchased pet insurance before. Their website is well done, and they were certainly quick to process a full year of premiums for both my dogs.  6 months later, on July 8, I sent in two claims which occurred within weeks of each other. CRICKETS. I followed up a month later regarding both claims (for two different dogs.) They answered me about ONE and said they needed more information from my vet., but couldn't find the name or contact of the vet. I suppose the detailed diagnosis WITH the vet's name and contact which I submitted wasn't enough. It's been another week, and no response. Oh and the other claim they ignored, well they are still ignoring it. I don't know about other pet insurances but this one isn't worth your time or dime.

text: We have an 11 year old terrier mix.  She is overall healthy and I have never thought about having pet insurance on her.  However, as she is getting older and because I love her so much, I wanted the peace of mind of having coverage should she experience expensive health care cost as she ages.  I researched several pet insurance carriers and chose Embrace because their customer service representatives were very up front and patient about answering all my questions.  They also allowed me to view their evaluation of her exclusions based on pre-existing conditions after receiving the required veterinary records.  They had an appeal procedure for me to provide additional information to limit some of the broader exclusions based on not enough documentation in her records initially.  I think this is fair and exceptionally transparent.   I truly hope I never need to use the pet insurance, but I am comforted in knowing it is in place if needed.

Our dog suffered from several life-threatening issues during her lifetime.  We were able to have excellent treatment that made her life comfortable and happy ,and for us to enjoy her because of excellent coverage from Embrace.

title: Great price for insurance and very easy…

text:
I would not recommend Embrace , I have been treated poorly.
They denied my cat coverage based on some inaccurate notes by a vet who did not receive any information from me directly.
My cat was examined by a shelter vet at adoption and had  had an upper respiratory bacterial infection treated with anti biotics. He was given the all clear. Two other vets have examined my cat  since and found him to be in good health. After finding my cat unresponsive and unable to breath 9 months later I had to rush him to a new vet as my regular vet was unable to see him due to covid 19. The emergency vet referred me for further treatment to a specialist hospital. At that time my cat was put on Oxygen in intensive care and diagnosed with asthma. He was released on bronchodilators and has responded well to treatment. Embrace have covered one small bill from that day around $290 but denied all the others because they claim asthma is connected to a bacterial respiratory infection 9 months ago making it a pre existing condition. I have been able to show with vet notes and a video that the symptoms now are nothing like 9 months ago and not ore existing. Now Embrace have switched to denying my claim of over $2000 because the emergency vet notes  Say that I had said my Cat ALWAYS made squeaky wheezy sounds. I had not said that ,  my 15 year old daughter commented that he had sounded wheezy/ squeaky RECENTLY in her bed at night  but Embrace have now decided to cling to this. The vet who wrote this did not treat my cat at the time and the information she got was from four different team members who spoke to us in a chaotic parking lot on the day itself. It does not matter to Embrace that 3 other vets have never cited this or put it in any notes, they just don’t want to reimburse me so are using these inaccurate notes to deny my claim. Their communication is poor, I am still waiting for so many responses from them, the appeal was supposed to take 14 days and I had to chase them on day 26 for a response. Overall I am very unhappy and would not recommend them. If you do use them make sure when you see a vet ask to see the notes they have written before you leave the office because one slight error and Embrace will cling to it and use it to deny you despite any other vet reports and facts they are presented with.
title: Dishonest

text:
I wouldn't recommend Embrace to my worst enemy. We have never, ever had such a terrible experience with a pet insurance company.

In February 2020, our cat became violently ill and could not stop vomiting on multiple days. After two of our cat's claims for vomiting were covered by Embrace, we found out that her largest claim for surgery ($2,162.65) where the diagnosis was also vomiting, was denied.

Embrace is claiming that a small bout of diarrhea in March 2019 that entirely cleared up on its own, requiring no vet appointment or medical treatment, is directly correlated to her recent GI issues. They are making an absolutely absurd claim that our cat's condition is pre-existing. Our cat was even seen for an annual wellness exam in July 2019 and presented no issues.

Our vet stated in a letter to Embrace that it is not possible for her recently-diagnosed IBD to have remained completely asymptomatic for 11 months, and the two GI issues are in no way related.

Embrace continues to decline to comment on our vet's letter or factor it into their decision. They stated that all the other claims due to vomiting were covered and the claims not covered were due to the mention of  IBD. The largest claim in question for $2,162.65 had the diagnosis of vomiting, and Embrace continue to contradict themselves. There have been several claims with the diagnosis of vomiting that were denied.

The best part? We were only $80 away from meeting our $750 deductible before Embrace started denying our claims, not having to send us any reimbursement checks. How convenient for them. They will look for ANY reason not to cover a claim. Honestly, what pet hasn't had slight diarrhea once or twice? We are counting down the days until our policy ends.

Just to share one more example to further prove my point, a recent claim for eye drops was also denied, stating that in July 2018, our vet noted herpesvirus. Herpesvirus is extremely common in cats, and an estimated 80-90% have it. Symptom severity is low and it's very easy to manage. Again, Embrace will look for ANY excuse possible to deny your claim. If your pet has ever had any issue, look elsewhere for pet insurance or Embrace will claim it's a pre-existing condition.

After all the stress and sadness of dealing with our cat's recent GI illness, we were at least relieved to know we had purchased pet insurance and were thankful Embrace would alleviate some of the expenses. Joke's on us. We could not be more disappointed with Embrace and hope sharing our story steers you away from them.
_________________________________________

EDIT: I’m truly sorry to hear your cat is going through something similar, Darcy. Regarding your response below, actually, Embrace denied the claim for $2,162.65 that was specifically for vomiting. I'd love to know how a slight bout of diarrhea that required no treatment or vet appointment qualifies as a pre-existing condition. That's like me getting food poisoning and vomiting for a day without any treatment needed, and 11 months later, developing acute pancreatitis in which vomiting is my main symptom, and my insurance company denying my claim because my vomiting 11 months prior from food poisoning is a "pre-existing condition."

Echoing someone else's review, diarrhea, vomiting, and lethargy are symptoms that present in most illnesses (both minor and serious) in cats and dogs. I could not feel more sorry for these pets and their owners after they discover their claims will not be covered due to Embrace’s ridiculous "pre-existing condition" language in the fine print.

In other words, in order for Embrace to be a worthwhile investment, a pet would have to be in absolute perfect health with not even so much as a slight bout of diarrhea in their medical records. I agree that Embrace does not support shelter pets, as most cats and dogs who are rescued will have at least very minor medical issues. Please do better.
title: STAY AWAY!

text: I absolutely LOVE Embrace Pet Insurance, in fact I got my parents and cousins to get Embrace for their pups. From the customer service to the coverage, I can't be happier. We have a Border Collie/Black Lab rescue who had a lot of health issues (literally was nicknamed worm King - including heartworm. Treatment was over $2,000. Embrace covered almost the entire thing (I believe the amount I paid if I remember correctly was only $600), so talk about a life saver. We also have the $650 coverage for his wellness (and if you know labs, they SHED and need to be groomed A LOT). They cover all of his grooming visits, AND his wellness medicines and vet visits. In fact, I submitted a claim for his heartworm preventative and flea/tick preventative and the invoice didn't properly get submitted. Instead of me having to follow-up about my claim, they sent me an email making sure everything was submitted and that they would help submit my invoice to the claim. So easy - and QUICK! Literally. Claims get reviewed and processed in about 2-3 days.
title: I absolutely LOVE Embrace Pet…

text: Very smooth and efficient claims process.
title: Efficient and smooth

text: This organization goes out of its way to earn the many negatives reviews.  I wish I would have done more research.  You can see from the many negative reviews -- I am not alone.  They will nicely reject all your claims and give nonsensical reasons that allude to the fact that everything wrong with your pet is "pre-existing".  It's a really interesting business model.  In our case, a "pimple" sebaceous cyst on his legs or abdomen is a "pre-existing" condition that disqualifies him from a cancer diagnosis years later.  It doesn't matter how many times they were tested or observed -- one "pimple" anywhere disqualifies you from benefits anywhere.  This isn't an insurance company that operates for its clients -- It's a cold-hearted bunch of claims administrators searching for ways to hurt innocent people.
title: Don’t Waste Your Money

text:
As of now they are severely disappointing. 
I found out after months of enrollment that they blanket precondition all cancers because my dog had a benign mass on her. Biopsy and cytology had revealed nothing. After months of back and forth where they “didn’t have records” which they did, it finally came down to the fact that the biopsy done was insufficient to remove the precondition. Mind you they preconditioned all cancers for ever. Months after I’d been paying. There’s nothing I can provide - not even an affidavit from my vet. So if your dog ever had any mass you will never have cancers covers. Think about that as your dog ages as that is a very common affliction for dogs as they age.
title: Severely shady about preconditions

text: Here's when you know if you bought a good policy - when the absolute worst thing happens and the company you bought from becomes your partner, not your adversary.  My Doberman, Jersey Girl, was that dog, you know the one, the one that's just a bit more.  When she collapsed in 2017 with DCM, we didn't know if we had three months or six months left with her.   The Embrace policy we'd bought meant that we didn't have to choose between our dog and what we could afford. We focused on getting her the best care.  Embrace was simple, easy to work with, reliable.  Because I could focus on Jersey Girl, we got the care that let her live until 2020.  That was three more years of her working at the hospital, visiting nursing homes, and doing what she loved. That was three more years of love.  What's the price for that?   BEST. POLICY. EVER.  Thank you Embrace. What you do?  Matters.
title: I'll buy this product all day, every day, ten times on Sunday.

text: It was easy to submit a claim and get reimbursed.  They also have the option of high coverage limits.
title: It was easy to submit a claim and get…

text: When I signed up with Embrace, I requested a review of my cat's veterinary record for the preceding twelve months.  During that time my cat had had a cracked tooth extracted, and this was duly noted as a pre-existing condition.  This was fair, but what I did not expect was that the anorexia (loss of appetite) that accompanied the fractured tooth (and resolved after the extraction) would itself be labelled as a pre-existing condition.  This meant (and this was confirmed by the adjuster) that if my cat subsequently developed a disease that had loss of appetite as a symptom (such as cancer, or many, many other diseases) treatment for that disease would not be covered.  Very, very slippery!
title: Watch out!

text: At the time of application, the company reviewed vet notes for previous 12 months. Those notes reflected one instance of vomiting and two instances of abnormal lab results. The only definitive diagnosis of a specific illness was a possible urinary tract infection. The company implicitly advised it would not cover any future illness that occurred within 12 months of the above findings if any of those findings reappeared in the future, unless it was proven the finding was unrelated to the new illness. It appeared to me that if my pet vomited again within 12 months and if that turned out to be a symptom of any illness whatsoever, there would be no coverage. My conclusion was that the company would be providing accident insurance only -- no illness coverage. A rather unique definition of "preexisting condition!"
title: Unique definition of preexisting condition

text: This company is a sham, don't waste your money with them. They take your premiums and then when it is time to pay your claim they come up with the excuse it is a pre existing condition. I requested them to get my dogs medical records to let me know if there were any pre existing conditions. They said it would take 20 business days to get, I waited over 30 business days and heard nothing, so scheduled my dogs surgery to remove a lump to see if it was cancer. Then after submitting the claim they sent it based on pre existing conditions. They couldn't tell me beforehand, which tells me it wasn't a pre existing condition, but because it could allow them to deny it after the claim they used it to do so. This company is a scam and stay far away.
title: This company is a sham

text:
Without belaboring the details, I bought the insurance and submitted a claim about two weeks later. The claim wasn't process for THREE MONTHS; therefore, I missed the 30 day cancellation window. Then the company determines, based on my pet's records, that she showed symptoms of a disease that was later diagnosed. This, FWIW, a GEICO company. I've filed a complaint with my state insurance regulator.

Follow up: the company continues to insist that it received no claims within the thirty day period; yet, I have proof of submission. If they failed to process the claim within the 30 days, that only further proves their intent to not honor the 30 day money-back guarantee.
title: Don't believe the 30 day money-back guarantee

text:
Stay away from this company, they look for any possible loophole to NOT pay your claim. My dog developed a mass on her side and had it removed a few years ago. At the time, the vet told me that if it grew back immediately, then it would indicate that it was cancerous. 2 years later, the tumor did end up coming back. By this point, I had already purchased pet insurance. I took her into emergency because she was having a bad bout of vomiting, diarrhea and lethargy. The vets said she was very dehydrated and after some testing, there was some pancreatic issues. I submitted the claim for the $1,400 it was to take her in, and that claim was denied, as Embrace claimed that it was a pre-existing condition. I had to take my dog in back maybe 6-8 months ago because she had eaten a palm tree seed and was poisoning her. This current issue was an issue with her pancreas. That's NOT a pre-existing condition. If they are going to make the argument that Vomting, diarrhea and lethargy are "a pre-existing case", then there's literally no reason to have insurance with them since literally EVERYTHING that affects dogs gives them SYMPTOMS like vomiting, diarrhea, and lethargy. Worms, cancer, poisioning....etc all give dogs the same symptoms. Just because they have the same symptoms, does not mean they have the same underlying condition, and it's criminal that this company thinks that's the case. 

During my dog's visit to the vet, they wanted to test the mass on the side of her body for cancer, and they determined that she did have a soft tissue sarcoma. Never been diagnosed before, hasn't been a pre-existing condition. Because that test came back as positive, I had to get her a CT scan to see if it was centralized to the tumor or if it had already spread. This hasn't been a condition of hers at this point, and cancer is a new diagnosis. So I'm feeling pretty good that the CT scan will be covered, but again, Embrace denied that claim. 

Then during the CT scan, the vet found a second tumor that was a mass cell tumor and is a completely different type of cancer. One that has never been on the body before, never diagnosed, never previously removed, brand new. NOT A PRE-EXISTING CONDITION, and yet, Embrace STILL declined the claim for chemo medication that would fight the new type of cancer, saying that it IS considered a pre-existing condition because they can't prove the cancer before didn't cause the new cancer. 

WORST. INSURANCE. COMPANY. EVER. STAY AWAY.
title: Stay away from this company

text:
We adopted a puppy, about 2 months old, who was found starving and dehydrated in a shopping center parking lot in Mexico. We were in Mexico for about a month with the dog and made several trips to the Mexican Vet. The dog had some skin and hair problems from over -exposure in the Sonoran desert and had some parasites. The Vet dewormed him, gave him his shots, documented  an International Vaccine card for him,  and wrote a letter to ICE, saying the dog was in generally good health by the time we left Mexico to return to the USA.  Shortly after our return to the states, we took him to a local vet who continued with some skin medication and started Giardia treatment. A stool sample after treatment indicated the Giardia was gone. We remarked to the Vet that he was still having loose bowels and the Vet suggested changing his food and/or trying a probiotic if it didn't clear. (As we are not allowed to bring dog across the border from Mexico,we bought a small bag of generic puppy food at a grocery store just after returning into the USA).We changed that food and the loose bowels resolved very quickly and he never required probiotics. As he never had loose bowels before returning to the states, it is most likely it was the generic food giving him some loose bowels.  Today he is a healthy happy pup and doing well. However, we realized after submitting the Mexican and USA medical records to Embrace there are enough "pre existing conditions" to make the policy worthless for us.
Following preexisting conditions were excluded for a full year
    Diarrhea and any related/underlying condition.
   Giardia
   Any and all dermatological or ear infections or parasitic conditions.

Comment sense tells me, after several conversations with Embrace, and reading the comments of other clients regarding non-payment of claims due to "pre-existing conditions", and being told we could hire an attorney to start an arbitration if we wanted, it is clear that nothing would ever be paid under this policy as any accident or illness would always be traced back to some preexisting condition. 
I understand that all insurance denies pre-existing conditions. However, a year is excessive in my opinion. And the year is not a maximum, but a minimum exclusion!
Also reading others comments about the large annual increases in premiums, I ran our $469  policy out for 10 years at a conservative 20% annual increase in premium. It totalled more than 12,000 dollars! 
So if you have a puppy  with no pre existing conditions from a breeder, maybe this cover is OK. But it certainly isn't worthwhile for a rescue dog, in my opinion. We have cancelled our policy and will self insure.
title: Certainly not good insurance for rescued dogs.

text: Embrace made me carve 1 hospitalization into 2 claims (every user is forced by Embrace's platform to do it that way). Embrace therefore could claim I had a 2 claim history instead of 1 (more claims equals an excuse to raise your premium). Embrace has yet to issue payment for either claim or even respond to my question for a status. Embrace in the meantime raised my premium. My claim was a no-brainer that should have been promptly paid.

She looked threw my social medias pages and said I was lying.  I dropped this horrible insurance and don't recommend it to anyone!! Horrible money hungry selfish people!!  Trupanion is the way to go!

text: Beware of 30% increases in premiums every single year. They’ve insured my dog since he was fresh from the litter at less than a year, he’s now 3. Let’s put it this way, year 1 premium was $454. My third year is now $767 annual premium with NO changes to my plan and NO claims filed.  Expect huge rate increases or you’ll feel the same gut punch I did. My healthy 3 year old puppy doesn’t justify such a high premium, especially not 30% every, single, year. By next year a 30% price hike will put his premium around $1000. Craziest price gouging I’ve ever seen.
title: Beware of 30% increases in premiums…

text: I originally signed up for Embrace because it was the best coverage for the price available. I've been disappointed since then - it is a real struggle to get in contact with Embrace: I often have to send them 2 or 3 or even 4 messages before I get a response (although I will say, when I do hear back, they are very polite and try their best to be informative!) My biggest issue is that claims I have submitted for my dog a month ago still have not gone through, because Embrace states they don't have a record of my dog's full medical history; however, I have sent them a record of every vet visit my dog has had in her whole life (she's only a year old!). Additionally, the premium increased by 20% ($10 more PER MONTH!) when it was time for me to renew. Lastly, I once submitted a medical history review for my older cat to make sure she didn't have anything that Embrace would consider "pre-existing conditions" - despite multiple follow ups on my part, Embrace never completed this review. I hope they will improve their service and their prices will not continue to increase at such an outrageous rate, or else I will have to go elsewhere!
title: Great in theory, only okay in practice.

text:
In my search for pet insurance, I always read the reviews. The consensus that I see here is the pre-existing conditions excuse. Manager Darcy even went as far as to call diarrhea in one dog's case a link to a pre-existing condition... even stating that if the dog had gone 12 months without diarrhea, they would expire the pre-existing condition excuse and only then cover the cost to cure it. lol. Amazing. Stale water can give a pup diarrhea. 

Sorry, but if that's your reasoning behind not paying a claim as menial as diarrhea, I'll assume I'd drop this company before the wait time is over. You've lost a potential 6 dog-loving customer.

Pets Best, it is, I guess.
title: In my search for pet insurance

text:
I have requested and submitted a letter from my veterinarian.  Taft suffered an episode in November which was diagnosed as gastritis  but it was found when he was neutered that he had suffered significant spermatic cord torsion.  I was willing to use my wellness benefits to cover the removal of the one testicle that had dropped but I feel the removal of the cryptorchidism was not an elective process it was a necessity.  Is it Embraces position that we should have left the testicle which was so badly wound around itself  behind the kidneys the Dr Proctor had to “tease”  (like  working a knot out of a string) it to fully remove it?  The testicle was then sent for testing to insure she had removed the entire testicle.  If it had been left we could have been facing far worse health risks for Taft.  I am thankful I have a Vet with the professionalism and skill to diligently perform this procedure.  Embrace should cover the cost of this part of the procedure because ultimately it saved them some major costly claims in the future.  The part I have a hard time with is the erroneous claim that you cover pre-existing conditions not to mention the pain that Taft would have suffered in the future if this was not addressed as a necessary procedure.  
I totally had a very poor experience with Embrace.  They come across as all dedicated to your pet but are a typical insurance company and will whip out the pre existing card although they advertise that they don’t. It is all about the $$$ with Embrace.
title: Do not fall for their advertising,  “Embrace distinguishes between curable and incurable preexisting conditions and covers curable conditions if pets remain symptom and treatment free for 12 consecuti

text: We've had embrace for two of our dogs now. I will say the customer service has gone downhill. text:
I want to thank each and everyone of you at Embrace Pet Insurance. I have had my dog and 2 cats insured through Embrace for several years and up until recently, I have been lucky to not have to submit a claim. 

Unfortunately, my kitty, Smokey, began losing weight. He was very sick and I was taking him to the Vet and after much testing, they found he had Triaditis and Cancer of the Intestines. Needless to say, it was expensive and had it not been for Embrace, I could not have given my kitty extra time and comfort before I had to send him to the Rainbow Bridge. Embrace made it so easy to submit claim forms for each Vet visit, each test, all the medication poor Smokey was on. They processed the claims efficiently and quickly. They approved everything that was covered under the policy I chose and the checks were in my hands so I could continue to try to help my kitty. Smokey was the sweetest, kindest cat I have ever known. I miss him so much. 

After I let Embrace know that Smokey had past, I received a beautiful sympathy card from them. The employees wrote individual messages to me and I can't tell you how wonderful that made me feel. They cared and they treated me with the upmost respect during this horrible time. I cannot encourage you enough to get Embrace Pet Insurance for you beloved fur kids. This is an A+ company and compassionate too.
title: EMBRACE PET INSURANCE IS WONDERFUL

text:
I called Nationwide (because I heard of their great reputation) well the customer service representative was clearly annoyed by my questions.  I felt as if he were rushing me off the phone.  When I called him on it and stated "if he doesn't like his job, he should not be in customer service" his tune changed.  Too late.  Most importantly the cost for the same benefits/policy were double. 

Had Pet Embrace for about 4 years.  This is my first claim. So far I am very happy with their customer service. My deductible has been reduced by $200 due to no claims since policy was effective. The app is awesome and I receive claim status e-mails.  So far, the experience has been great.

Updates once claims are processed.
title: I called Nationwide (because I heard of…

text:
Just received my denial of claims for my dog, who had a tooth pulled and some fatty lumps removed. They denied the $697 claim, which would have amounted to them paying less than $300. And of course the overused "previous condition" excuse was used. A bad tooth is not a preexisting condition just because he had one pulled a couple of years ago. Ditto for fatty lumps. I have had three pet insurances over the past decade, and only one, PetPlan,actually paid a claim. But they were sold several years ago and their rates about tripled. I was hoping Embrace would be better, but alas they too deny deny deny. This is the last time I am going to spring for pet insurance. I will be opening a special savings account and sticking the $70 per month I was paying Embrace into that account. At least it will have some money in there when I need it!
Update:
OK, so you see embrace’s response. My point is, that as long as you take your pet to a veterinarian whenever care is needed, as in my case when my dog needed a tooth pulled, a blister on his eye taken off, fatty lumps that were interfering with his daily movements, etc., you will have established pre-existing conditions. The longer you have your pet, the less likely insurance is going to cover anything. In my case, they went back two years, found the other surgery, and denied the claim. They wrongly assumed that Pet plan, my previous insurance, use the pre-existing excuse. They didn’t. They actually paid the claim, but not until I was charged two separate $500 deductible‘s. Even though the surgery was done on the same day, they said the dental and lumps were two different problems, so each was its own incident. So rather than pay around $700, I got about 150. When I called Pet plan to complain, the woman actually was sympathetic, Saying she understood my point about who in their right mind would put a dog under twice for two separate incidences when it could all be handled at one time, the policy was the policy. In any event, before you buy any pet insurance, take into account that they are going to find some reason to deny your claim. That has been my experience, and that is a fact.
title: The preexisting conditions excuse strikes again

text: I strongly recommend choosing Embrace pet insurance as a referral from USAA. We found it very easy to use Embrace for claims at a time when our 8 year old golden doodle was very sick. All my questions were answered on the phone or through the app by email with courtesy and professionalism. I am glad I chose the $300 deductible and 90% reimbursement. The security of knowing we could get specialized veterinary care was worth the cost of insurance. I found the Embrace app easy to use and their confirmation emails about receiving and processing my claims were timely.  There was no hassle about covering the claims. Our vet helped us a little with filing the claims but the paperwork was simple. Finally, the genuine tenderness of the correspondence from Embrace staff was a true blessing. Thank you to all the Embracers.
title: Highly recommended! Embrace cares.

Marianne, Muggsie's Mom

text: Embrace is great! Quick communication, easy to use website, and very fast claim processing. I couldn’t believe how fast my claims have been approved and I’ve had a check in my hand! In addition, they are just a kind company. When I emailed them to take my cat off the policy because he had passed away, I got a sympathetic email AND a real sympathy card in the mail. I highly recommend to anyone with pets!! Having paid thousands for uninsured cats, getting insurance is a no brainer and Embrace is the best company to go with.

text: I knew when I was getting my Labrador Retriever, Archie, that I was going to get pet insurance. After much research I finally decided to use Embrace and I haven’t been disappointed Archie will be 3 in September 2019 and he has been insured as soon as he could get a policy. For Archie’s first year I had the insurance and the wellness plan. I knew for the first year there are so many vet visits, vaccines and such so the wellness plan made sense. After he turned 1 I only kept the insurance and stopped the wellness. When I have expenses the process is quick and easy especially with direct deposit. People ask how much his policy is and they are surprised on how little I pay. Very happy with Embrace!

text: I've had Embrace insurance for my dog for 5 years now. They have been great. However, they recently doubled my monthly insurance payment. When I called the representative, she stated that it does not have anything to do specifically with my dog but that they decided to raise all rates across New York State and that I can expect my rates to double every year going forward. This is outrageous. For 5 years my rate has not changed and out of nowhere they are going to start doubling it every year?! I could understand a few dollars here or there each year but doubling? If what this representative said is true, I will find a different pet insurance company going forward.  We shall see.

text: Member for 12 years with no complaints. Claims quickly assessed and payment issued. Always able to speak with an Embracer  if needed. The only problem I have had was getting response to emails, but again there is always a real person available. If your furry person needs a special diet Embrace pays for it . My cat has many allergies, Embrace paid for 80% of the expense for skin testing which was $2,000 and all his medicines were paid for under the Wellness plan which is less than $19 a month. Yearly exams are covered in full if you have Wellness and any bloodwork  is covered in full. My cat is a senior now and senior blood tests are $300to $400 and are covered by Wellness. This company offers dental with anesthesia and accident coverage as well as joint surgery.   The initial waiting period when you sign up is 10 days. Can't say enough positive things about this company. They will pay your Vet directly which makes it easier all around.  I never have to concern myself that I can't provide the care my cat needs, Embrace is there at a reasonable price.

text: Honestly I loved Embrace at first. Prices were great and they had good customer service. Then this past year they hiked our monthly premium an extra $30/mo which is an insane amount to jump. They said it was because I lived in a big city and that’s why my price jumped which isn’t fair because who is to judge how much or how little I make? I’m not a millionaire and it’s not fair to hike the prices because I live in a big city. The money savings account for extra expenses is also a joke. I put money into the account each month to have it there in case I need it. What I didn’t know is that the money expires by the end of the year and my money goes away if unused and I don’t get any of it back. I’m not happy with embrace anymore and I might go and see if I can find insurance elsewhere.
title: Honestly I loved Embrace at first....

text: This is the biggest rip-off insurance EVER!  Had I known only 5 years ago, when we first signed up for our SAME two HEALTHY dogs at a total annual cost of $685.01, that in just 5 yrs, the annual premium would jump to $2203.16!!!!!, I would have NEVER signed up for this insurance!  That's a jump of  MORE than 225%!!!  Holy crap!  We've only had to claim tiny things that only logged against our deductible, so we have never even had a payout, so for our rates to climb more than 30% almost every year is INSANE!!  I'd be better off just saving this money toward any healthcare for our dogs!  The ONLY reason we haven't canceled is because of Murphy's Law and feeling like the second we do, something big would happen.  But I guarantee we will NEVER purchase insurance through here for any future pets EVER AGAIN!  Total and complete rip-off!  How do you all live with yourselves charging this much after baiting people in with basically reasonable fees and then more than TRIPLING the fees in just 5 years time when the pets on said policy have remained very healthy the entire time?!  You're a bunch of CROOKS who take advantage of people who are just trying to do right by their pets!  SHAME ON YOU!!
title: This is the biggest rip-off insurance…

text:
I purchased an Embrace insurance policy for my dog (a 25 lb terrier) 3 months before she turned 5. I had hesitated about pet insurance because my dad was a veterinarian so I didn’t pay for pet  healthcare at first, and then when I left my home state I just couldn’t make sense of the various policy choices. My new veterinarian at the time recommended Embrace and I am so thankful she did. 

My dog developed a rare tumor in her leg in 2016 that required specialist surgery and 18 rounds of radiation and a lot of follow-up care. This year, my dog tore the cruciate ligament in one of her legs. Thanks to my Embrace policy, I was reimbursed 80% of my 2016 $7,500 costs and my 2019 $3,000 costs. Without Embrace, I would have had to have made some very difficult financial decisions. Thanks to Embrace, I celebrated my dog’s birthday with a theme this year of “8 years with all four legs!”
title: So grateful for Embrace!

text: My dogs have had Embrace Pet Insurance for almost five years. Embrace has great coverage, exemplary customer support and affordable prices. I highly recommend them!

text: Embrace insurance equals peace of mind that $$ won’t be a factor on whether your pet lives or dies. The folks at embrace care about your pet and that translates to they care about me, when I call one of first questions a rep asks me is how is Georgia my pets name and then go over any questions I may have about a claim or coverage question. When I had question about coverage when Georgia was a puppy the CEO at the time got on the phone with me and walked me through the health certification form they asked me to submit through my pets vet so that coverage would be clear going forward. I have not been disappointed once in 7 years of coverage. The folks at embrace are committed to making Georgia’s health needs an emotional decision not a financial one.
title: Embrace insurance equals peace of mind…

text: Our Siberian Husky, Kona, has been insured by Embrace since he was eight weeks old in 2013 when we got him. Prior to getting Kona  I spent  a full day researching and calling, in my opinion, the top 5 pet insurance companies and Embrace came out on top because I like that they have an ANNUAL deductible whereas the others had a per incident deductible, and if you need to take your pet to an emergency hospital as soon as you walk in the door you pay anywhere from $125.00 to $150.00 which Embrace covers along with the treatment your pet receives which the others do not.  And, finally, since Kona has quite a few allergies to food and outside influences and that caused and, sometimes, still does ear infections and impacted anal glands we have been to our Veterinarian quite a few times and after I submit the claim within 5 days or sometimes sooner I receive the Explanation Of Benefits of what will be paid and then within a week the money is deposited directly into our bank account. My husband and I both are constantly recommending Embrace to other pet parents.
title: Embrace - Best Pet Insurance

text:
Filed a claim, which was accepted, but was sent to us along with a list of items that would not be covered in the future due to preexisting conditions. Our dog is 3 years old and healthy, but had a clump of fur which our vet apparently called a “lump” on his elbow. It came out with after grooming, but when we got our claim we were told our dog would not be covered for any cancer treatments. Makes sense given the description the vet wrote. 
The frustrating part is we received this information from a Do Not Reply Email, with no contact information for support from embrace. To appeal this our vet needs to reach out to embrace, it’s unclear who they need to reach out to, and there was no option for us to contact embrace ourselves. We are working with our vet to update them, but not by any means an ideal experience for making this clarification.
title: difficulty updating our dogs medical history

My fear is as my dog gets older and will need the medical insurance, the premiums will be more than I can afford.

text: My husband and I have insured our 2 dogs with Embrace for 5 years. Their customer service is above and beyond awesome. We needed to use the insurance the first year for our younger dog who came from Cleveland with heart worm. Embrace didn't hesitate to pay the bills. (we have the $500 deductible 80% payment) Recently, our older dog (14+years) developed heart issues (too much protein in the non-grain foods!!! Choose grain foods unless your dog has allergies! Latest warning from dog health websites.) For 5 months, he needed heart, lung or abdominal draining. Again Embrace was spectacular in helping us with bill payments. Yes, you pay as you go along, but when you need it, the insurance is there.  We just added the puppy (3.5 months) on our policy. I can only say they are awesome!

The second one applied towards my deductible right away. My policy renews next month, so we'll see what happens this next year if I have a claim that would exceed my deductible. The rates seem High when you don't have any medical problems over the year to claim but when major things happen such a surgeries are cancer, then the rates don't seem unreasonable at all.

text: My experience with Embrace has been absolutely great! They have gone above and beyond in providing aid to me and my pets. I highly recommend them as a provider for your pet's insurance needs
title: Above and Beyond

text: Normally vets require payment upfront before anything is done. This was the case when my 2 year old female cat swallowed a sewing needle and needed surgery. I panicked, knowing there was no way I could afford their estimate, especially when time was of the essence.  However, once I explained to them that we had Embrace, and was able to get a prior authorization for services, they were able to waive this policy and perform the much needed operations to try and save my kitty. Embrace fully understood the situation and spoke directly to their financial department, assuring them of our coverage and providing them with the estimated reimbursement that would be issued directly to them. The vet was then okay with me making a payment then and there and working on a payment plan for the rest. Although my precious girl did not survive due to complications, Embrace was there through the whole process, working with me and the vet clinic, orchestrating the payment and claims processing. It was a difficult time for our family, but I can't even begin to express how much Embrace relieved the stress of the financial situation and allowed us to focus on our efforts to save our kitty, and then through our grieving process as well. You never know what will happen to your furry family members. The simplest thing could send them into a fight for their lives. Having some sense of peace when it comes to finances is ultimately priceless. Embrace your pets today. Whether it's a simple vet visit or a middle of the night emergency, you'll be able to focus solely on them and their care, knowing your pets are Embraced.
title: Emergency surgery can't be performed before paid in full? Not the case for this Embraced!

text: I give 5 stars to how easy it is to submit claims with Embrace! It’s fabulous. However, I give a hard fail to their rates. We’re in our 5th year with embrace and our rates have gone up 175%, 30ish% in the last year alone. There is no cap. They claim that it is not based on your claims filed, but we’ve only filed in the last 2 years, and are rates have doubled. DOUBLED. When I call to complain, they claim it’s because of costs, but I don’t buy it. It’s impossible to leave, because at this point, previous claims can be considered pre existing to other companies. We’ll be priced out of being able to afford embrace in the near future.
title: easy claims, terrible rates.

text: Embrace has consistently come through for me and my pup over the last 4 years. Most notably, they've been with us through two major knee surgeries-- saving me the heartache of having to make a tough decision based on my ability to afford those surgeries. Their Wellness plans have also proven to be well worth the value-- all of my dog's regular supplements, dental chews, flea/tick treatment, annual vaccines, & regular blood work have been covered with the Wellness plan, saving me a bit of money each year. Insuring my dog with Embrace has been one of the best decisions I made after getting her as a puppy.
title: Consistent, great value!

text: Embrace Pet Insurance has been wonderful. The customer service is amazing, and the coverage is great! The dental exams were rather expensive for my vet, but I was fully reimbursed by Embrace. The wait period for reimbursement wasn't long at all. I have been completely satisfied with Embrace.

text:
Embrace was great and easy to work with. Their claims handling was fair, upfront, and quick. 
I do wish that the claim filing process was more streamlined - as it stands right now, you have to have the vets office file claims. My vet office forgot a couple times. It would be easier and more efficient for me if I could send the paperwork myself.
title: Two thumbs up

text: I've had to use my Embrace pet insurance several times for my older dog Benny. Each time, I was reimbursed promptly with no questions asked. It's a huge comfort knowing that I have coverage for my dear dogs. Several months ago, Benny lost the use of his back legs. I was in a panic. The emergency vet hospital diagnosed disc compression, and said that surgery may be needed. I was able to get pre-authorized with Embrace prior to any surgery, which absolutely amazed me. The vet specialist estimated the high and low cost of the procedure, and Embrace approved me for the higher amount. Thank God we didn't need the surgery after all. We chose a conservative treatment approach, and it worked. Benny is back on his feet. I'm just so grateful I have Embrace to lean on in times like this.
title: Wonderful company

text: Wellness claims take FAR FAR too long to be processed. 10-15 business days is absurd and one of the longest I have ever experienced with pet insurance. For this reason, I won’t be renewing past my one year.
